Program.FullCard.Name: "Acid Hands" McGillicutty
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Acid Hands is destroyed, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fight for glory, fight for prestige; as long as you pay, we can fill your need!"
Program.FullCard.Name: "Backstab" Bindo Gearbomb
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Exhaust target card. If you exhausted an Arena card this way, it can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What's the matter? Can't think straight?"
Program.FullCard.Name: "Batter Brains" McGillicutty
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Batter Brains is destroyed, target player discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Hey, stick around. I've got plans for you."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Black Ice" Fizzlefreeze
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Black Ice Black Ice deals 1 frost damage to target hero or ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You shouldn't try so hard. It's just going to hurt more."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Bladehands" Spigotgulp
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Escape Artist (When this ally becomes targeted by an opposing card or effect, you may put it into its owner's hand.)
If you would draw a card, you may skip drawing it instead.
When you skip drawing a card this way, turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We will lose everything unless we fight together!"
Program.FullCard.Name: "Bonewall" Simms
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Bonewall Target hero or ally is a protector this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Nowhere in the Firelord's lair is safe from the flames.
Program.FullCard.Name: "BY FIRE BE PURGED"
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose two: Destroy all opposing abilities; destroy all opposing allies; or destroy all opposing equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "In Azeroth, there's only one absolute: everything freezes."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Chillhands" Spigotgulp
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you would draw a card, you may skip drawing it instead.
When you skip drawing a card this way, target ally can't attack this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Skipping is optional. If you can't draw cards, you can't choose to skip. You can't look at a card before deciding whether to skip drawing it. If you skip drawing two cards, this power triggers twice, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I never let a little thing like armor slow me down."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Chipper" Ironbane
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Destroy "Chipper" Ironbane Destroy target ability or equipment with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Name: "Cookie" McWeaksauce
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Cookie enters play, each opponent puts a Chicken ally token with 0 ATK / 1 health into play.
Destroy all ally tokens.

Program.FullCard.Name: "Cracklehands" Spigotgulp
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you would draw a card, you may skip drawing it instead.
When you skip drawing a card this way, Cracklehands deals 2 arcane damage to target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Skipping is optional. If you can't draw cards, you can't choose to skip. You can't look at a card before deciding whether to skip drawing it. If you skip drawing two cards, this power triggers twice, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A sharp sword is worth its weight in gold."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Deathgrip" Jones
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Your weapons can't be targeted by opponents.

Program.FullCard.Name: "DIE, INSECT!"
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When an opposing ally is destroyed, draw a card.
When an opposing hero is destroyed, draw a card for each rune you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Keep your eyes on the prize!"
Program.FullCard.Name: "Eyeball" Jones
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Eyeball deals combat damage to a hero or ally, exhaust that character, and it can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Death hasn't robbed the Forsaken of the ability to understand what you say. They're just not likely to listen.
Program.FullCard.Name: "Fungus Face" McGillicutty
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Fungus Face is destroyed, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Is your sack 'Gigantique'?!" - Haris Pilton
Program.FullCard.Name: "Gigantique" Bag
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You have no maximum hand size.
, Pay 1 for each card in your hand Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: How do you kill that which has no life?
Program.FullCard.Name: "He Who Has No Life"
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally with cost 5 or less enters play, destroy it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Lowdown" means more than just height.
Program.FullCard.Name: "Lowdown" Luppo Shadefizzle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Gnome Hero Required
Elusive, Stealth, Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "BOLDLY, YOU SOUGHT THE POWER OF RAGNAROS. NOW YOU SHALL SEE IT FIRSTHAND!"
Program.FullCard.Name: "NOW FOR YOU, INSECTS!"
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target ability, ally, or equipment card.

Program.FullCard.Name: "Poison Tongue" McGillicutty
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Poison Tongue is destroyed, you may destroy target resource.

Program.FullCard.Name: "Quickhands" Spigotgulp
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
If you would draw a card, you may skip drawing it instead.
When you skip drawing a card this way, opposing allies have -1 ATK / -1 health this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Skipping is optional. If you can't draw cards, you can't choose to skip. You can't look at a card before deciding whether to skip drawing it. If you skip drawing two cards, this power triggers twice, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That's for my brother!"
Program.FullCard.Name: "Scrapper" Ironbane
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: "Spider Legs" McGillicutty
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Spider Legs is destroyed, you may exhaust target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This fight is over."
Program.FullCard.Name: "The Painsaw"
Program.FullCard.Rules: When The Painsaw enters play, you may destroy target ready weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've never had to work this hard before."
Program.FullCard.Name: "Tubs" Klankbopple
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, he may deal 4 melee damage to target ally with cost 4 or less.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Once the prized possession of Pathaleon the Calculator, its odds eventually stacked against him.
Program.FullCard.Name: Abacus of Violent Odds
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When your hero attacks, roll a die.
If it's even, remove your hero from combat.
If it's odd, ready your hero and all of your weapons at the end of this combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: He's a mean one . . .
Program.FullCard.Name: Abominable Greench, The
Program.FullCard.Notes: Exclusive to Feast of Winter Veil Collector's Set
Program.FullCard.Rules: If an opponent would draw a card, you draw one instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Abomination Knuckles
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this equipment enters play, you may destroy target armor or item.

Program.FullCard.Name: Abracadaver
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, you may put a 1 [Melee] / 1 [Health] Cadaver ally token into play with Ferocity and Protector.
At the end of your turn, for each Cadaver you control, destroy it unless you pay 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When they have no tools with which to fight, they will concede to your great might." - Codex of Defense
Program.FullCard.Name: Absolute Poise
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target ability or equipment card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Absorb Magic
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability. If you do, your hero heals damage from itself equal to that ability's cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Abyss Walker's Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A more advanced construct than the infernal, abyssals have rougher and more jagged edges on their shells.
Program.FullCard.Name: Abyssal
Abyssal Reinforcements
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Put an Abyssal ally token with 6 ATK / 6 health into play.
Ongoing: Destroy two Bloods Put an Abyssal ally token with 6 ATK / 6 health into play. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Whenever a warlock starts talking about sharing the wealth, I opt to be a pauper." - Timmo Shadestep
Program.FullCard.Name: Acolyte Demia
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Put 1 damage on Acolyte Demia Demia deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You take the high road. I'll take the eady path to power."
Program.FullCard.Name: Acolyte Kemistra
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Put 2 damage on Kemistra Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: (You are safe here.)
Program.FullCard.Name: A'dal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all damage that would be dealt.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: (You have proven yourself as a being of great power.) - A'dal
Program.FullCard.Name: A'dal's Signet of Defense
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target armor has +3 DEF this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "By the power of Greybeard, I HAVE THE POWER!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Adam Eternum
Program.FullCard.Rules: Pay 2 or remove an honor counter from a card you control Remove Adam from the game. Put him into play at the start of the next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Was that supposed to hurt?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Addisyn the Untouchable
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Addisyn Choose arcane, fire, frost, nature, or shadow. Addisyn has the chosen resistance this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: We must be prepared to ask of ourselves what we demand from others.
Program.FullCard.Name: Adenda Lighthaven
Adept Breton
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Adept Breton deals 1 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let'sget'em! Whatarewewaitingfor? Gogogo!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Adrenaline Rush
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Combat Hero Required
Ready all of your resources. Draw cards until you reach your maximum hand size. At end of turn, discard your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Adrienne the Inspiring
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4 Target ally has Assault 4 this turn. (It has +4 ATK on your turn.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Adyen the Lightwarden
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
Cards can't leave opposing graveyards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Its power mirrors your despair.
Program.FullCard.Name: Aegis of the Blood God
Program.FullCard.Rules: Aegis of the Blood God has +1 DEF for each damage on your hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aegis of the Vindicator
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing hero or ally becomes exhausted, your hero heals 2 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The deadliest assassins hide in plain sight.
Program.FullCard.Name: Aesadonna Al'mere
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth
When Aesadonna attacks, destroy target exhausted ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aftermath
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destruction Hero Required
Ongoing: When you play an ability, you may exhaust target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You're one step closer to gaining my full trust." - Altruis the Sufferer
Program.FullCard.Name: Against the Illidari
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you control an ability, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You've proven you're not tainted by the Legion's touch, and the enemy of my enemy is my friend." - Altruis the Sufferer
Program.FullCard.Name: Against the Legion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an opponent has more resources than you, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aggressive Exploitation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 4 melee damage to target exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Get in there and do as much damage as you can. That's what you're good at, right?" - Garrosh Hellscream
Program.FullCard.Name: Aggressive Infiltration
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 melee damage to each exhausted opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I may no longer feel any connection to the Light, but I retain my commitment to my people."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ahkara
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Ahkara enters play, put a Ghoul ally token into play with 3 [Melee] ATK / 3 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aileen the Thunderblessed
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Exhaust a [Nature] card you control This ally deals nature damage to target hero or ally equal to that [Nature] card's ATK.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aim of Eagles, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 ranged damage to target hero or ally. Ready one of your resources for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One shot. One kill.
Program.FullCard.Name: Aimed Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Marksmanship Hero Required
Your hero deals X ranged damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When the time is right, the Betrayer will become...the betrayed."
Program.FullCard.Name: Akama
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Loyal Hero Required
Protector, Stealth
Other allies in your party are untargetable.
Traitor cards can't be played.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take this as my promise to you that when the time comes and you face Illidan, I will be on your side."
Program.FullCard.Name: Akama's Promise
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Loyal Hero Required (Can't put this into your deck if your hero is a Traitor.)
Pay 1 for each card in your hand to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Akama's Sash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Loyal Hero Required
If your hero would deal damage with an ability, it deals that much unpreventable damage +1 instead.
When an ally is destroyed by fatal damage dealt with an ability you control, remove that ally from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: With her loyal protector, Fido, Akiko is a deadly ray of sunshine.
Program.FullCard.Name: Akiko the Alert
Program.FullCard.Rules: [Hunter] Pets you control have +2 / +2.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stand aside, puny human!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Aknot Whetstone
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Hardiness (If this ally would be dealt damage, prevent 1 of it.)2, Destroy another ally in your party Destroy target weapon.

Program.FullCard.Name: Alador Stonebrew
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Nature will not harm me. I am its defender."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alamira Grovetender
Program.FullCard.Rules: Nature Resistance (Prevent all nature [Nature] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: CAT DURID IS 4 FITE!
Program.FullCard.Name: ALAMO
Program.FullCard.Rules:
OK, LISSEN, UDDER FRENDLY DURIDS HAF +1 FITE / +1 HEELTH.
(Alamo is a Druid. Other friendly Druids have +1 ATK / +1 health.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "As you can see, my work speaks for itself; my patrons are still alive to talk."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alard Schmied
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has +X [Health], where X is the combined [Armor] of Plate armor you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Araj can always recruit reinforcements from the grave.
Program.FullCard.Name: Alas, Andorhal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Remove up to three target cards in one graveyard from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I assume by your interruption that you wish to be numbered among those I am considering for apprenticeship."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alchemist Finklestein
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
1, Discard a Unique card > Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Alchemist Norrin'thal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
0 Norrin'thal becomes an Arcane ally this turn. Use only once per turn.
0 Norrin'thal becomes a Fire ally this turn. Use only once per turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Alchemist's Stone
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Servants of the Betrayer) - requires 5 Primal Water, 5 Primal Fire, 5 Primal Earth, 5 Primal Mana, 5 Primal Air, 2 Fel Lotus, 1 Earthstorm Diamond, 1 Skyfire Diamond
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Alchemy Hero Required
Reveal the top card of your deck. You may discard a card with a different type. If you do, put that revealed card into hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Come on. I'll even let you take the first shot."
Program.FullCard.Name: Aldana
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your weapons have +2 ATK while your hero is defending.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aldori Legacy Defender
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target hero or ally has -2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It appears I have arrived with time to spare."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alecia Hall
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Alecia enters play, she heals 3 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bow your head in my presence. I am a noble, after all, and you are a copperless peasant."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alexi Barov
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, put three Peasant ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and ferocity. At the end of the next turn, destroy them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Life is my Aspect, dark one, and I, like all mothers, know both the pain and wonder that entails!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay X less to play Alexstrasza, where X is the combined ATK of allies you control.
Assault 5
Allies you control can't be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mercy? You waste your breath. I bend the Light to my ends. I do not serve it, nor shall I ever do so again."
Program.FullCard.Name: Aleyah Dawnborn
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Aleyah Dawnborn When an ally in your party deals combat damage this turn, Aleyah heals that much damage from herself.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This modifier triggers every time any applicable ally deals combat damage this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Light be with you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Alhas
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, Alhas heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Alister Cooper
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aberration (Prevent all non-combat damage that would be dealt to this ally.)
Ferocity (This ally can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Next stop, Tirisfal Glades!" - Frezza
Program.FullCard.Name: All Aboard for Undercity!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each player puts a [Horde] ally from his graveyard into his hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The scent of their burnt remains will linger in the air, reminding our enemy of their weakness." - Kilix the Unraveler
Program.FullCard.Name: All Things in Good Time
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
Pay 8 or discard an ability, ally, and equipment to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You have much to learn of how the world works."
Program.FullCard.Name: Al'lanora
Program.FullCard.Rules: Shadowmeld (Elusive and untargetable while ready.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Frostwolf clan and the Stormpike Expedition battle for supremacy of this territory.
Program.FullCard.Name: Alterac Valley
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you play a card, add an honor counter.
On your turn: , Remove eight honor counters Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That's right at the top of my list of things I don't want to see before I die." - Pidge Filthfinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Amani Mask of Death
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of each turn, destroy all abilities, allies, and equipment with the same name as another card in play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Amaria Kelsur
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 4 Flip Amaria. BACK: Opposing allies have -1 ATK while in combat with Amaria.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As hard to pin down at the negotiating table as he is on the battlefield, the Ambassador thrives on taking chances.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ambassador Jerrikar
Program.FullCard.Rules: Jerrikar has ferocity if an opponent went first this game.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ambush
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if your hero has stealth.
Your hero deals X melee damage to target exhausted hero or ally, where X is 5 plus the ATK of one of your Daggers.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You can play Ambush whether or not you have a Dagger in play. If you don’t have one, X is 5.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the burden of your existence be ever light." - Elaar
Program.FullCard.Name: Amice of Brilliant Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 1 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who exhibit twice the bravery often need twice the healing.
Program.FullCard.Name: Amplify Magic
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly hero or ally.
Ongoing: If damage would be healed from attached character, that much damage +2 is healed instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm finished with you, chump!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Anarchist Bladewalker
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Finishing Move (To play, remove X Combo cards in your graveyard from the game, where X is 5 or less.)
When this ally enters play, she may deal X melee damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For every light, there is a shadow.
Program.FullCard.Name: Anathema
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When your hero deals shadow damage with an ability to a hero or ally, that character's controller discards a card.
Exhaust your hero Put a card named Benediction from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ancestral Awakening
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Search your deck for an ally with cost less than or equal to the number of resources you control. Put it into play with damage equal to its [Health] -1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ancestral Purge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability that's not attached to a friendly card. If you do, your hero deals 1 nature damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The ancestors have spoken. It is not yet time for you to join them."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ancestral Spirit
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have. That ally enters play with damage on it equal to its health -1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Alonora
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
Inspire: Ally (Ready one of your allies during each other player's ready step.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light will soon triumph over its enemies."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Ceyla
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
When another ally in your party is destroyed, its owner may put it from his graveyard into hand at the start of the next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Allow me to ease your burden."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Fareena
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
0 Attach target attachment to Fareena. Use only once per turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Though I cannot save everyone, I can certainly do my best to try."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Jaliah
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
When an ally in your party is destroyed, Jaliah heals 2 damage from each hero and ally in your party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Jaliah’s destruction triggers her own power.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "As long as our faith remains strong, the man'ari will never prevail."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Kalinna
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Flip Anchorite Kalinna Destroy target ability with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A single unprepared comrade can cost you your life."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Karja
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
Ready allies in your party have +3 ATK / +3 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Kilandra
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
When Kilandra enters play, name a card in play you control.
Inspire: Card with that name (You may ready a card you control with that name during each other player's ready step.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Onkoth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
Inspire: Ability, Ally, Equipment, Hero, or Resource.

Program.FullCard.Name: Anchorite Viluaa
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
Inspire: Hero (Ready your hero during each other player's ready step.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Handed down from ancestor to ancestor, this bow has seen many enemies fall before it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ancient Bone Bow
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with Ancient Bone Bow, your hero has long-range this combat. (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: These great beasts of lava roam the whole of the Molten Core.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ancient Core Hound
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Ancient Core Hound enters play, roll a die.
1-2: Exhaust all opposing allies.
3-4: Ancient Core Hound deals 2 fire damage to each ally in a party of your choice.
5-6: Put an opposing ally into ist owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Some tomes of ancient lore are best left forgotten.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ancient Cornerstone Grimoire
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Put a Skeleton ally token with 1 ATK, 1 health, ferocity, and protector into play. At end of turn, destroy it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This fight bores me. Show some spirit!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Andarius Put an attached ability you control into its owner's hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Attached ability means “ability attached to anything” rather than “ability attached to Andarius.”

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have been waiting for the day the Horde would finally act against the Scourge. I hunger for vengeance and I will not be denied!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Andarius Put an attached ability you control into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Anders Blankheart
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
If damage would be dealt with an ability you control to a hero or ally it’s attached to, that much +1 is dealt instead.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Anders has received errata. The bold text above updates his printed text, and clarifies that it’s the ability. (If damage would be dealt with an ability you control to a hero or ally it’s attached to, that much +1 is dealt instead.) attached to the character, not vice versa.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My advice? Keep your scabbard greased and your blades sharp."
Program.FullCard.Name: Andiss Butcherson
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to strike with weapons.

Program.FullCard.Name: Andrew Ulric
Program.FullCard.Rules: Aberration (Prevent all non-combat damage that would be dealt to this ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Hi there. Have you heard any news of my father?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Anduin Wrynn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Other friendly Humans can protect Andiun.
On your turn: Search your deck for a Human ally card and put it into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Elune may be the Goddess of the Moon, but even the Moon has a dark side."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anduros Silversong
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally can't attack heroes.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Poison the body, and you'll numb the mind." - The Assassin's Creed, Chapter 6
Program.FullCard.Name: Anesthetic Poison
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally that was dealt combat damage by your hero this turn.
Ongoing: When attached character becomes exhausted, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Hi, I'm pretty sure you don't need that. Thanks."
Program.FullCard.Name: Angelista
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth
At the end of your turn, you may put target equipment into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For a warrior, violence is always the answer.
Program.FullCard.Name: Anger Management
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arms Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon to a hero, put the top card of your deck into your resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Crafted to look like the Helm of Domination, worn by the Lich King himself.
Program.FullCard.Name: Angrathar the Wrathgate
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When a card enters an opposing graveyard from anywhere, add a rattle counter.
On your turn: 2, , Remove three rattle counters Put a 3 [Melee] / 3 [Health] Scourge ally token into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't touch what you can't afford."
Program.FullCard.Name: Angrida
Program.FullCard.Rules: Angrida deals 2 shadow damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "So I'll get to beat someone over the head with this? I'm in!" - Parvink
Program.FullCard.Name: Angry Dread
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Death Knight, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this weapon enters play, you may draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Anguar Frostbeard
Program.FullCard.Rules: Frost Resistance (Prevent all frost or [Frost] damage that this ally would be dealt.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Most paladins would gladly live and die as Uther did."
Program.FullCard.Name: Anika Berlyn

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You expend yourself too quickly." - Timmo Shadestep
Program.FullCard.Name: Annihilate
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target exhausted ally or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Annihilator
Program.FullCard.Rules: Combat damage dealt by your hero with Annihilator can't be prevented.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Ragnrok 11/10/2006] Just to clarify, Annihilator states that "combat damage dealt by your Hero with Annihilator can't be prevented". This just means that you cannot use armor or abilities like Divine Shield or Blessing of Protection.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It seems you need another lesson, mortals."
Program.FullCard.Name: Another Lesson
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Onyxia deals combat damage to an ally this turn, ready Onyxia.

Program.FullCard.Name: Antikron the Unyielding
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Put 2 damage on your hero Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Antikron this combat. Use only if he's defending.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I find your so-called mastery of magic to be lacking." - Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Name: Anti-Magic Shell
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Prevent the next non-melee (non-[Melee]) damage that would be dealt to your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Originally created as a holy shield for the Silver Hand, its energies have been twisted by close proximity to the Burning Legion.
Program.FullCard.Name: Antonidas's Aegis of Rapt Concentration
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your ability cards can't be interrupted.
Your abilities are untargetable.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] A link is interrupted if all of its targets have become illegal as it tries to resolve, even if it “can't be interrupted.” Only your abilities in play are untargetable. However, if you play this card in response to a link about to interrupt one of your ability cards, this modifier will stop that link from interrupting that card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Look how easily your strength fails in the presence of the elements."
Program.FullCard.Name: Antyr
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, you may destroy target ability that's not attached to a friendly card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Apocanon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ally cards in all zones are also Demon cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A relic from the eredar home world.
Program.FullCard.Name: Apostle of Argus
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Exhaust your hero Your hero heals 1 damage from target hero or ally, or 4 if an opponent when first this game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This elixir should protect against their spit. Offer it to Ko'char for me, will you?" - Zort
Program.FullCard.Name: Apply This Twice Daily
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.
If a hero or ally you controlled healed damage this turn, draw another card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For some reason Merry never made much of a first impression - or much of any impression at all.
Program.FullCard.Name: Apprentice Merry
Program.FullCard.Rules: Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Name: Apprentice Teep
Program.FullCard.Rules: Elusive (Can't be Attacked)

Program.FullCard.Name: Aquatic Form
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: You may complete quest cards from your graveyard. As you do, remove them from the game as an additional cost.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] All costs (other than turning the quest face down) must still be paid, and any other restrictions on completing it must still be observed. A cost of "destroy this quest" can't be paid from a non-play zone. Corki's Ransom has received errata to clarify that its cost can be paid only from play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Blood Knights of Silvermoon are the backbone of the blood elf army.
Program.FullCard.Name: Araelun

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Controlling vital resource points is the key to victory. Control all five, and you are virtually guaranteed it." - Loraala
Program.FullCard.Name: Arathi Basin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you play a card, add an honor counter.
, Remove five honor counters Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You will find him at the Pools of Aggonar. If not, his evil will most certainly find you." - Force Commander Danath Trollbane
Program.FullCard.Name: Arazzius the Cruel
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Arazzius attacks, each player destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Fire consumes whatever fuel it is given.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arc of Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero deals 4 fire damage to target ally; or your hero deals 2 fire damage to each of two target allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Binding
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: As this ability enters play, choose "ability," "ally," or "equipment."
Attached hero's controller can't play more than one card of the chosen kind per turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Each blast of arcane power strikes its target more quickly than the last.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Blast
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less for each other card named Arcane Blast in your graveyard to play Arcane Blast.
Your hero deals 3 Arcane Damage to target Hero or Ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Brilliance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Each friendly player draws a card.
Ongoing: Each friendly player's maximum hand size is increased by three.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There's plenty for everyone!" - Nicholas Merrick
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Burst
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Essence
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust all resources you control. Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Explosion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally. Draw a card for each character dealt damage this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Focus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arcane Hero Required
Ongoing: Ready one of your resources. Use only if you've played another Arcane or [Arcane] card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Guardian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Protector
Arcane Guardian has +1 ATK / +1 health for each card in your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Knowledge is power.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Intellect
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero, and its controller draws a card.
Ongoing: Attached hero's controller's maximum hand size is increased by three.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo already be losin', mon!" - Gladiator Zi'mo
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Intuition
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Preparation (On your first turn, you may play this card without paying its cost.)
Ongoing: When Arcane Intuition enters play, draw a card. Your maximum hand size is increased by one.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As mage spells go, this one isn't the showiest. Nonetheless, you'll find it quite effective.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Missiles
Program.FullCard.Rules:
X can't be more than 5.
Your hero deals X arcane damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Arcane energy surged through her as she drew deep from her own power.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Power
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arcane Hero Required
Ongoing: When you play an ability, you may pay 1. If you do and your hero would deal damage with that ability this turn, it deals that much damage +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Practice makes perfect.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Research
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to play Arcane Research for each other card named Arcane Research in your graveyard.
Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Knowledge shared is power gained.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Revelation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each friendly player draws a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A hunter's deadly accuracy doesn't just seem like magic; sometimes, it is.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Spikes
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X arcane damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Arcane magic is the quintessential combination of spell power and efficiency.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Tactics
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When you draw a card, your hero may deal 1 arcane damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Deprived of the Sunwell, the sin'dorei have learned new techniques for manipulating arcane magic.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Torrent
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Blood Elf Hero Required
Interrupt all other ability cards. Opponents can't play abilities this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] Opponents can play abilities in response to Arcane Torrent, and they will resolve before it does.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I hope you brought more to this fight that just your wits." - Cerripha Sunstreak
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcane Warding
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally is untargetable.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Alathana
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Ability
When Alathana sabotages an ability, put a depletion counter on it.
Abilities with depletion counters lose and can't have powers.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That which was lost shall remain so."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Atikan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Side Deck
When Atikan sabotages a side deck, cards in it can't leave that side deck this match.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Avelena
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Ability (This ally can attack opposing abilities.)
When Avelena sabotages an ability, put it on top of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Bartis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Player (This ally can attack opposing players.)
When Bartis sabotages a player, that player discards a card or destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Clearly, you are ill-suited to address the mental complexities of this issue. Clearly."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Dayvana
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Quest
When Dayvana sabotages a quest, you may complete it this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Victory is fleeting for you this day, cur."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Lyronia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
When Lyronia enters play, look at the top card of target opponent's deck. You may put it on the bottom.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Feeling a little exposed? That might be my fault."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Raith
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Opponents play with the top card of their decks revealed.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Renaan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor card in your deck.)
If you would draw a card, you may draw it from the bottom of your deck instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take this flare…and deliver it to Commander Hobb."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Thelis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Deck
When Thelis sabotages a deck, switch that deck with yours.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanist Tian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
You may look at the top card of your deck at any time.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The next best thing to an Onyxian Whelp
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanite Dragonling
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1 Arcanite Dragonling is also an ally with 2 [Melee] ATK / 2 health and protector this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] This modifier never overwrites any earlier modifiers that add to or subtract from Arcanite Dragonling’s ATK or health. As this turn ends, any damage is removed from Arcanite Dragonling, and any of its “attach to ally” attachments are destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The arcanite reaper was long the mark of a true warrior in Azeroth. Having one crafted was like a rite of passage.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanite Reaper
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Jeff Donais 8/12/2006] Shamans cannot use 2-H Axes or 2-H Maces without first getting the Enhancement tree talent, just like the online game. [Mike Hummel 8/19/2006] Costs cannot be reduced below zero. So you do not 'gain' a resource by striking with Arcanite Reaper if you control Edgemaster's Handguards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The intricacies of this weapon would make even the most brilliant goblins and gnomes jealous.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanite Steam-Pistol
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with Arcanite Steam-Pistol, youre hero has long-range this combat.
When a hero is dealt damage with Arcanite Steam-Pistol, if its controller went first this game, he destroys one of his resources.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arcanium Signet Bands
Program.FullCard.Rules: If target ally would be dealt damage this turn, it's dealt double that much instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: May Cenarius bless all those who defend Azeroth from the corruption of the Lich King.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arch Druid Lilliandra
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation
Flip Lilliandra, remove a Druid in your graveyard from the game When Lilliandra is dealt combat damage this turn, she deals 1 nature damage to the source of that damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Archbishop Benedictus
Program.FullCard.Rules: Heroes and allies can't attack.

Program.FullCard.Name: Archdruid Hamuul Runetotem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Druids in your party have +1 ATK while attacking.
Druids in your party have protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our plan for success is in motion. Now, let's see what develops."
Program.FullCard.Name: Archduke Franklin Pearce
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Discard a card Put target equipment on the bottom of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The time has come to 'enlighten' the Scourge with the proper use and technique of magic."
Program.FullCard.Name: Archmage Barstow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Barstow, discard a Mage Opposing heroes and allies lose and can't have powers this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When helms are cracked, skulls aren't far behind." - Codex of Defense
Program.FullCard.Name: Arcing Smash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Destroy target opposing equipment and all opposing equipment with the same cost as that equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Lich King isn't the only one who can command the powers of frost. - Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Name: Arctic Blast
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 frost damage to each opposing ally. Allies dealt damage this way have -2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ardent Defender
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protection Hero Required
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to your hero while it has 25 or more damage.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] If your hero has 24 or less damage and is dealt damage, this power doesn’t prevent any of it. Damage is prevented only if your hero already has 25 or more damage, in which case it is prevented completely.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Now, I sent some mail to my friends already, telling them that I have a surprise for them. This is where you come in!" -Umi Rumplesnicker
Program.FullCard.Name: Are We There, Yeti?
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 6 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put three Mechanical Yeti ally tokens with 1 ATK and 1 health into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Much blood have you spilt on the Arena floor, and I be glad to name you Grandmaster of the Arena!" - Short John Mithril
Program.FullCard.Name: Arena Grandmaster
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: If an ally is in your party and the combined ATK of allies in your party is greater than the combined ATK of allies in an opponent's party, draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Arr, me hearty! Now 'tis the time to truly prove your steel." - Short John Mithril
Program.FullCard.Name: Arena Master
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Each player chooses an ally in his party. If you chose the ally with the highest ATK, draw two cards.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] You draw cards only if your ally has the outright highest ATK. (Nothing happens in the event of a tie.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Aresha Thorncaller
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
This ally has Nature Resistance while you control another ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In the face of despair and hatred, we must continue to stand true to our beliefs and fight on.
Program.FullCard.Name: Argent Confessor Paletress
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation
Flip Paletress, remove a Priest in your graveyard from the game The next time target hero or ally would be dealt damage this turn, prevent it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Argent Crusader
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you and target opponent each draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our cause is to fight swiftly and mercilessly against any element of evil that surfaces in Azeroth." - Argent Officer Garush
Program.FullCard.Name: Argent Defender
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Argent Defender becomes exhausted, you may remove target card in a graveyard from the game.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arisa Sarum
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)
Opponent's can't place quests face up.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Great Bear Spirit speaks to me, and it is my duty to share what it teaches."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arktos
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Arktos Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Arktos while defending in bear form this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take care of your armor, and it will take care of you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arlek Stonehilt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Each of your armor has +5 DEF while your hero is defending.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The call of the wild guides my steps, and you would do well to follow."
Program.FullCard.Name: Arlen the Untamed
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Assault 1 while you control a Form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One of the many treasures guarded closely by the vyrkul of Utgarde Keep.
Program.FullCard.Name: Arm Blade of Augelmir
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this weapon enters play, you may put target ability into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Armed to the Teeth
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals melee damage to target ally equal to 3 plus the number of equipment you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They are quite restless when they aren't soaring through the skies of Northrend" - Mei Francis
Program.FullCard.Name: Armored Blue Wind Rider
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ready a location you control.
When you place a resource face up, you may remove a counter from target location.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They have proven capable of weathering the harsh winds of Northrend." - Mei Francis
Program.FullCard.Name: Armored Snowy Gryphon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ready a location you control.
When you place a resource face up, you may choose a counter on target location and add another of those counters to it.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Armwraps of Disdain
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy an ability you control your hero has +1 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You probably think you're quite strong - fighting these undead and crushing their bones beneath your war machines." - Matthias Lehner
Program.FullCard.Name: Army of the Damned
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
Name a Scourge ally. For each ally you control with that name, you may pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card for each 2 paid this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You're no use to me alive." - Saeryn Dusksorrow
Program.FullCard.Name: Army of the Dead
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy all allies. For each ally destroyed this way, you put a 3 [Melee] / 3 [Health] Ghoul ally token into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arnerus Brightsteppe
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each of your armor has +5 DEF while your hero is attacking.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arnold Flem
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Arnold Flem is destroyed, he deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arrowsong
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with this weapon, your hero has Long-Range this combat.
When you draw a card, add a verse counter.
Remove three verse counters You pay 3 less the next time you strike with this weapon this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My son may no longer be able to aid you, but his power is still within your grasp." - Oronok Torn-heart
Program.FullCard.Name: Ar'tor's Mainstay
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals damage with an ability, you may ready one of your resources.

Program.FullCard.Name: Arturius Hathrow
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 3 Flip Arturius. BACK: When Arturius heals damage for the first time each turn, he may deal 1 nature damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will use my magic to mold your shape to one more suited to scouting the marsh." - Ysiel Windsinger
Program.FullCard.Name: As the Crow Flies
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Look at target player's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Go ahead, mon. Hit me again."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ash'ergi
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)
Ash'ergi has +1 ATK for each damage on him.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You think you've won already? Perhaps you'll need another lesson in pain!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ashes to Ashes
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Each opponent chooses an ally in his party and removes it from the game. If your hero is Majordomo Executus, you choose instead.
Ongoing: When an ally is destroyed, remove it from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even in the darkest of times, I will do all that I can to aid those in need."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ashnaar, Frost Herald
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has Assault X, where X is this ally's ATK.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ashtongue Battlelord
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero: When Ashtongue Battlelord enters play, destroy target undamaged opposing ally.
Loyal Hero: When Ashtongue Battlelord enters play, destroy all damaged opposing allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When the time is right, we will strike against the Betrayer." - Akama
Program.FullCard.Name: Ashtongue Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Loyal Hero Required (Can't put this in your deck if your hero is a Traitor.)
Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We'll see where my tribe's loyalties lie once we make our move." - Akama
Program.FullCard.Name: Ashtongue Rogue
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero: Elusive, Ferocity
Loyal Hero: Long-Range, Stealth

Program.FullCard.Name: Askalti Darksteel
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Askalti, remove a Scourge ally in your graveyard from the game Target ally has +1 / -1 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It turns three days' travel into two days, provided no one gets in the way." - Chaigon Steelsight
Program.FullCard.Name: Aspect of the Cheetah
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to complete quests, to a minimum of 1.
When your hero is dealt damage, put Aspect of the Cheetah from play into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aspect of the Hawk
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If your hero would deal ranged damage, it deals that amount of damage plus 1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Monkey see, monkey dodge.
Program.FullCard.Name: Aspect of the Monkey
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Discard a card Opposing allies have -2 ATK while in combat with your hero this turn. Use only once per turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Vipers may appear sluggish, but they can lash out with deadly speed and precision.
Program.FullCard.Name: Aspect of the Viper
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the end of your turn, you may ready all of your resources.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This power triggers at the start of your end phase. If you choose to ready your resources, you can exhaust them to pay resource costs during your end phase.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Every soul has a wild aspect; you must find yours and embrace it." - The Greatest Race of Hunters
Program.FullCard.Name: Aspect of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: [Nature] allies you control have +2 / +2.
2 Target ally you control has Nature Resistance this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Allow me to introduce you to the Light."
Program.FullCard.Name: Astani Dawngrace
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector, Assault 1, Mend 1

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let me give you a life lesson: never put all your eggs in one basket." Spellweaver Jihan
Program.FullCard.Name: Astral Denial
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Interrupt target quest reward effect.
Ongoing: When an opponent completes a quest, destroy this ability. If you do, interrupt that quest's reward effect.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I hate that you did all that work for nothing."
Program.FullCard.Name: Astral Grief
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target quest reward effect.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It be da fool's assumption dat once someth'n be gone, it be lost forever." - Mojo Shaper Ojo'mon
Program.FullCard.Name: Astral Recall
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove this ability from the game. Put up to one target ability, up to one target ally, and up to one target equipment from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our duty requires resolve."
Program.FullCard.Name: Atani of the Watch
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
If damage would be dealt to your hero, it's dealt to Atani instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light giveth and the Light taketh away." - Graccus
Program.FullCard.Name: Atonement
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all damage that target hero or ally would deal this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: If one is to acquire Spirit Shards, one must capture each Spirit Tower.
Program.FullCard.Name: Auchindoun Spirit Towers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you draw a card, add a capture counter.
, Remove five capture counters Turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Name: Augustus Corpsemonger
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Remove three ally cards in your graveyard from the game Destroy target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aura of Accuracy
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play cards and effects with one or more targets, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My soul longs for vengeance" - Illidan Stormrage
Program.FullCard.Name: Aura of Anger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: Heroes and allies in your party have +1 ATK while attacking damaged heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Know that your sacrifice will bring me great glory this day." - Crusader Goodchilde
Program.FullCard.Name: Aura of Fanaticism
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: Your hero has +1 ATK for each ally in your party.
Allies in your party have -1 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Aurastone Hammer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Put target ally from your party into its owner's hand. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Before I submit to this impending death, there is one last thing I must do."
Program.FullCard.Name: Aurius
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a friendly Paladin is destroyed, it may deal 3 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When it comes to the unjust, the Light has a very long memory."
Program.FullCard.Name: Auryna the Lightsworn
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Paladin: Flip Auryna Auryna deals 2 unpreventable holy damage to each opposing hero and ally that dealt damage this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Never in my life have I seen an arrow with such force, such raw power..." - Lelora Sunlancer
Program.FullCard.Name: Avalanche
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with this weapon, your hero has Long-Range this combat.
When your hero deals combat damage with this weapon to a hero, your hero deals that much frost damage to target ally in that hero's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The forests of Ashenvale provide many escape routes for the knowledgeable.
Program.FullCard.Name: Avanthera
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1 If Avanthera is in combat, remove her from combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Rise, great hunter, and feast!" - Amaria Kelsur
Program.FullCard.Name: Avatar of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put an X [Melee] / X [Health] Tiger ally token into play with Ferocity.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who oppose the shield must yield.
Program.FullCard.Name: Avenger's Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protection Hero Required
Exhaust up to three target heroes and/or allies, and each of them can't ready during its controller's next step. Your hero deals 1 holy damage to each of those characters.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] All targets are dealt damage and can’t ready even if they were already exhausted as this card resolved. Each of them can’t ready even if the 1 holy damage that would have been dealt to it was prevented.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Evil shows no mercy, nor is it shown an by the Light.
Program.FullCard.Name: Avenging Wrath
Program.FullCard.Rules: Double your hero's ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Axe of the Legion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your other Axes have +2 ATK.
Your hero has dual wield. (Can have a second one-handed Melee weapon instead of an Off-Hand equipment. Can strike with a second Melee weapon during the same combat.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Ayaka Winterhoof
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 4 Flip Ayaka. BACK: When Ayaka deals 1 or more damage, she heals 1 damage from herself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I must tend to our wounded quickly."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ayluro Nightwind
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Mend 5
This ally can't heal heroes.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Find a way to let him loose on his captors." - Exarch Onaala
Program.FullCard.Name: Azaloth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Azaloth enters play, choose an opponent.
That opponent puts five Warlock ally tokens with 0 Shadow ATK / 5 health into play.
Azaloth can't attack while any of those tokens are in play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You are worthless! All I need to do is point, and your life will be forfeit."
Program.FullCard.Name: Azamoth Deathfang
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Discard a card This ally deals 1 shadow damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: He sees you coming before you see yourself.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azarak Wolfsblood
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Flip Azarak Wolfsblood Target hero or ally has -X ATK while in combat with Azarak this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Than venom is so toxic that it can paralyze even a Dragon in a matter of seconds.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Acidslinger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
This ally has +1 / +1 while an equipment is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: They prefer when their prey tries to flee.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Acidspewer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
This ally has +1 / +1 while an equipment is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Guardians bred for a single purpose: protect Kilix the Unraveler, no matter the cost.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Battleguard
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
This ally has +1 / +1 while an ally is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Broodguards of Azjol-anak are ruthless in the defense of their fellow Nerubians.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Broodguard
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other repuations in your deck.)
This ally has +1/+1 while an ally is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Champion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation
This ally has +3 / +3 while an ability, ally, and equipment are in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Deathwatcher
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
When this ally enters play, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Skirmisher won't stop until it or its enemy is dead.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Skirmisher
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
At the start of your turn, discard a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Ironically, if you don't close the distance quickly, you may soon find yourself unable to escape.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Webspinner
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other repuations in your deck.)
This ally has +1/+1 while an ability is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The intricate webs that they weave are most beautiful when viewed from a distance.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azjol-anak Webweaver
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Nerubian Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
This ally has +1 / +1 while an ability is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Long guarded by the blue dragonflight, this relic was passed on to the naaru and then to those who would defend the Light.
Program.FullCard.Name: Azure-Shield of Coldarra
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero would be dealt damage, prevent all but 3 of it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Azuresong Mageblade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you draw a card, put a verse counter on Azuresong Mageblade.
1, Remove three verse counters Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Out of my way - I have important matters to attend to!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Babagahnoosh the Grumpy
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, turn all resources you control face down and discard your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I want yo uto hit me as hard as you can."
Program.FullCard.Name: Backlash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destruction Hero Required
Ongoing: If an opposing hero or ally dealt damage to your hero this turn, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In the war between the Horde and the Alliance, grudges are taken to the hilt.
Program.FullCard.Name: Backstab
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X melee damage to target exhausted hero or ally, where X is 3 plus the ATK of one of your Daggers.

Program.FullCard.Name: Bad Mojo Mask
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of each player's turn, that player discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you find yourself in a pinch, lad, greater focus will bring you greater returns."
Program.FullCard.Name: Baelgond Soulgrace
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Baelgond enters play, reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed ability card into hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Come and get some!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Bait the Trap
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Trap cards in your hand also have “You may exhaust a defending ally in your party rather than pay this card’s cost.”

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How much can you know about yourself if you've never been on a hunt?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Bakaar
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has long-range (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Killing is her business, and business is good.
Program.FullCard.Name: Bala Silentblade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Bala Silentblade has +3 ATK while attacking an exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Balanced Heartseeker
Program.FullCard.Rules:
While your hero is attacking a hero, this equipment has +2 ATK for each heirloom counter on it.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Add an heirloom counter to target equipment you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Kirin Tor found a way to solidify and condense the pure essence of arcane magic.
Program.FullCard.Name: Band of Channeled Magic
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you may pay 2. If you do, draw a card. Otherwise, destroy this item.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Legion reels…a pit lord commander has been defeated." - Nazgrel
Program.FullCard.Name: Band of Crimson Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Discard a card The next time damage would be dealt with an ability you control this turn, that much +3 is dealt instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Band of Sulfuras
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: If a friendly hero or ally would deal damage to an Elemental, it deals that much damage +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Inexorable, unavoidable, inescapable…
Program.FullCard.Name: Band of the Inevitable
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Destroy Band of the Inevitable Destroy each equipment with cost X or less. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As much a symbol as a treasure, it had been handed down through generations of many great heroes.
Program.FullCard.Name: Band of the Ranger-General
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to strike with weapons for each weapon you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The ring brings out the worst in everyone that wears it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Band of Vile Aggression
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Destroy target resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Did you drop this?" - Oakenclaw
Program.FullCard.Name: Bandit's Insignia
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Target opponent puts a card from his hand into his resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The time has come to forge the sword." - David Wayne
Program.FullCard.Name: Bane of the Illidari
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you have an equipment, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Who would have thought that such a small item could provide such a great power?" - Moonshadow
Program.FullCard.Name: Bangle of Endless Blessings
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Bangle of Endless Blessings enters play, put each face-down resource into its owner's hand.
Players can't place resources face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When you draw power from demons, it's a good idea to have a backup plan in case they disagree.
Program.FullCard.Name: Banish
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target Demon ally or Elemental ally from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who enter the Nether rarely return.
Program.FullCard.Name: Banish to the Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Remove target ability, ally, or equipment from game.
Ongoing: When Banish to the Nether leaves play, the owner of that removed card puts that card into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Their shrieks can crumble even the sturdiest of warriors.
Program.FullCard.Name: Banshee Soulclaimer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
[Alliance] and [Horde] allies have -1 / -1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Sooner or later, all of Azeroth will come to appreciate just how masterful Kulvo truly was."
Program.FullCard.Name: Bantham, Jadefist Apprentice
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
This ally has -2 / -2 while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "With all these corpses around, Banzai is going to have a feast!" - Thaka Deadeye
Program.FullCard.Name: Banzai
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has +1 ATK for each card in opposing graveyards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who fail the Test of Lore are outcast, bearing the Mark of Shame upon them.
Program.FullCard.Name: Barak the Shamed
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Barak enters play, each player secretly chooses a number. The player who chooses the highest number gains control of Barak, and you put that amount of damage on that player's hero. If there's a tie, you choose the outcome.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: These leggings were once among the trove of the Black Stalker, a menace to Sporeggar and all of Zangarmarsh.
Program.FullCard.Name: Barbaric Legstraps
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally. Use only if an opposing ally was destroyed this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Barkskin
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your ability, ally, and equipment cards can't be interrupted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Property of the Grim Guzzler Tavern.
Program.FullCard.Name: Barman Shanker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Barman Shanker has +2 ATK while your hero is attacking an exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Pain begets pain.
Program.FullCard.Name: Barnathrum, Lord of Pain
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Double the damage on each ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If a modifier (like Barnathrum’s) adds damage to a character but doesn’t specify that it deals that damage, that damage is put on that character, and so it can’t be replaced or prevented.

Program.FullCard.Name: Baron Geddon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: When Baron Geddon enters play, each opponent destroys all but five of his resources.
At the end of your turn, Baron Geddon deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally for each resource you have.
Flip Baron Geddon.
BACK: Destroy Baron Geddon Baron Geddon deals 12 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally. Use only if Baron Geddon has 12 or more damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Barous the Storm Baron
Program.FullCard.Rules: Nature allies in your party have " This ally deals nature damage equal to its ATK, divided as you choose, to any number of target allies."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It calls forth three servants of House Barov to fight, cook, and clean for you.
Program.FullCard.Name: Barov Peasant Caller
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, , Destroy Barov Peasant Caller Put three Peasant ally tokens with 1 ATK, 1 health, and ferocity into play. At end of turn, destroy them.

Program.FullCard.Name: Bash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Your hero is in bear form. (Has protector. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My blood is my own!" - Magtheridon
Program.FullCard.Name: Bathe in Blood
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Magtheridon deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally.
If Magtheridon is Unleashed, gain a Blood.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo gonna be a masta of da elements someday, dis I promise, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Bath'rah the Windwatcher
Program.FullCard.Rules: When each Shaman you control exhausts for the first time each turn, you may ready it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Battle "Preparations"
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies can't attack until after your next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The justice it deals out is harsh and unfair.
Program.FullCard.Name: Battle Mage's Baton
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Exhaust your hero Destroy target ability, ally, or equipment with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No man, woman, or child survived to tell the tale.
Program.FullCard.Name: Battle of Darrowshire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Remove three ally cards in your graveyard from the game and pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you choose to stay, you will have to fight!" - High General Marcus Auralion
Program.FullCard.Name: Battle of the Crimson Watch
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 or more to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card for each 3 paid this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor:
"Warriors and paladins to the front. Druids, priests, warlocks, mages, and hunters to the rear. Rogues...do something sneaky."
"There," thought Graccus. "It's the best we can do."
Program.FullCard.Name: Battle Plan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For Lordaeron!" "For Khaz Modan!" "For the Horde!" Azeroth has heard them all.
Program.FullCard.Name: Battle Shout
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Allies in your party have +1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Name: Battle Tactics
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Opposing heroes and allies must attack each turn if able.
When an opponent proposes a combat, you may change the proposed defender. (It must be a legal choice for the attacker.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] If you choose to change a proposed defender, that proposal effect is updated before it resolves. If the proposed attacker is a saboteur, you can’t change a proposed sabotage into a non-sabotage, or vice versa.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your distractions are all for naught." - Ozzati
Program.FullCard.Name: Battlecast Pants
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Blood of Gladiators) - requires 4 Primal Air, 4 Primal Fire, 4 Primal Earth, 4 Primal Water, 4 Primal Mana, 6 Bolt of Imbued Netherweave, 1 Primal Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules: Cards in your hand are instant this turn until you play a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Battlemage Vyara
Program.FullCard.Notes: The Hunt for Illidan Sneak Preview Promo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
You may exhaust Vyara rather than pay the cost of an ability with cost 7 or less, or a weapon's strike cost of 7 or less.

Program.FullCard.Name: Bear Form
Program.FullCard.Notes: UDE Card Preview, Errata: Clarified to state it goes into its owner’s hand from the graveyard.
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero is in bear form. (Has protector. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)
When Bear Form is destroyed, you may pay 2. If you do, its owner puts it from his graveyard into his hand at end of turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Bearlady Brala
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Brala enters play, make up a name.
At the start of your turn, put a unique Bear ally token with that name and 1 Melee ATK / 1 health into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't push me, lad. Or me pet." - Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Name: Beast Within, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Beast Mastery Hero Required
While you have a Pet this turn, prevent all damage that your hero would be dealt, and your hero has +3 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fight at your best, or die like the rest!" - Lord Benjamin Tremendouson
Program.FullCard.Name: Behead
Program.FullCard.Rules: If target ally is damaged, destroy it. Otherwise, your hero deals 1 melee damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Bella Wilder
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has Ferocity while you control another [Nature] card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Belligerence
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: You pay 2 less to strike with Melee weapons on your turn.
Death Rattle (When this ability enters your graveyard from anywhere.): Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed Melee weapon into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The lair itself shuddered at the awful sound.
Program.FullCard.Name: Bellowing Roar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stage 3 Only.
Put all opposing allies into their owner's hands. Opponents can't play allies until after your next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I always shoot from the hip." - Blaize Brightspark
Program.FullCard.Name: Belt of Blasting
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Servants of the Betrayer) - requires 15 Primal Fire, 6 Bolt of Imbued Netherweave, 4 Nether Vortex
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Exhaust your hero Your hero deals X arcane damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take a breath…savor it…and then say farewell." - Dralor
Program.FullCard.Name: Belt of Deep Shadow
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Servants of the Betrayer) - requires 10 Primal Air, 10 Primal Shadow, 4 Heavy Knothide Leather, 2 Nether Vortex
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has stealth.
If your hero would deal combat damage, it deals that much +2 instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Belt of the Archmage
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Belt of the Archmage enters play, reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put all revealed ability cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Belt of the Black Eagle
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Wrathgate)
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, , Turn a resource you control face down Look at the top two cards of your deck. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can see the fear in your eyes, and yet you can't see me. How unfortunate for you." - Tysandri Duskstrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Belt of the Twilight Assassin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Discard an equipment Add a murder counter.
Your hero has Assault 1 for each murder counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Behind every shadow is the light of hope.
Program.FullCard.Name: Benediction
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When your hero heals damage with an ability, draw a card.
Exhaust your hero Put a card named Anathema from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Benefits of Practice, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 melee damage to target hero or ally. You may choose on of your weapons. If you do, put a +1 ATK counter on it for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In life he cooked meat for his brothers. In death he cooked his brothers for meat.
Program.FullCard.Name: Benethor Draigo

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Nothing can stop a servant of the Light!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Bernard, Zealot of the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy Bernard Destroy target attacking ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm pretty sure we should run now. . ." - Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Name: Berserk
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Feral Hero Required
Ongoing: While your hero has Bear Form, when it's dealt combat damage, you may draw a card.
While your hero has Cat Form, when it deals combat damage to a hero, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let yourself lose control…" - Kelm Hargunth
Program.FullCard.Name: Berserker Bracers
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero is dealt damage, ready Berserker Bracers.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Nothing incites the killing urge like the taste of one's own blood.
