Program.FullCard.Name: Elder Valdar of the Exodar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Inspiring Presence (If a hero or ally in your party would deal non-combat damage, it deals that much +1 instead.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your courage will be their inspiration."
Program.FullCard.Name: Elder Zeez
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
Inspiring Presence (If a hero or ally in your party would deal non-combat damage, it deals that much +1 instead.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Damned Frostwolf! Ye will not halt our sovereign imperialistic imperative! - Vandar Stormpike
Program.FullCard.Name: Electrified Dagger
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy Electrified Dagger Your hero deals 2 nature damage divided as you choose to any number of target [Horde] heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a hero or ally deals damage to Ragnaros this turn, Ragnaros deals that much fire damage to each hero and ally in that character's party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Focus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elemental Hero Required
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play Elemental abilities, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Lords of the Twilight Council possess powerful treasures of the elements.
Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Focus Band
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, , Discard an ability card Your hero deals 2 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Precision
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If a hero or ally in your party would deal nature [Nature] damage, it deals double that much instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: This ability enters play with three water counters.
Ready a resource you control for each water counter, then remove a water counter. If none remain, destroy this ability.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Vision
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Put one into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When their weapons are glowing, you had better keep at a safe distance!" - Chloe Mithrilbolt
Program.FullCard.Name: Elemental Weapons
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Enhancement Hero Required
Ongoing: Each of your weapons becomes a [Nature] weapon and has +X ATK, where X is its cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I thought you could use the help."
Program.FullCard.Name: Elementalist Psyrin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Psyrin can't attack.
Target ally has +3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Elements' Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 nature damage to target hero and 3 nature damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Elendril is most at home in the wilderness with only his tiger at his side.
Program.FullCard.Name: Elendril
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Elendril Your Ranged weapons have +3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Love is fleeting. Power is eternal."
Program.FullCard.Name: Elithys Firestorm
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Elithys Firestorm attacks, she deals 1 fire damage to each other hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Forsaken have their own unique way of mending the injured.
Program.FullCard.Name: Elizabeth Crowley
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Discard a card Elizabeth heals 4 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Be at peace. I will not leave you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Elumeria Wildershot
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Elumeria Elumeria heals all damage from all of your Pets.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: They're sturdy, stylish, and shiny. What's not to like?
Program.FullCard.Name: Elven Chain Boots

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "One cannot make magic if one's mind is unmade." - Holy Bologna: What the Light Won't Tell You
Program.FullCard.Name: Embolism
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player discards X cards, where X is the cost of a non-hero Priest or Rogue you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A gift to the Nether and a punishment for you. Fair deal. - Rinni Gloomtrik
Program.FullCard.Name: Embrace of the Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, choose "ability," "ally," or "equipment" and discard a card of that kind.
Remove target card from the game if it shares that kind.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do not be fooled by the path I choose to follow."
Program.FullCard.Name: Emek the Equalizer
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Flip Emek You and target opponent each discard a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our troubles lie abroad, where the armies of the Lich King dwell. That is where the true challenge awaits."
Program.FullCard.Name: Emelia Darkhand
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
This ally can't attack unless an opponent controls more allies than you.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Acidspewer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource you control is turned face down, you may have target player shuffle his graveyard into his deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Ysera and her green dragonflight seek to protect the World Tree from the onslaught of Ragnaros the Firelord.
Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Captain
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource you control is turned face down, this ally deals 1 nature damage to target hreo.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Emissary
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to complete quests for each Druid and Hunter you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Lifewarden
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You can place an additional resource on each of your turns.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Reveal the top card of your deck. If it's a quest, put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Hmmm, unanounced visitors? Preparations must be made." - Moroes
Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Ripper
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has dual wield.
3 Emerald Ripper has +X ATK this turn, where X is its ATK.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] X is locked in as this payment effect resolves.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Soldier
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource you control is turned face down, this ally heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The titan Eonar granted Ysera a portion of nature's influence, bound to the Emerald Dream.
Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Tree Warder
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource you control is turned face down, you may draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald Wanderer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource you control is turned face down, this ally has Assault 3 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Emerald-Scale Greaves
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Emerald-Scale Greaves Ready target friendly ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those who wish to fight against the Scourge must be willing to sacrifice life and limb."
Program.FullCard.Name: Emerson Zantides
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Priest: Flip Emerson Emerson deals 2 shadow damage to target hero or ally and 2 shadow damage to himself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The best part of being small is that everyone is a bigger target!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Emmi Sprinklestrike
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: 5 You may flip Emmi.
BACK: 1 [Melee] ATK

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My old friends. How good to see you again." - Shaii
Program.FullCard.Name: Empty the Stables
Program.FullCard.Rules: Search your deck for up to three Pet cards with different names, reveal them, and put them into hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Unnnnngggggnnnn. . ."
Program.FullCard.Name: Encrusted Zombie Finger
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero attacks, yo umay point and make a Zombie noise. If you do, this weapon has Assault 1 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Cover me, I'm going in!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Endina the Hunted
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
While Endina is exhausted, opposing heroes and allies can attack only Endina if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo got dat wrong, mon. A good offense is da best defense."
Program.FullCard.Name: Enduring Shout
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: While exactly one ally is in your party, it has +2 ATK / +2 health and is a protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If I had things my way, the winter would last forever." - Suvok Frozeneye
Program.FullCard.Name: Enduring Winter
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Frost Hero Required
Attach to target ability or equipment.
Ongoing: Attached card can't be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We cannot allow them a victory there, as Garadar would be next without a doubt." - Karrtog
Program.FullCard.Name: Enemies, Old and New
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. You may remove a counter from target card in play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] You can’t remove damage (even if damage is being represented by counters).

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A taste of the refreshing energies of the Emerald Dream.
Program.FullCard.Name: Energize
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player draws two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let's go!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Energized
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Good health. Long life."
Program.FullCard.Name: Enfea Contha
Program.FullCard.Rules: Enfea Contha heals all damage from target friendly ally, then deals that much nature damage to target opposing ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can’t use this power unless you target both an opposing ally and a friendly ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I know what I'm doing! Just keep the priests ready!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Engulfing Blaze
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 fire damage to each hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who survive the initial blast are far from safe.
Program.FullCard.Name: Engulfing Flames
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target opposing hero or ally, and Onyxia deals 5 damage to it.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, Onyxia deals X fire damage to attached character, where X is the current stage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Enlightenment
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Discipline Hero Required
You pay 1 less to play Enlightenment for each ability card in your graveyard.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, you win the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Trust me, he's better off this way." - Radak Doombringer
Program.FullCard.Name: Enslave Demon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target Demon ally.
Ongoing: You control attached ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those types of friendships never last long
Program.FullCard.Name: Enslaved Abyssal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Fire Resistance
At the end of your turn, if you didn't play a Demon or Demonology card this turn, choose an opponent. He gains control of Enslaved Abyssal, and it loses this power.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Enslaved Abyssal doesn't lose fire resistance. It doesn't regain the lost power while it remains in play, so it doesn't change control again (unless something else causes it to change control).

Program.FullCard.Name: Entangling Growth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target opposing ally and exhaust it.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't ready during its controller's ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The vines grew angry, as if every weed of Azeroth sought revenge upon those who would destroy their fertile home.
Program.FullCard.Name: Entangling Roots
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally and exhaust it.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't ready during its controller's ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Would you prefer they bury you instead? - Chloe Mithrilbolt
Program.FullCard.Name: Entomb
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target equipment on the bottom of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Entry into the Black Temple
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card for each different class among allies in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Subterfuge is what separates the dead rogues from the live ones." - Ravenna
Program.FullCard.Name: Enveloping Shadows
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Subtlety Hero Required
Ongoing: Target ally can't deal damage this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Envenom
Program.FullCard.Rules: As an additional cost to play Envenom, remove up to five combo cards in your graveyard from the game. Your hero deals that much nature damage to target hero or ally, or double that much if the targeted character has a Poison attached to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mechanical ingenuity is vital to the success of the Alliance." - Master Mathias Shaw
Program.FullCard.Name: Envoy Aiden LeNoir
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Diplomacy: Gnomes (You pay 1 less to play Gnome allies, to a minimum of 1.)
1, Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't usually like da noise of a rifle, but in dis case, I might make an exception." - The Longeye
Program.FullCard.Name: Envoy of Mortality
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with this weapon, your hero has Long-Range this combat.
When your hero deals damage with this weapon, it also deals that much ranged damage to target friendly hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Since the Third War, the kaldorei have been a proud member of the Alliance.
Program.FullCard.Name: Envoy Samantha Dillon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Diplomacy:(You pay 1 less to play Night Elf allies, to a minimum of 1.)
Ready another target ally in your party. It can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let us reflect on this difference of opinion."
Program.FullCard.Name: Equal Opportunity
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each player puts an ally from his party into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let's level the playing field." - Boris Brightbeard
Program.FullCard.Name: Equalize
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each player with more cards in play than you destroys cards in play he controls until he has the same number as you.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I must return to her…to protect her…"
Program.FullCard.Name: Eranikus
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, reveal the top card of your deck, then place it into your resource row ready as an additional resource.

Program.FullCard.Name: Eredar Wand of Obliteration
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals shadow damage to an opponent's hero, you may destroy an ability, ally, or equipment you control. If you do, that opponent destroys an ability, ally, or equipment he controls.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Few are able to wield the many schools of magic with such ease.
Program.FullCard.Name: Erindae Firestrider
Program.FullCard.Rules: Once per turn: 1 Interrupt target card unless its controller pays 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I failed once before, but perhaps you…?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Eris Havenfire
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this or another Priest ally enters play under your control, the next time target hero or ally would be dealt damage this turn, prevent it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "In the name of the storms and the stars, I shall end you!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Eriun Moonglow
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Flip Eriun, shuffle X Balance ability cards from your graveyard into your deck Eriun deals X nature damage to target ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your screams for mercy will not save you, for Elune no longer guides my blade."
Program.FullCard.Name: Erondra Frostmoon
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Death Knight: Flip Erondra Target ally has -2 [Health] this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You call that a spell?" Let me show you how a real mage does it!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Errzig Cogflicker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arcane Resistance (Prevent all arcane or [Arcane] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My friends are dead. My family is dead. Even I am dead. What do I have left to fear?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Erytheis
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Erytheis is destroyed, she deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: E'sad
Program.FullCard.Rules: When E'sad enters play, target opponent puts the top card of his deck into his resource row face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Never be too sure you have a gnome cornered.
Program.FullCard.Name: Escape Artist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Gnome Hero Required
Choose one: Interrupt target ability card that's targeting your hero; or if your hero is defending, remove all attackers from combat.

Program.FullCard.Name: Eskhandar's Collar
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has +1 ATK while in combat with an opposing hero.
Opposing heroes have -1 ATK while in combat with your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The spirit of Eskhandar lives within this beastly looking weapon.
Program.FullCard.Name: Eskhandar's Right Claw
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may remove an equipment card in your hand from the game rather than pay Eskhandar's Right Claw's cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those who have been brought back by the curse of undeath must be freed so that their souls may rest."
Program.FullCard.Name: Esonea
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Esonea, discard a Warrior Weapons you control have +3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Essence Focuser, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: If a hero or ally in your party would heal damage, it heals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Essence Gatherer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing ally is destroyed, you may pay 1. If you do, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Essence of Enmity, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top five cards of your deck. Put a revealed ally into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The soothing waves of light flow freely." - Katianna
Program.FullCard.Name: Essence of Mending
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 6 damage from each friendly hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Essence of the Martyr
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally in your party is destroyed, you may remove it from the game. If you do, Essence of the Martyr becomes a copy of that ally with this power, and you remove all damage from it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We will establish new fortifications to tighten the noose around our enemies." - Emissary Whitebeard
Program.FullCard.Name: Establishing New Outposts
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed [Alliance] card into hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Etched Dragonbone Girdle
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Destroy a Dragonkin you control Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The deadliest weapon is one that ends a conflict." - Dizdemona
Program.FullCard.Name: Eternium Runed Blade
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program - requires 3 Primal Water, 3 Primal Fire, 3 Primal Earth, 3 Primal Mana, 3 Primal Air, 3 Khorium Bar, 5 Eternium Bar, 2 Hardened Adamantite Bar, 1 Primal Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Players can't play allies.
Allies can't be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Consortium always collects its debts.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ethereal Plunderer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Ethereal Plunderer leaves play, you may gain control of target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Even if you see a rogue, there's no guarantee your strikes will, too.
Program.FullCard.Name: Evasion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This piece of ice has been submitted to immense pressures and exposed to natural magics from deep beneath the world's surface."
Program.FullCard.Name: Everfrost
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 6 to complete this quest.
Reward: Target player shuffles his graveyard into his deck. Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's too cold to stand still!" - Magnus
Program.FullCard.Name: Everlasting Cold
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 frost damage to attached character, or 2 if that character didn't attack on its controller's last turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Guts were meant to be gutted." - The Assassin's Creed, Chapter 3
Program.FullCard.Name: Eviscerate
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play Eviscerate, remove up to five Combo cards in your graveyard from the game.
Your hero deals X melee damage to target hero or ally, where X is 2 plus the number of Combo cards removed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For those trained to draw on its power, the wellspring of magical energy is limitless.
Program.FullCard.Name: Evocation
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: 2 Draw a card.
When a card leaves your hand, destroy Evocation.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] A card leaves your hand when it goes to any other zone.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You've proven yourself not just to the Aldor, but to all of Outland."
Program.FullCard.Name: Exarch Onaala
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
5 Onaala deals 4 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.
4 Onaala heals 14 damage from target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Exarch Orelis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
Inspire: Ability, ally, equipment, hero, and resource

Program.FullCard.Flavor: By the time you feel the pain, it is already too late.
Program.FullCard.Name: Exasperate
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player discards a card for each [Shadow] ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Just because your allies are dead, doesn't mean they're useless."
Program.FullCard.Name: Exaura the Cryptkeeper
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Exaura Remove two target ally cards in one graveyard from the game. Draw a card. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Excessive Force
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target ally has +3 ATK this turn.
Target ally has -3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Showing weakness to a warrior is a death sentence.
Program.FullCard.Name: Execute
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ally with damage on it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Execute
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ally with damage on it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Watch and learn, friend."
Program.FullCard.Name: Exemplar's Blades
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +X ATK, where X is the highest ATK among your Melee weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Pay attention, friend."
Program.FullCard.Name: Exemplar's Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +X health, where X is the highest DEF among your armor.

Program.FullCard.Name: Exhaustion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: They are the celebrated warriors and defenders of the draenei.
Program.FullCard.Name: Exodar Peacekeepers
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Exodar Peacekeepers enters play, it heals 1 damage from target hero or ally for each ally named Exodar Peacekeepers in your party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You count Exodar Peacekeepers in your party as this effect resolves. Each one that enters play will usually heal at least 1 damage, because it counts itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Once a satellite of Tempest Keep, the Exodar crash-landed on Azeroth and became a surrogate home for the draenei." - Explorers' Guild Guide to Kalimdor
Program.FullCard.Name: Exodar, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Draenei Hero Required
1, Draenei in your party have +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Light glares brightest upon the most sinister of foes.
Program.FullCard.Name: Exorcism
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target Demon ally or Undead ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take great care in choosing your weapon, and you will be sure to find harmony with it in battle." - Indalamar
Program.FullCard.Name: Expertise of Steel
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has Dual Wield.
Axes you control have +2 ATK.
You pay 2 less to strike with Swords.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We've got explosives!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Explosions!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 fire damage divided as you choose to any number of target allies.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can’t target a character unless you allocate at least 1 of the 2 fire damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "With every Scourge death, its mindless brethren will be punished tenfold!" - Blythe the Pyromaniac
Program.FullCard.Name: Explosive Flames
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If an opposing ally was destroyed this turn: 1, Your hero deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Enjoy the fireworks, mon." - The Longeye
Program.FullCard.Name: Explosive Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Survival Hero Required
Destroy target opposing ally. If you do, your hero deals fire damage equal to that ally's cost to a second target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If the explosives are in there, where'd I put the snakes?" - Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Name: Explosive Trap
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Destroy target attacking ally. If you do, exhaust all other heroes and allies in its party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Expose Armor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play Expose Armor, remove up to five Combo cards in your graveyard from the game.
Destroy X target armor, where X is the number of Combo cards removed.

Program.FullCard.Name: Extinguish
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When this ability enters play, you may interrupt target ability.
If your hero would be dealt magical damage (Arcane ([Arcane]), Fire ([Fire]), Frost ([Frost]), Holy ([Holy]), Nature ([Nature]), or Shadow ([Shadow])), prevent 1 of it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Extract of Necromantic Power
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As each turn starts,
[Warlock] Hero: Prevent the next 3 melee ([Melee]) damage that would be dealt to your hero this turn.
[Death Knight] Hero: Prevent the next 3 non-melee damage that would be dealt to your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Faster, faster, faster! I'm not paying you to sit around all day."
Program.FullCard.Name: Exxi the Windshaper
Program.FullCard.Rules: While you control another Goblin, this ally has Time is Money and " Ready another target ally."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is you who must lead our troops to victory, Commander!" - Lieutenant Haggerdin
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of Command, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, pay 7 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Focus the Eye, and so too the flame.
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Exhaust your hero If your hero has dealt fire damage this turn, it deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Ben Drago 8/31/2006] Exhausting your hero is part of the cost to play the power on Eye of Flame, so you have to do it in order to deal 1 damage to a target.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Eye was named in honor of Kilrogg Deadeye, chieftain of the Bleeding Hollow clan.
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of Kilrogg
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card. Remove that card from the game.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You look at that player’s hand and choose a card as Eye of Kilrogg resolves. Players can respond before you do so. Once a card is chosen, that player can’t respond by playing or discarding it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The body parts of Magtheridon are said to hold tremendous, latent power. The Eye, when properly channeled, will bend fate toward the will of the user.
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of Magtheridon
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: If 1 would be rolled on a die, you may change it to any value on that die instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Eye is said to reveal even the most obscured weaknesses of a foe.
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of Rend
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your weapons have +1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Be careful where you step - the Nether is not a forgiving place." - Kristoff Manchester
Program.FullCard.Name: Eye of the Storm
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you play a card, add an honor counter.
, Remove four honor counters Exhaust up to four target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Beware the beast that shares a mind with its master." - Bloodsoul
Program.FullCard.Name: Eyes of the Beast
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, Exhaust your hero Ready target Pet you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ezra Phoenix
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
When Ezra readies, he deals 2 ranged damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ez'trin
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Ez'trin enters play, you may exhaust target weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For all their talk of honor and the Light, even the Alliance has a savage side.
Program.FullCard.Name: Face Smash
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally has " Destroy target ally" this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Faces from the Past
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put any number of target ally cards from your graveyard into play if their combined cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This is not the priest you are looking for." - Kintara Wintermoon
Program.FullCard.Name: Fade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if an ally is in your party.
Your hero is elusive and untargetable this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You are a fool if you think that I can be defeated so easily!" - Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Name: Fading Glow
Program.FullCard.Rules: When combat damage is dealth with this weapon, your hero heals 2 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Faerie Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Attached character loses and can't have Stealth.
If attached character would be dealt damage, it's dealt that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You dare challenge the might of the master? This is blasphemy! This is madness!" - Grand Widow Faerlina
Program.FullCard.Name: Faerlina's Madness
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: , Turn a resrouce you control face down Turn target opposing resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Name: Faesha Firestalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy one of your resources Faesha Firestalker has long-range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Faith Healer's Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules: an ally card from your graveyard into your hand. Use only if your hero healed damage this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can use this power only if your hero actually healed damage this turn. Trying to heal characters with no damage or that can’t be healed doesn’t count.

Program.FullCard.Name: Falana of the Glen
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Falana is destroyed, if an opponent has more resources than you, you may put Falana from the graveyard into her owner's resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The trick is they shouldn't see the hunter until it's too late." - The Greatest Race of Hunters
Program.FullCard.Name: Falcore
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long-Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)
Shadowmeld (Elusive and untargetable while ready.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Fall Back
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally from your party into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Every decision Akama made and every moment of his life since Illidan arrived, Akama planned for this moment." - Seer Kanai
Program.FullCard.Name: Fall of the Betrayer, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: If target opposing hero's printed health is more than your hero's, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Tor illsar'thera'nal!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Fallenstar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
2, Flip Fallenstar Fallenstar deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally without damage.
Use only on your turn.
Tortured Spirit

Program.FullCard.Name: Falling to Corruption
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destroy two of your resources and pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] You can pay costs in any order that allow all of them to be paid. So you can exhaust Falling to Corruption to pay (1), and then destroy it as one of the two resources you must destroy to pay its completion cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bandu thoribas!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Fallingstar
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Fallingstar Allies in your party with damage have +2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You will obey."
Program.FullCard.Name: Famish the Binder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: 3, Destroy three Horde allies in your party Flip Famish face down.
BACK: Horde allies in your party have ferocity.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I always have another trick up my sleeve." - Ressa Shadeshine
Program.FullCard.Name: Fan of Knives
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 ranged damage to each opposing hero and ally. On your turn: Discard a weapon Put this ability from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let them charge! My shoulders will greet them!" - Lionar, Unbound
Program.FullCard.Name: Fanblade Pauldrons
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust your hero Fanblade Pauldrons has +4 DEF this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The strength of the wolf is the pack, and the strength of the pack is the wolf.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fang
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Allies you control have Assault 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The jeweled blade hides a debilitating secret.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fang of the Crystal Spider
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage to a hero, that hero's controller can't play cards or strike with weapons this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My eyes are open."
Program.FullCard.Name: Far Sight
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at the top five cards of your deck. Choose one, shuffle the rest into your deck, then put that card on top.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Embrace the darkness, and you shall be made whole."
Program.FullCard.Name: Farander Shadesurge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mend 2 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Lar'korwi followed my brother for days, destroying everything he touched." - Torwa Pathfinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Fare of Lar'korwi, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Ally cards in your hand are instant this turn until you play an ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] As you add an ally card to the chain, any other ally cards in your hand stop being instant, so you can’t play any of them in response to the first.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fa'tafi
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
At the start of each turn, Fa'tafi heals 1 damage from himself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There exists no greater calling for a champion than to fight for the Argent Crusade."
Program.FullCard.Name: Father Gustav
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation
You pay 1 less to play Unique allies, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It fled without a word…unless "AAAAAGH!" counts as a word.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fear
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target opposing ally into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fear
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target opposing ally into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Feast of Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to attached character for each Mage and Warlock you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Feeding Frenzy
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
As an aditional cost to play, destroy and number of allies in your party.
Target Pet in your party has +2 ATK this turn for each ally destroyed this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Grennan's ties with nature made him comfortable in any environment...until he found himself among dozens of smoking, shaking dragon eggs.
Program.FullCard.Name: Feeding Time
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put X Whelps into play, where X is the current stage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The faster I am, the faster they fall."
Program.FullCard.Name: Feera Quickshot
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Feera You pay (2) less the next time you strike with a Ranged weapon this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Hunters blur the line between life and death.
Program.FullCard.Name: Feign Death
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if your hero is defending or the target of an opposing card or effect.
Interrupt all cards and effects, then end the turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Sucker."
Program.FullCard.Name: Feint
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target attacker from combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Whatever you do, don't forget to destroy as much as you can!" - Plexi
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel and the Furious, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If your hero has more damage than an opposing hero, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Armor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: If your hero would deal damage with an ability, it deals that much damage +2 instead.
If a hero or ally would heal damage from your hero, it heals that much damage +2 instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Blaze
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 fire damage to each non-Demon hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Burning Legion has no need for ammunition like cannonballs. The demons utilize far more potent weaponry." - Dralor
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Cannon
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a player plays a card, Fel Cannon deals 2 fire damage to that player's hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Domination
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Demonology Hero Required
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, put a dominate counter on Fel Domination.
Destroy Fel Domination You may put a Pet card from your hand into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of dominate counters on Fel Domination.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No natural force can extinguish this fire.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attack to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to attached character.
3 Your hero deals 1 fire damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let's see if you can survive through the fire and flames!" - Mazar
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to each non-Demon hero and ally. Then destroy this ability if you control no Demons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Gurtogg Bloodboil's taste for destruction has a way of erupting onto his foes.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Geyser
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: Opposing quests have "As an additional cost to complete, turn another one of your quests face down."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Obey me, demon. Unleash the fury of the Legion!" - Plague Fleshbane
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Infernal
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you discard a card, you may pay 1. If you do, this ally deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Even the metals of Outland carry with them the taint of the Burning Legion.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Iron Hatchet

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The craftsmanship shows that such potent evil is not a unique trait of the corrupted.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Leather Gloves
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource enters play, put 2 damage on its controllers hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Pact
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target Demon ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Away, you mindless parasites!" - Magtheridon
Program.FullCard.Name: Fel Ruination
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only of seven or more Bloods are in play.
Raiding players destroy an ability, ally, or equipment they control for each Blood in play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fel-Acid Breath
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Target opponent chooses three allies in his party, in order. Your hero deals 3, 2, and 1 nature damage to them, respectively.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What kind of curse is undeath if it falls so easily before my incantations?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Felbender Lara
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Warlock: Flip Lara Lara deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally with an attachment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Heed well this warning: Felendren the Banished is only a symptom of a much larger problem." - Lanthan Perilon
Program.FullCard.Name: Felendren the Banished
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Blood Elf Hero Required
During your turn, remove a non-token ally in your party from the game and pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You're lucky if you realize what's going on before you're nothing more than a chew toy." - Gyro of the Ring
Program.FullCard.Name: Feline Grace
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: 2, Ready your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The first mistake is assuming that "bigger" means "slower."

Play only if your hero is in bear form.
Interrupt target card.

Protector

Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Remove Fianna Spellbinder from the game Player's can't draw cards this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings:
[Mike Rosenberg 9/11/2006] -If you activate a draw effect in response to someone using Fianna's ability, you will draw your cards before Fianna's effect resolves.
-Fianna stops its user from drawing cards too, so make sure you are saving a quest like Zapped Giants for the turn you use her instead of Your Fortune Awaits You. ;)
-Fianna is a blood elf. Blood elves are awsome. Draw-skipping effects are awesome. As such, Fianna is, by natural order, awesome.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Litori had counted her blessings when she stumbled across the tome describing Onyxia's lair. Now she wished she hadn't skipped the first part and gone straight to the treasure section.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stop standing there and do something useful."

Protector

Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.

Totem (Can be attacked or targeted like an ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In the right hands, this weapon can stop armies.
Program.FullCard.Name: Flame Wrath
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Flame Wrath, your hero deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Danny Mandel 8/5/2006] Combat Damage happens in one single "packet" no matter how many times you strike with a weapon during the combat. So Flame Wrath's trigger would only happen once. Keep in mind that many effects that ready your weapon also ready your hero. This means that your hero could attack, strike with Flame Wrath, resolve the combat getting Flame Wrath's trigger. Then you can use an effect to ready your hero and Flame Wrath and start a new combat with your hero so you can get a second trigger off of Flame Wrath. Sometimes it's better to strike twice in a single combat, sometimes it's better to fight in two separate combats.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "TASTE THE FLAMES OF SULFURON!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Flames of Sulfuron

Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Brian Kibler 9/1/2006] Heroes do not take 'damage back' from allies when they use ability cards to kill them, unless the ability specifically states such. You would not take damage from Flamestrike'ing an ally, nor from Fire Blast'ing one - only if you attack or are attacked by them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Play nice.
Program.FullCard.Name: Foam Sword Rack
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1 Your hero deals 1/2 melee damage to target hero. Any player can use this power.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This card has received errata. The bold text above updates the printed text and clarifies which hero deals this damage, and that this damage isn’t dealt “with an ability.” This is the only way that a fractional amount of damage can be dealt. You can't divide integer amounts of damage into fractional amounts. A character with ½ damage is “damaged.” However, modifiers that do something “for each damage” on a character, or “for each damage” dealt, healed, or prevented a certain way ignore fractions. For example, an ally with berserking and 1½ damage has only +1 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "One's spirit can be focused to a point more deadly than the sharpest blade." - Tome of Divine Right
Program.FullCard.Name: Focused Will
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Discipline Hero Required
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, switch all damage on your hero with the damage on target opposing hero.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This effect isn’t optional. It removes and puts damage as applicable; it neither deals nor heals damage. If target hero has 0 damage as this effect resolves, remove all damage from your hero and put it on the target. If the target becomes illegal in response, or either hero isn’t in play on resolution, nothing happens.
