Program.FullCard.Name: Fork Lightning
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 5 nature damage to target hero and 5 nature damage to target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This card requires two (different) targets. If one becomes illegal in response, the other is still affected.

Program.FullCard.Name: Form of the Serpent
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero attacks, put a poison counter on Form of the Serpent. Your hero has +1 ATK this combat for each poison counter.
Remove all poison counters Your hero deals 1 nature damage to target ally for each counter removed this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Formation of Felbane, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 7 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top four cards of your deck. Put a revealed ability, ally, equipment, and quest card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] If you reveal two ally cards, a weapon card, and an armor card, you put two cards into your hand—one of the allies, and either the weapon or the armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our motivations may be wildly different, but our methods are, at times, strikingly similar." - Zophos the Vengeful
Program.FullCard.Name: Fortify
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has Protector this turn.
Your hero has +X ATK while protecting this turn, where X is the cost of target non-hero Paladin or Warrior you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Group up!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Fortifying Shout
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Heroes and allies in your party have +2 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fortune Telling
Program.FullCard.Rules: Turn your deck over.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] After your deck has been turned over, the top of your deck is still the side furthest from the table and the bottom of your deck is still the side closest to the table. You still draw cards from the top. All cards in your deck become face up and public. Any player can look at them, but not reorder them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You didn't really think I was going to let you hit me, did you?" - Vor'na the Disciplined
Program.FullCard.Name: Freeze
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target opposing ally or weapon.
Ongoing: Attached card can't attack or exhaust.
Death Rattle (When this ability enters your graveyard from anywhere.): Target opposing ally or weapon can't attack or exhaust this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Her accuracy was astounding; she placed the trap right underneath my foot from off in the distance! - Emmi Sprinklestrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Freezing Arrow
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Remove target opposing attacker from combat. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Name: Freezing Band
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent can't draw more than one card per turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Freezing Trap
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Attach to target attacking ally and remove it from combat.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't attack or protect and loses all powers.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frek Snipelix
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Time is Money (This ally can use powers immediately.)
Target ally has Long-Range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frenzy
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Target ally you control has Assault 1 this turn. (It has +1 ATK on your turn.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Freya Lightsworn
Program.FullCard.Rules: Freya Lightsworn heals 3 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Their bark is worse than their bite.
Program.FullCard.Name: Friends in High Places
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put two Treant ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Keep your enemies running scared, and surely they can never harm you." - Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Name: Fright
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target opponent puts an ally he controls into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will take advantage of your hesitation." - Gwon Strongbark
Program.FullCard.Name: Frigid Winds
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target hero or ally can't attack this turn.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Fear those that move in the shadows.
Program.FullCard.Name: From the Shadows
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: All allies have elusive.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Anyone can hit a mage. Once." - Morganis Blackvein
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Armor
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, Remove an ability card in your graveyard from the game Target ally can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Slowly, surely, inevitably. . .death comes." - Saeryn Dusksorrow
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Burst
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target hero or ally has -4 ATK while attacking or protecting this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Before you know it, your body will be entombed in frost, inside and out." - Krunkle Deadspark
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Fever
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 frost damage to attached hero.
Allies in attached hero's party lose and can't have Assault and Mend.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When you're charging at a mage, the last ten steps can take an eternity.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Funnel
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 frost damage to each of up to two target heroes and/or allies. A character dealt damage this way can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Litori's pursers found themselves quite literally frozen in their tracks.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Nova
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 frost damage to each opposing hero and ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings:
[Paul Ross 9/3/2006] Frost Nova deals no damage to totems.
[Paul Ross 9/3/2006] If you Nova in response to a combat proposal, the proposed attacker never exhausts and that combat step never starts. If you Nova during a combat step (after the attacker has exhausted), it does not "cancel the attack". (And you can strike with a weapon only during the defender window of a combat step.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Death knights personify the frigid invulnerability of Icecrown.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Presence
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Opposing cards and effects must target your hero if able.
Your hero has +10 health and is a protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Luckily, I came prepared for this frozen wasteland. - Kaerie, Defender of the Sunwell
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Resistance Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Friendly allies have Frost Resistance while ready. (Prevent all frost ([Frost]) damage that would be dealt to them.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Dont venture too far if you want to stay warm." - Phaladus the Enlightened.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Resistance Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Friendly heroes and allies have Frost Resistance.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Rune
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, remove an ability in your graveyard from the game.
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play your next card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: There is only one kind of cold the dwarves of Dun Morogh fear.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Shock
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 frost damage to target hero or ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack or protect this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Frost Hero Required
Your hero deals frost damage to target hero or ally equal to the ATK of a weapon you control.
Up to X target opposing cards can't attack or exhaust this turn, where X is the ATK of a weapon you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo think joo can do betta, mon? Prove it!" - Zi'mo the Empowered
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Surge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X frost damage to target hero or ally, where X is the cost of a non-hero Mage or Shaman you control. A character dealt damage this way can't attack or exhaust this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The frost trap allows hunters to reposition themselves for a better shot...or, if the need arises, to run.
Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Trap
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Remove all attackers from combat, and opposing heroes and allies can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Ward
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has Frost Resistance this turn. (Prevent all frost ([Frost]) damage that would be dealt to it.)
When damage that an opposing hero or ally would deal is prevented this way, your hero may deal that much frost damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frost Wave
Program.FullCard.Rules: Up to two target allies can't attack or exhaust this turn. Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This unnatural cold hounds us like a rabid animal!" - Morn Walks-the-Path
Program.FullCard.Name: Frostbite
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Frost Hero Required
Ongoing: 1, Discard a Frost or [Frost] card Opponents pay 2 more to play cards this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Wearing heavy plate is taxing enough without having to lug around another eighty pounds of ice." - Warrax
Program.FullCard.Name: Frostbolt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 frost damage to target hero or ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frost-bound Chain Bracers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with a weapon, your hero may deal 1 frost damage to target hero or ally.
Death Rattle: You pay 2 less to strike with weapons this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you are wise, you will ensure that your equipment enhances your best abilities." - Ozzati
Program.FullCard.Name: Frostbridge Orb
Program.FullCard.Rules:
[Druid] Hero: Cards you control with Mend have an additional Mend 1.
[Mage] Hero: Cards you control with Assault have an additional Assault 1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frostfire Bolt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 unpreventable frostfire damage to target ally. This turn, an ally dealt damage this way can't attack or exhaust, and loses and can't have powers. (Frostfire damage counts as both frost and fire.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Frostguard
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Allies in your party have frost resistance.
(Prevent all frost or [Frost] damage that those allies would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Frostweave Bandage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Destroy this item Your hero heals 4 damage from target hero or ally.
Death Rattle: Target hero or ally has Frost Resistance this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Scourge defiled Silvermoon once before. I will die before I see it happen again!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Frostweaver Dakar'sith
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes and allies can't attack unless their controller exhausts two other cards he controls for each attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Eye of Command
Program.FullCard.Name: Frostwolf Insignia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you play a card, add an honor counter. If there are six or more on Frostwolf Insignia, destroy it.
When Frostwolf Insignia is destroyed this way, your hero heals 10 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Frozen Nerves
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target non-hero card.
Ongoing: Attached card can't attack or exhaust.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you try to wiggle, it's only going to hurt more." - Loraala the Frigid
Program.FullCard.Name: Frozen Solid
Program.FullCard.Rules: The next time target opponent would draw a card this turn, you draw one instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fuel for the Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Destroy one of your resources Your hero deals 3 fire damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Foolish mortals, you think you can defeat me? Come, all of you! All the more to feast upon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Fuel for the Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: Draw a card for each opposing hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fugu
Program.FullCard.Rules: Gain control of target ally until end of turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Full Circle
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may discard an ally card. If you do, put a second target ally card from your graveyard into play, then put a third target ally from your party into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Furan Rookbane
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, reveal the top card of your deck. You may place it into your resource row exhausted as an additional resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The elements and I share a common fury!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Furious Kalla
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Hardiness (If this ally would be dealt damage, prevent 1 of it.)
When Kalla attacks, you may put a Totem card from your hand into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No one is immune to the power of motivation.
Program.FullCard.Name: Furious Resolve
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +1 ATK and +1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Whoa - I thought all you did was heal!" - Victoria Jaton
Program.FullCard.Name: Furor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: When you play a Form, you may ready up to X of your resources, where X is its cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A faint rustling of brush, a whirlwind of tooth and claw - and silence. Such is the fate of Fury's prey.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ferocity

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When Emperor Thaurissan called upon a powerful elemental to aid him in the War of the Three Hammers, he knew not what power he would awaken.
Program.FullCard.Name: Fury of the Firelord
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ragnaros deals 50 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally. That damage can't be prevented.
Fury of the Firelord can't be interrupted.

Program.FullCard.Name: Fusion Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: 1, Exhaust a Totem you control
Air: Exhaust target ally.
Earth: Target ally has Assault this turn.
Fire: It deals 2 fire damage to target ally.
Water: Target player draws a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gabble
Program.FullCard.Rules: Elusive (Can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Martyrs instill morale, the damned instill bloodlust.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gahrunt Foulfang
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove three ally cards in your graveyard from the game Target ally in your party has ferocity this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I even invented a detector that makes finding the Gahz'ridian a snap! Just put it on, and the search begins!" - Marvon Rivetseeker
Program.FullCard.Name: Gahz'ridian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Can't we all just get along?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gakmat
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
X, Gakmat deals X fire damage to target ally and itself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Galahandra, Keeper of the Silent Grove
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
1, Exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The frozen earth adds a surprising twist to the storms we conjure." - Yanna Dal'shalan
Program.FullCard.Name: Gale Winds
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Balance Hero Required
Ongoing: Abilites you control can be exhausted to pay costs as though they were resources.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bringing the inanimate and the dead to life wasn't enough?" - Kileana the Inferno
Program.FullCard.Name: Galvanize
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Choose one: Ally tokens you control have +1 ATK this turn; or target ally token you control has +3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Galway Steamwhistle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready target hero and one of your weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Not again!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gamon
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Any hero or ally can attack Gamon. (Including characters in your party.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] His power allows friendly characters to propose combats against him if otherwise legal.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Chances are, you'll never see the second one.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gang Up
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, exhaust two heroes and/or allies in your party.
Destroy target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Garell Strout
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Garell Strout attacks, he deals 2 fire damage to target opposing hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have little patience for the likes of you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Garet Vice
Program.FullCard.Rules: Aberration (Prevent all non-combat damage that would be dealt to this ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Gareth Ironshot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Long Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Garr
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Garr has +3 ATK while attacking and can attack only heroes.
At the end of each turn, if you have four or fewer Firesworn, flip Garr.
BACK: Garr has +6 ATK while attacking and can attack only heroes.
1 Destroy one of your Firesworn. If you do, it deals 2 fire damage to each hero and ally in target opponent's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Lich King sought to sow the seeds of fear. Let me be the first to show him the Horde fears nothing!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Garrosh Hellscream
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Each ally you control has Assault X, where X is its printed ATK.

Program.FullCard.Name: Garrote
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if your hero has stealth.
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 melee damage to attached character. The controller of a character dealt damage this way can't play abilities this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] The attached character’s controller can play instant abilities in response to this triggered effect.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gartok Skullsplitter
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Gartok Skullsplitter attacks, you may exhaust target armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They are nothing but sheep - easily guided, even to their deaths." - Martiana the Mindwrench
Program.FullCard.Name: Gathering of Wits
Program.FullCard.Rules: Gain control of any number of target opposing allies with combined cost less than or equal to the number of resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Nothing feels better than sending a volley into a group of dwarves."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gatlin Clouds-the-Sky
Program.FullCard.Rules: Gatlin has long-range while attacking exhausted heroes and allies. (Defenders deal no combat damage to him.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The head is the toughest part of the body to penetrate. If you got that beat, then armor is nothing." - Bloody Mary
Program.FullCard.Name: Gauntlets of the Skullsplitter
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally in your party attacks, you may exhaust target armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The bearer of these gauntlets strikes down foes with righteous fury.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gauntlets of Vindication
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your melee weapons have +1 ATK.
If your hero would deal damage with an ability, it deals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't want to know how many experiments it took to make this thing . . ." - Katianna the Shrouded
Program.FullCard.Name: Gavel of the Fleshcrafter
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has Mend 3. (At the start of your turn, it may heal 3 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Gear Upgrade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play Gear Upgrade, destroy one of your equipment.
Search your deck for an equipment card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gehennas
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Gehennas has +2 ATK while attacking and can only attack heroes.
At the end of your turn, Gehennas deals 3 shadow damage to target opposing hero chosen at random. That hero's controller discards a card. Flip Gehennas.
BACK: Gehennas has +2 ATK while attacking and can only attack heroes.
At the end of your turn, Gehennas deals 1 fire damage to each opposing ally. Flip Gehennas.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gehennas's Shadowbolt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 4 shadow damage to target opposing hero or ally. If your hero is Gehennas, each opponent discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even in death, I'll leave a scar upon you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gellrin of the Gallows
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove Gellrin from the game Target player turns one of his quests face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The time has come to put an end to the disruption you have caused to the Scourge."
Program.FullCard.Name: General Lightsbane
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: On your turn: Flip Lightsbane, remove a Death Knight in your graveyard from the game Target ally has -4 ATK this turn.
BACK: Deckbuilding: You can only include either [Alliance] or [Horde] cards, [Death Knight] cards, [Death Knight] Frost Talents, neutral cards, and Scourge cards. You can't include cards with reputations or other text restrictions.

Program.FullCard.Name: Geoffrey Kimble
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
3, Discard a card Destroy target ability or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gerana Sparkfist
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, she deals 1 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: She's the type of ally you always want in front of you.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gertha, The Old Crone
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, , Destroy an ally in your party Destroy target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No, he won't pick on someone his own size.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ghank
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)
When Ghank enters play, you may destroy target exhausted ally with damage on it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ghost Wolf
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Exhaust your hero If your hero is defending, remove all attacking allies from combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The servants of undeath will fight without remorse until they are laid to rest.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ghoul
Gift of Nature
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: Allies in your party can’t be destroyed by fatal damage.
At the end of each turn, destroy all allies in your party with fatal damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I would not advise you to test the limits of the Earthmother." - Harona Proudmane
Program.FullCard.Name: Gift of the Earthmother
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +6/+6.
When attached ally is destroyed, draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gift of the Elven Magi
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, , Exhaust your hero Look at the top card of your deck. If it's an ability card, your may reveal it and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There is always strength in numbers." - Bronson Greatwhisker
Program.FullCard.Name: Gift of the Pious
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Allies you control have +1 / +1 for each Druid and Paladin you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gift of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Allies in your party have +2 ATK / +2 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gifts from the Past
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put any number of target equipment cards from your graveyard into play if their combined cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gilneas
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4 Worgen you control have Assault 2 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fresh from our farm to your plate, it's Smokywood Pasture's wholesome goodness!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gingerbread Cookie
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy Gingerbread Cookie Each hero heals 7 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Faith in your friends will be your undoin', mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ginza Darktusk
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
This ally can't attack unless an opponent controls more allies than you.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The time for practice is over! Show me what you've learned!" - Instructor Razuvious
Program.FullCard.Name: Girdle of Razuvious
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this armor enters play, search your deck for a weapon with cost less than or equal to the number of resourcs you control, put damage on your hero equal to its cost, and put it into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The discord woven between its threads does not distinguish between friend and foe." - Boris Brightbeard
Program.FullCard.Name: Girdle of Ruination
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program - requires 16 Primal Fire, 10 Shadowcloth, 1 Primal Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, destroy the ability, ally, or equipment with the lowest cost. If two or more are tied, destroy all with that cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Girdle of the Blasted Reaches
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Girdle of the Blasted Reaches enters play, look at the top card of your deck. You may put it on the bottom.

Program.FullCard.Name: Girdle of the Endless Pit
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, put 1 damage on your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "By Uther's beard, do not give up. There is still a battle to be fought."
Program.FullCard.Name: Girdle of Uther
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Ready your hero and one of your Melee weapons.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gispax the Mixologist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Time is Money (This ally can use powers immediately.)
, Discard a card Search your deck for a [Nature] card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Givon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Opposing allies have -2 ATK while in combat with Givon.

Program.FullCard.Name: Glacial Bag
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust a Bag you control Add a thaw counter.
, Remove four thaw counters Draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Cursed Stormpike! We will rip you from our home!" - Drek'Thar
Program.FullCard.Name: Glacial Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy Glacial Blade Your hero deals 1 frost damage to target [Alliance] hero or ally. If a hero is dealt damage this way, its controller skips drawing his next card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We make a good team, Sepirion, but I wish you'd bathe."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Addisyn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As Addisyn enters play, choose arcane, fire, frost, nature, or shadow.
Arena allies in your party have the chosen resistance.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Opponents can respond while Addisyn is on the chain as usual. However, once you choose a damage type as he enters play, there's no chance for them to respond before the chosen resistance starts applying.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Did you see that, Addisyn? Can your Light do that?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Boum
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party have ferocity.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Careful - if you overreach, it will spell doom for us."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Dorn
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an Arena ally in your party attacks, it heals 1 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I fight, Skumm, because I want everyone to share the pain of my existence."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Emek
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an Arena ally in your party is destroyed, you may discard a card. If you do, target player discards a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This power triggers off Emek’s own destruction.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It pains me that the only peace I can give Emek is in battle."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Kaniya
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party are protectors.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Lanthus, my dear, seek shelter in these deep shadows."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Katianna
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party are elusive.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Not on my watch!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Keward
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party are protectors.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm not the same novice you knew, Zi'mo"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Kileana
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Kileana or another Arena ally enters your party, it may deal 1 fire damage to each hero and ally other than itself.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This card has received errata. The bold text above updates the printed text, and clarifies that that ally may deal damage to each hero and ally other than itself rather than each hero and ally other than Kileana.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The elements demand I take part in this…bloodsport."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Kinivus
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing card or effect causes you to discard an Arena ally card, you may put it from your graveyard into hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This power triggers only while Kinivus is in play. If you discard two such cards, it triggers twice, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All we do, my sweet Katianna, we do for Teldrasseil."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Lanthus
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party have " Exhaust target ally."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm to fight alongside other draenei? Fortune is kind this day!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Loraala
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party have " This ally deals 3 fire damage to target hero."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Who cares about your trees, Lanthus? There's Horde to kill!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Magnus
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy an Arena ally in your party Turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Only true masters of deception can sneak around with flaming maces."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Meganna
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party have stealth.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'd win this tournament by myself, but I guess a rogue and warrior could come in handy."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Ryno
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Ryno or another Arena ally enters your party, put a Felhunter Demon ally token into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'll show joo who be de real eye of de storm."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Sepirion
Program.FullCard.Rules: When each Arena ally in your party attacks for the first time each turn, you may pay 1. If you do, ready it.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This power triggers when an applicable ally exhausts to attack. It triggers only once per ally per turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Dis arena, Kaniya, dis be a true test."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Skumm
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an Arena ally in your party is dealt damage, you may turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Straight ahead, hard. Dat be my motto."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Zi'mo
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arena allies in your party have +2 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those criminals have my daughter! I have to win if I want to see her again!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator Zophos
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an Arena ally in your party is dealt damage, it deals 3 unpreventable holy damage to its source.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] That ally deals 3 damage even if it was destroyed by the damage that triggered this power.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Aegis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an ally in your party would be dealt non-fatal damage, prevent it.
Exhaust target hero or ally, and it can't ready during its controller's next ready step. Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If damage would be dealt to an ally in your party that would leave that ally's damage at less than its health, prevent it. The target can’t ready during its controller's next ready step even if it was already exhausted. If the target is no longer legal as this effect tries to resolve, you don’t draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If your friends ask, tell them you were mauled by a bear." - Ryno
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Maul
Program.FullCard.Rules: You can place the top card of your deck face down (as your one resource per turn.).

Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Regalia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Opposing allies lose and can't have powers.
Your hero deals 2 fire damage to target hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Each armor set is one card with five uniqueness tags: Chest (1), Hands (1), Head (1), Legs (1), and Shoulder (1). Controlling any other armor with one of these tags causes a uniqueness violation as normal.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Salvation
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Exhaust your hero Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target hero or ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Sanctuary
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you place a resource, you may put the top card of your deck into your resource row face down and ready.
Attach a Balance ability token with three wind counters to target hero or ally. That ability had "Attached character can't attack or protect. At the start of your turn, remove a wind counter. If none remain, destroy this ability."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That ogre looks vicious, but I'm putting my money on the clever one." - Grikkin Copperspring
Program.FullCard.Name: Gladiator's Spellblade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, put a spell counter on Gladiator's Spellblade.
If your hero would deal damage, it deals that much +1 for each spell counter instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Woe to those who choose to stand against the glaive.
Program.FullCard.Name: Glaive of the Pit
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes have -5 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Fortune and the Light favor the bold.
Program.FullCard.Name: Glimmer of Hope
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target ability card that's targeting a card in play you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gloves of Calculated Risk
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to play equipment, to a minimum of 1.
Weapons you control have +1 ATK, and other armor you control have +1 [DEF].
When this armor is destroyed, destroy all equipment you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gloves of Immortal Dusk
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Fields of Honor) - requires 2 Primal Air, 2 Primal Fire, 2 Primal Earth, 2 Primal Water, 2 Primal Mana, 4 Primal Shadow, 7 Heavy Knothide Leather, 4 Fel Hide, 2 Sunmote
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Gloves of Immortal Dusk enters play, you may put the top card of your deck into your resource row face down and exhausted.
When Gloves of Immortal Dusk is destroyed, you may destroy target resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Admire them for just a moment, and you will see a rare glimpse into a piece of life frozen in time." - Lunira Swiftbreath
Program.FullCard.Name: Gloves of the Frozen Glade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3, Ready your hero and all Melee weapons you control>
Death Rattle: Your hero has Stealth this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gloves of the High Magus
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Remove the top card of your deck from the game If it's an ability, ally, or equipment card, you may play it this turn if able. If it's a quest card, you may place it this turn if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are times in battle when the enemy of my enemy is my friend." - Marlowe Christophers
Program.FullCard.Name: Gloves of Token Respect
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn: 2 Put a 1 [Nature] / 1 [Health] Spider ally token into play.
, Destroy this armor Put a copy of target ally token into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Once called home by the gnomes, Gnomeregan's halls are now roamed by mutant troggs.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gnomeregan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Gnome Hero Required
Gnomes in your party are irradiated. (When this character deals combat damage to an ally that's not irradiated, it becomes irradiated.)
Destroy target irradiated ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gnomeregan Auto-Blocker 600
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, put a Blocker ally token into play with 0 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It's Landro-licious.
Program.FullCard.Name: Goblin Gumbo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has -2 ATK.
When Goblin Gumbo enters a graveyard from play, put it from that graveyard on top of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Goblin Rocket Launcher
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Drums of War) - 6 Primal Fire, 6 Primal Earth, 2 Khorium Power Core, 2 Hardened Adamantite Tube, 4 Felsteel Bar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Engineering Hero Required
Remove the top card of your deck from the game. Your hero deals ranged damage equal to that card's cost to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fine, fine! Don't say I never did anything for you!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gobloz
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
When an ally in your party is dealt damage, Gobloz may deal 1 fire damage to the source of that damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gok Stormhammer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long-Range
When Gok enters play, he deals 3 nature damage divided as you choose to any number of target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "An unprepared target is a welcome one."
Program.FullCard.Name: Golas Swiftwind
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Golad readies, exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This one is Snowball, and this one is Hammy, and this one is Sticky Toes, and this one is..."
Program.FullCard.Name: Goldenmoon
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
You can have an additional Pet while your Pets have different names.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If Goldenmoon is in your party, you can have up to two Pets with different names in your party. If two Goldenmoons are in your party, you can have up to three Pets with different names in your party, and so on. Having two Pets in your party with the same name causes a uniqueness violation, as does Goldenmoon leaving your party while you have the maximum number of Pets.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A trophy from the golem Panzer, bouncer for the Grim Guzzler.
Program.FullCard.Name: Golem Skull Helm
Golemagg the Incinerator
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Golemagg has +5 ATK while attacking and can attack only heroes.
At the end of your turn, Golemagg deals 3 fire damage to target opposing hero or ally.
At the start of your turn, if Golemagg has 15 or more damage, flip him.
BACK: Golemagg has +5 while attacking and can attack only heroes.
When Golemagg is dealt damage, he deals 5 melee damage to the source of that damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gone Fishin'
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 2, Draw three cards and skip your next turn. Use only on your turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] To skip a turn is to replace that turn with nothing. If two modifiers each tell a player to skip his or her next turn, that player skips his or her next two turns, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Master of weapons. Devoid of mercy.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gorebelly
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Gorebelly You pay 3 less the next time you strike with a Melee weapon this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The axe of Grom Hellscream has sown terror across hundreds of battlefields.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gorehowl
Gor'gar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Gor'gar enters play with an ankh counter.
While Gor'gar has an ankh counter, when he's destroyed, you may have his owner put him from his graveyard into play, then remove his ankh counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do you see how quickly nature can dismantle even the most powerful weapons?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Goru Thornmane
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assault 2
When this ally deals damage while attacking, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gorz Blazefist
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ferocity (This ally can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Every being has vulnerable spots; make it your business to know them all." -The assassin's Creed, Chapter 2
Program.FullCard.Name: Gouge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust target hero or ally. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Name: Gouge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust target hero or ally. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest battles are won not by strength of arm, but strength of will.
Program.FullCard.Name: Graccus
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Graccus Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target hero or ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grace of Air Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Totem (Can be attacked or targeted like an ally.)
Ongoing: Opposing allies can't attack your heroes, allies, or Totems unless their controller pays 1 for each attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Scourge could learn a thing or two about strategy and cunning. I can see them coming from a mile away."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gramm Thunderjaw
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Gramm, discard a Hunter This turn, target ally has +2 ATK, and a second target ally has -2 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Humanity must bring the Light to the darkest ends of Azeroth."
Program.FullCard.Name: Grand Marshal Goldensword
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 5, Flip Goldensword Target ally deals holy damage to itself equal to its ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You wouldn't hurt a harmless old lady, would you?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grandma Deadsie
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Grandma Deadsie.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grazzle Grubhook
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Time is Money (This ally can use powers immediately.)
Draw a card, then discard a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Native to Draenor, the chosen mount of the Draenei inspires all those who ride it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Great Elekk
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Draenei Hero Required
You pay 1 less to complete quests.
When you place a resource face up, this turn, if your hero would deal damage, it deals that much +2 instead.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Tauren riding Kodos give new meaning to the word "stampede."
Program.FullCard.Name: Great Kodo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Tauren Hero Required
You pay 1 less to complete quests.
When you place a resource face up, you may exhaust target card in play.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Everything's connected.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greater Chain Heal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target up to five heroes and/or allies. Your hero heals 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1 damage from them, respectively.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] You can’t target the same character twice. Amounts are locked in as you target. For example, if you target two characters, your hero will heal 5 and 4 damage from them, respectively. If the character you targeted for 5 becomes illegal in response, your hero heals 4 damage from the remaining legal character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't stand so close to me!" - The last words of Sordin Gumner, lead singer of the Azeroth Authority
Program.FullCard.Name: Greater Chain Lightning
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target up to five heroes and/or allies. Your hero deals 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1 nature damage to them, respectively.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Damage amounts are assigned to targets as you play Greater Chain Lightning.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As long as you're not dead, you'll be as good as new.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greater Heal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 14 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You're quite the helper to ol' Greatfather Winter."
Program.FullCard.Name: Greatfather Winter
Program.FullCard.Rules: 0 Put a card from your hand into target player's hand. Use only once per turn. (He owns that card for the rest of the game.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mmmm . . . Gingerbread cookies and milk!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Great-father Winter
Program.FullCard.Notes: Exclusive to Feast of Winter Veil Collector's Set
Program.FullCard.Rules: 0 Target player gains control of target ability, ally, or equipment you control. Use only once per turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Bestowed by the Lich King on those who willingly spread the disease of undeath.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greathelm of the Scourge Champion
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Greathelm of the Scourge Champion is destroyed, you may put it from its owner's graveyard into his hand at the start of the next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Some visions are better left unseen.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greatsword of Forlorn Visions
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Greatsword of Forlorn Visions, put a +1 DEF counter on each of your armor.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You add one counter to each of your armor for each packet of combat damage your hero deals with this weapon, regardless of the size of that packet.

Program.FullCard.Name: Greatsword of Horrid Dreams
Program.FullCard.Rules: As an ally enters play under an opponent's control, it loses and can't have powers until the start of that opponent's next turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] While you control Greatsword, an ally loses its powers as the first part of entering play under an opponent’s control. As a result, it loses any powers that trigger off it entering play, or that would cause it to enter play exhausted or with damage or counters. If that ally has a power that triggers at the start of that opponent’s next turn, it triggers then. An ally doesn’t regain any lost powers as Greatsword leaves play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest instrument of vengeance for the Knights of the Ebon Blade.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greatsword of the Ebon Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Greatsword of the Ebon Blade enters play, at the start of the next turn, destroy it unless you pay 3.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What better way to kick some arse than with these?" - Triton the Sacrilegious
Program.FullCard.Name: Greaves of Ancient Evil
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When damage is prevented with this armor,
[Death Knight] Hero: Ready a weapon you control.
[Paladin] Hero: Ready another armor you control.
[Warrior] Hero: Ready your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: These greaves protect more than just the wearer."
Program.FullCard.Name: Greaves of Desolation
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with a weapon, your hero heals all damage from target ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "To some, reputations are best used when spent like gold."
Program.FullCard.Name: Greed Before Need
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: You can play equipment cards from other players' graveyards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: He takes delight in the misery of others.
Program.FullCard.Name: Greefer
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents can't complete quests.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] To complete a quest is to add its completion effect to the chain. Greefer’s power has no impact on completion effects already on the chain.

Program.FullCard.Name: Green Hills of Stranglethorn, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put all revealed cards named The Green Hills of Stranglethorn into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Famously used by the druid Snig in battles for Warsong Gulch.
Program.FullCard.Name: Green Whelp Armor
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an attacking ally deals combat damage to your hero, you may pay 2. If you do, put that ally into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Not enough for you?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Gregory Flamewaker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Assault 3 (+3 ATK on your turn)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The sky itself trembles at his call.
Program.FullCard.Name: Grennan Stormspeaker
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Flip Grennan Stormspeaker Grennan deals 3 nature damage to target hero or ally and heals 3 damage from target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grim Campfire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When an opposing ally is destroyed, add a fuel counter to this equipment.
At the end of your turn, your hero may heal 1 damage from each friendly hero and ally for each fuel counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My reach extends into your soul." - Forang Deathrattle
Program.FullCard.Name: Grim Reach
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Affliction Hero Required
Opposing heroes and allies have -1 health this turn for each ongoing ability you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You better back me up on this one!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grimdron
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
1, Grimdoom deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grimtotem Weapon, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top five cards of your deck. Put a revealed equipment into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Catch a glimpse of your eternity."
Program.FullCard.Name: Grindel Hellbringer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Grindel Grindel deals 1 fire damage to each hero and ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Boom!
Program.FullCard.Name: Grint Sundershot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents can't strike with weapons on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grip of the Damned
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target opposing ally or weapon on the bottom of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: There is a hefty price to pay to wear the garb of the damned.
Program.FullCard.Name: Grips of Damnation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 melee damage to each hero.
2 This turn, prevent all damage that would be dealt this way. Any player can use the power.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The forces of nature are at his beck and call.
Program.FullCard.Name: Grismare
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy an ally token in your party Grismare deals nature damage equal to that token's ATK to target hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Damage is dealt equal to the ATK that token had as it left play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Grizlik Sparkhex
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 2 Flip Grizlik. BACK: You can control an additional Pet.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Nap time is over.
Program.FullCard.Name: Grizzly Defender
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Ready heroes and allies in your party have +2 ATK.
Your hero is in bear form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will have my revenge on the Lich King and any who stand in my way!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grogmar Deathgore
Program.FullCard.Rules: Grogmar has ferocity while you have a weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stick with me, and you'll find out just how useful you can be."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gromble the Apt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Find Treasure (When this ally enters play, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.)
Your hero can be exhausted to pay costs as though it were a resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The elements will ensure our safe passage." - Zorin
Program.FullCard.Name: Grounding Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Opposing cards and effects must target Grounding Totem if able.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Grounding Totem is a “magnet.” While a magnet is in play, any opponent who adds a link with one or more targets must choose that magnet as one of those targets if it can be legally chosen. If two or more magnets are in play, that player must choose so as to include the maximum possible number of magnets.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If brute force doesn't work, you aren't using enough."
Program.FullCard.Name: Groundshaker Earnheart
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Earnheart is dealt damage, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We must embrace the Earth Mother if we are to rid the land of the Scourge."
Program.FullCard.Name: Grovemender Ash'lon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Mend 3 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 3 damage from target hero or ally.)
When this ally heals damage, you may draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sen'zir reached back to her quiver and pulled out...nothing. She'd struck this beast with every arrow she had, and still it stood.
Program.FullCard.Name: Growing Rage
Program.FullCard.Rules: Draw X cards, where X is the current stage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Come closer, I dare ya!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grudum, Trove Guardian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Find Treasure (When this ally enters play, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stay out of my way, fool!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grugthar Sharpblade
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, choose a hero or ally in your party. Other characters can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Did you really think such a small hindrance could stay the hand of death?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Grumdur Bladebane
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Each opposing ally has -1 ATK during its controller's turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Protecting your companions is often the same as protecting yourself."
Program.FullCard.Name: Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Grumpherys Your Pets are elusive and untargetable this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The harsh wilds of Durotar breed some of the strongest warriors in all of Azeroth.
Program.FullCard.Name: Grunt Baranka
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Grunt Baranka defends against an ally, destroy her. If you do, destroy all attacking allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Speak with me when you're ready to go."
Program.FullCard.Name: Gryth Thurden, Gryphon Master
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Gryth has +1 ATK / +1 health while you have a location.
Ready target location.

Program.FullCard.Name: Guard Duty
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The naaru watch over us all."
Program.FullCard.Name: Guarded by the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Guardian Steelhoof
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)
This ally can't attack.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Every tauren vows to keep safe the golden plains of Mulgore.
Program.FullCard.Name: Guardian Steelhorn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Guardian Steelhorn can't attack.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the Earth Mother watch over you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Guardian Steppestrider
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Guardian Steppestrider can't attack.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let them come! I can take it!" - Emmi Sprinklestrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Guardian's Plate Bracers
Program.FullCard.Rules: Preparation (On your first turn, you may play this card without paying its cost.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Gurok must be summoned. You summon Gurok and you destroy." - Gordawg
Program.FullCard.Name: Gurok the Usurper
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one of your quests. Gurok the Usurper has that quest's powers this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A relic of the Gurubashi Empire, the goblin cartels have confiscated it for use in their games." - Explorers' Guild Guide to the Eastern Kingdoms
Program.FullCard.Name: Gurubashi Arena
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally in your party is an Arena ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is perfectly suited for hitting small, stout targets.
Program.FullCard.Name: Gurubashi Dwarf Destroyer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with Gurubashi Dwarf Destroyer, your hero has long-range this combat.
2, Destroy Gurubashi Dwarf Destroyer Destroy target Dwarf ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the naaru guide my aim."
Program.FullCard.Name: Guruvan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Long-Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Gurzuk
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You choose an ally card in your graveyard as the completion effect resolves. If you successfully remove an ally card from your graveyard each time you complete a quest with this name, you draw one card the first time you do so, two cards the second time you do so, and so on. Only cards removed during the current game are counted.

Program.FullCard.Name: Hearthstone
Program.FullCard.Rules: 6, , Concede the game Players can keep any of their equipment and start the next game with those cards in play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 11/6/2006] Hearthstone has a payment power with conceding the game as part of its cost. Using that power is called "hearthing" and follows the rules below, parts of which are exceptions to other rules: A player may hearth any time he or she has priority. In a multi-player game, hearthing concedes the game for an entire team, so a player must have the unanimous permission of all remaining players in his or her team in order to hearth.; Hearthing does not add a link to the chain, so it can't be responded to or interrupted. Rather, a modifier is created as part of paying the cost. That modifier affects all players remaining in the game, including the hearthing player.; As that modifier is created, each affected player chooses any number of equipment he or she controls, then that game ends. The hearthing player may choose Hearthstone. As that game ends, any effects remaining on the chain are interrupted.; Chosen equipment stays in play between games, keeps any counters, and continues to count towards deck totals for the next game. All other cards are shuffled into decks and may be sided out between games as usual. Hearthing during the final game of a match does nothing except end that game.

Program.FullCard.Name: Himul Longstrider
Program.FullCard.Rules: War Stomp (When this ally attacks or defends, you may exhaust target opposing hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Asps - very dangerous - you go first." - Zallah
Program.FullCard.Name: Hissy
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
When Hissy enters play, he deals 1 nature damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No secret is safe from the Scryers.
Program.FullCard.Name: Historian Firana
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor card in your deck.)
Stealth
Opponents play with their hands revealed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The lumbering brutes of the Scourge don't stand a chance against our speed and quickness." - Zorak'tul
Program.FullCard.Name: Hit and Run
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust up to X target opposing cards, where X is the number of Rogues and Shaman you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If we work together, then we are sure to have greater success against the Scourge." - Joren the Martyr
Program.FullCard.Name: Holy Barrier
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target ally this turn, where X is the number of Paladins and Priests you control.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and your hero deals 2 holy damage to it. That damage can't be prevented.
Ongoing: At the start of each turn, your hero deals 1 holy damage to attached character. That damage can't be prevented.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I watched as the Light poured over its body, leaving the once-vile creature as nothing more than a pile of ash." - Thoros the Savior
Program.FullCard.Name: Holy Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 unpreventable holy damage to target ally. If that ally has fatal damage, destroy any number of abilities attached to a card you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Not all blessings come in the form of a Power Word." - Marta Spires
Program.FullCard.Name: Holy Guardian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Damage that this ally would deal is unpreventable.
If shadow ([Shadow]) damage would be dealt, prevent all but 1 of it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The third and most important of the Light's virtues is compassion." - Uther the Lightbringer
Program.FullCard.Name: Holy Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero heals 5 damage from target hero or ally.
Draw a card.

Holy Hero Required

Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt to your hero by target hero or ally this turn. When damage is prevented this way, your hero deals that amount of holy damage to that character.

Holy Hero Required
Prevent the next 4 damage that target friendly hero or ally would be dealt this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Two parts holy, two parts melee, all parts pain.

Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage and 2 unpreventable holy damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fools! You think you can defeat me in my lair?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Home Lair Advantage
Program.FullCard.Rules: This turn, Onyxia can't be targeted by opponents, and your cards can't be interrupted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It can be hard to keep a clear head in the heat of battle." - Dralor

Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally you control with Assault deals combat damage to an opponent's hero, he discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: He doesn't mean it when he blocks your view.

Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes and allies have -1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The ruthless grip of despair offers no salvation.

Program.FullCard.Name: Horace Shadowfall

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The whispers in my ear are those of the Nether, hungering for your energy."

Program.FullCard.Name: Horkin Figluster
Program.FullCard.Rules:
War Stomp (When this ally attacks or defends, you may exhaust target hero or ally.)
When Horkin enters play, exhaust all opposing heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Eranikus lies trapped in the Emerald Dream amidst chaos and nightmare.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Make your choice!" - Witch Doctoe Koo'zar

Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player destroys an ally in his party. If he does, your hero heals damage from itself equal to that ally's cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Hota the Bloodsoaked
Program.FullCard.Rules: Hota has protector while an opponent has more allies than you.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even the steaming goo that flows in Hive'Ashi won't melt thorium. I'm getting out of here!" - Savin Lightguard
Program.FullCard.Name: Hotter Than Goo
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy all of target opponent's abilities, allies, and equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Hourglass of the Unraveller
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to play equipment, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I got yer back."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hovin the Shield

Protector
3 Ready Hovin.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How fortuitous! Usually I must leave my lair in order to feed."

Program.FullCard.Name: Hoxie Mettlemelt
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, Hoxie deals 2 fire damage to target opposing hero or ally for each Fire ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Send me back."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hukkath
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
1, Destroy Hukkath Your hero is untargetable this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The only way to stop these hulking monstrosities is to tear them to pieces." - Crusade Commander Entari

Scourge Hero Required
Protector
1, Remove an Unlimited card in your graveyard from the game This ally heals all damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The path is clear. Follow my marks, and you'll be fine."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hulok Trailblazer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you place a quest, Hulok deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have learned how to withstand the crushing blows of shadow, but I still have so much to learn."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hulstom, Servant of the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that this ally would be dealt.)
Mend 1 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 1 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've got you covered." - Warrax
Program.FullCard.Name: Human Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules: If damage would be dealt to an ally you control this turn, it's dealt to your hero instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Who's using whom?
Program.FullCard.Name: Hungering Bone Cudgel
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, if no damage was dealt with Hungering Bone Cudgel this turn, destroy it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Hunter Training

Attach to target friendly ally.
Ongoing: When an opposing ally enters play, attached ally deals 1 ranged damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Ah, there you are…" - Sharpshooter Nally
Program.FullCard.Name: Hunter's Mark
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: If attached hero would be dealt ranged or [Ranged] damage, it's dealt that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Accept your weaknesses and turn them into strengths."
Program.FullCard.Name: Huntress Xenia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Inspiring Presence (If a hero or ally in your party would deal non-combat damage, it deals that much +1 instead.)
At the start of each opponent's turn, target ally is a protector this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Strength and honor."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hur Shieldsmasher
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Hur Shieldsmasher enters play, you may destroy target armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It will take more than that to lay my spirit to rest."
Program.FullCard.Name: Hurdan the Everlasting
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play a non-Ongoing [Priest] ability, if this ally is in your graveyard, you may pay 2. If you do, put him into play.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long-Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)
When Hurlorn Battlechaser enters play, he deals 2 ranged damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Smash, smash, smash - dis be too much fun."
Program.FullCard.Name: Huro'shal Gutwrench

Ongoing: This ability enters play with two wind counters.
Opposing heroes and allies can't attack or protect.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 nature damage to each opposing hero and ally, then remove a wind counter. If none remain, destroy this ability.

Program.FullCard.Name: Huruk Lightvow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can help you with that."
Program.FullCard.Name: Huzrula

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The thrusts and slashes of her blade were mesmerizing, making defense a challenge.
Program.FullCard.Name: Hypnotic Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, , Exhaust your hero Target player discards a card. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You would be surprised how far you can push yourself when your sanity has been stripped." - Krog Deathfist
Program.FullCard.Name: Hysteria

Blood Hero Required
Ongoing: , Put 1 damage on a hero or ally you control It has Assault 4 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "…what I am now is a farmer." - Oronok Torn-heart

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Dat's da chill of death you feel, mon." - Warmaster Bo'jo
Program.FullCard.Name: Ice Barbed Spear
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent can't draw cards unless he pays 1 for each card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Cards are drawn one at a time, so if an opponent would draw two cards, for example, he may pay (1) to draw one of them, look at it, and then decide whether to pay another (1) to draw the second.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Da grigid cold will slow your actions and our mind." - Zi'mo
Program.FullCard.Name: Ice Barbs
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Each opponent can't draw cards unless he pays 1 for each card.

At the start of your turn, destroy Ice Block

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's hard to nail a moving target. An immobile one, though…Now that's a different story." - Velindra Sepulchre
Program.FullCard.Name: Ice Lance
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 frost damage to target ally, or 6 if that ally is ready.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Northrend's frozen landscape provides me with quite the powerful tools." - "Black Ice" Fizzlefreeze
Program.FullCard.Name: Ice Nova
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only on an opponent's turn.
His abilities, allies, equipment, and hero can't attack or exhaust this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ice Trap

Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Your hero deals 3 frost damage to target attacker. Remove a character dealt damage this way from combat.

Program.FullCard.Name: Iceblade Hacker

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "De chill of death is in da air."
Program.FullCard.Name: Icemistress Gal'ha
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by one for each Frost ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You may as well get used to the cold. We are going to be in Northrend for a while. - Morganis Blackvein
Program.FullCard.Name: Iceshear Mantle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target [Frost] card has Assault 2 this turn. (It has +2 ATK on your turn.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The howling winds of Northrend will surely stop even the dead in their tracks." - Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Name: Iceshrieker's Touch
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When your hero turns face down, it deals 1 frost damage to each opposing hero and ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack or exhaust this turn.
Death Rattle: Each player turns his hero face up.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For this restorative salve, you must use a simple formula: one part poison, two parts cure." - Ogtinc
Program.FullCard.Name: Ichor of Undeath, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put target ally from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Icon of the Silver Crescent
Program.FullCard.Rules: If a non-token ally in your party would be destroyed, attach it to a hero instead. That ally loses all powers and becomes an ability with "At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to attached hero."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The last remnant of a once-powerful dragon.
Program.FullCard.Name: Icy Blast Amulet
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Death Knight, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero is dealt damage on an opponent's turn, you may pay 1. If you do, it deals 1 frost damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The leatherworkers of Dalaran have really outdone themselves this time." - Prometha
Program.FullCard.Name: Icy Scale Chestguard
Program.FullCard.Rules: If a friendly hero or ally would deal frost ([Frost]) damage, it deals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The frozen touch of death will take your strength, your morale, and eventually your life." - Erandra Frostmoon
Program.FullCard.Name: Icy Torment
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 frost damage to attached hero.
When damage is dealt this way, target ally in attached hero's party has -2 ATK this turn.

Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 frost damage to attached hero.
Allies in attached hero's party have -1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How can you freeze magi in their tracks when their veins are already filled with ice water?!" - Pidge Filthfinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Icy Veins

Frost Hero Required
Ongoing: Skip your draw step.
At the start of your turn, target opponent chooses a hero or ally in his party, and your hero deals 5 frost damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the light of Elune bring you safety and comfort." - Eriun Moonglow
Program.FullCard.Name: Idol of the Shooting Star

2, Your hero heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.
When you play an ally, ready this item.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Afraid of da shadow and flame? Don't make me laugh."
Program.FullCard.Name: Iku'tak

Fire Resistance (Prevent all fire or [Fire] damage that this ally would be dealt.)
Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow or [Shadow] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Night Elf Hero Required
Elusive
Put your hand on the bottom of your deck, then draw that many cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fire, fool?! I have faced the red dragons of the Second War!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Illia the Bitter
Program.FullCard.Rules: Fire Resistance (Prevent all fire [Fire] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Feel the hatred of ten thousand years!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Illidan Stormrage

Traitor Hero Required
At the start of your turn, you may put a Traitor ally card from your collection into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Their souls are committed to the darkest of purposes.
Program.FullCard.Name: Illidari Archon

Traitor Hero Required
When Illidari Archon attacks, you may ready one of your resources.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This world belongs to the Illidari."
Program.FullCard.Name: Illidari Blood Lord

Traitor Hero Required
When Illidari Blood Lord enters play, each player turns one of his face-up resources face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is a blade with but one purpose.
Program.FullCard.Name: Illidari-Bane Mageblade
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero would deal damage to a Demon, it deals double that much instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those who serve the Silverwing Sentinels shall be richly rewarded."
Program.FullCard.Name: Illiyana Moonblaze

Program.FullCard.Name: Illumination

Holy Hero Required
