Totem (Can be attacked or targeted like an ally.)
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, draw a card for each hero and ally in your party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You don’t draw a card for each Totem in your party ,because a Totem is not an ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Past accomplishments can have present implications.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mana-Etched Crown
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ability card from your graveyard into your resource row face down and exhausted. Use only if you have seven or more cards in hand,

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The subtle hues deceive the onlooker into believing the runes that adorn these pants are only decorative.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mana-Etched Pantaloons
Program.FullCard.Rules: Draw a card. Use only if you have seven or more cards in your hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Use this power only if your have seven or more cards in your hand as you activate this card. It doesn’t matter how many cards are in your hand as this effect resolves.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mana-Etched Spaulders
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 1 damage from itself for each of your armor with Mana-Etched in its name.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Overflowing power has to go somewhere.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mana-Etched Vestments
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally. Use only if you have seven or more cards in hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You can help our information gathering efforts by obtaining a personnel roster." - Spymaster Thalodien
Program.FullCard.Name: Manaforge B'naar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Manaspark Gloves
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, if a player has fewer cards in hand than each other player, he draws a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Hand sizes are compared before you draw a card in your draw step. If there’s a tie for fewest cards in hand, this effect does nothing.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The energy within attracted the ravenous hunger of Zereketh the Unbound
Program.FullCard.Name: Mana-Sphere Shoulderguards
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opponent discards a card, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to each hero and ally in that opponent’s party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Did you find the Collector? Did you discover whom he's working for?" - Marshal Dughan
Program.FullCard.Name: Manhunt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose one: Name an ally card, then target player reveals his hand and discards a card with that name; or draw a card. If your hero is a Human, you may choose both.

Program.FullCard.Name: Manthos the Recently Sewn
Program.FullCard.Rules: Manthos enters play with 3 damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Manticron Cube
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust a hero or ally in your party Attach this Cube to that character while that character remains exhausted. Only a raiding player can use this power, and only on his turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The perfect servants for a ruthless master.
Program.FullCard.Name: Marauding Geist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
This ally can't attack unless there is at least one card in each graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Marcus Dominar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)
Aberration (Prevent all non-combat damage that would be dealt to this ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Perseverance will be key to our ultimate victory."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mardun Valorhearth
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mend 4 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 4 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sabotage can stop a battle before it even starts.
Program.FullCard.Name: Margaret Fowl
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to strike with weapons.
Opponents pay 1 more to strike with weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I am the arm of the Light in battle. I know my path. Can you say the same?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Marilyn of the Sacred Vows
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Marius Jator
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long-Range (When this ally attacks, defenders deal no combat damage to it.)
Once on each of your turns: 1 This ally has Assault 3 and loses and can't have Long-Range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You have been chosen. - Dorn the Tranquil
Program.FullCard.Name: Mark of Life
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +2 / +2 and Mend 1. (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 1 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Mark of the Untamed
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +1 / +1 and Nature Resistance. (Prevent all nature ([Nature]) damage that would be dealt to it.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May Cenarius smile upon you." - Archdruid Hamuul Runetotem
Program.FullCard.Name: Mark of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +2 ATK and +2 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A ghoulish future awaits you." - Triton the Sacrilegious
Program.FullCard.Name: Mark of Undeath
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly non-token ally.
Ongoing: When attached ally is destroyed, put a 3 [Melee] / 3 [Health] Ghoul ally token into play.
When attached ally is destroyed, put this ability from its owner's graveyard into play attached to target friendly non-token ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are fragile draenei machines in these ruins, which I must retrieve." - Maxx A. Million Mk. V
Program.FullCard.Name: Mark V Is Alive!
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a Mechanical ally token named Mark V into play with 0 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and "At the start of your turn, Mark V deals 5 melee damage to target hero or ally."

Program.FullCard.Name: Marka Addington
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, Marka deals 3 fire damage to herself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Once marked, there can be no escape.
Program.FullCard.Name: Marked for Death
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target opposing hero or ally.
Ongoing: Allies in your party have +1 ATK while attacking attached character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you wish to prove yourself to the Aldor, bring me the insignias of low-ranking Legion and their Shadow Council followers." - Adyen the Lightwarden
Program.FullCard.Name: Marks of Kil'jaeden
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
If an ally with inspire is in your party, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Marksman Boriz
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
Long Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)
Opposing heroes and allies lose and can't have long-range.

Program.FullCard.Name: Marksman Eowan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)
Long-Range
When an opposing ally is dealt non-ranged damage, Eowan deals 1 Ranged damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "To do what needs to be done, you have to know where to do it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Marksman Glous
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
Inspire: Quest
When a quest is inspired this way, you pay 1 less to complete it this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Protect Halaa at all costs!" - Quartermaster Davian Vaclav
Program.FullCard.Name: Marksman's Legguards
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy Marksman's Legguards Target ally has long-range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The curse's effect is only temporary. Your death will not be."
Program.FullCard.Name: Marlowe Christophers
Program.FullCard.Rules: 6, Flip Marlowe Target hero or ally has -5 health this turn. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is your death, not your life, that I require."
Program.FullCard.Name: Marlowe the Felsworn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
2, Flip Marlowe, destroy a friendly ally Target hero or ally has -X health this turn, where X is that friendly ally's health. Use only on your turn.
Cult of the Dark Strand

Program.FullCard.Name: Marnie Moonlight
Program.FullCard.Rules: Marnie heals 5 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: All owe debt to the knight who gave his life to reveal the dark secret of Lady Katrana Prestor.
Program.FullCard.Name: Marshal Reginald Windsor
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Destroy Marshal Reginald Windsor Destroy target ally with cost 7 or more.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Postpone the funeral."
Program.FullCard.Name: Marta Spires
Program.FullCard.Rules: 6, Flip Marta Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'll come for ye at your darkest hour."
Program.FullCard.Name: Martiana the Mindwrench
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Martiana Target player discards a card if he already discarded a card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your master won't be able to resurrect you this time, Kel'Thuzad. The shadows will consume every trace that you even existed."
Program.FullCard.Name: Martiana the Mindwrench
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Martiana Target player discards a card if he already discarded a card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Martyr's Mending
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals any amount of damage from other friendly heroes and allies. Put that much damage on your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those who fight alongside me will quickly find themselves with the advantage."
Program.FullCard.Name: Marundal the Kindred
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each ally has ATK and health equal to its cost, and can't gain or lose ATK or health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Masons Fraternity Ring
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has +1 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Name: Masquerade Gown
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally in your party becomes a copy of a second target ally in your party this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] If either target is illegal on resolution, nothing happens. As a card becomes a copy of a second card, the first card loses all of its printed information, and then its printed information becomes identical to that of the second card. The first card is still the same card. Any links targeting it continue to do so. Modifiers to that card still apply within their durations, but they modify its new printed information. If a non-token card becomes a copy of a token, that card doesn’t become a token, and vice versa.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The bonds of magic shatter like broken glass in the grasp of an experienced priest.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mass Dispel
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy any number of abilities.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mass of McGowan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mass of McGowan has +2 ATK while your hero is attacking an ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Their power is nothin' but an easily scattered illusion, bruddah." - Kil'zin of the Bloodscalp
Program.FullCard.Name: Mass Purge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy any number of abilities that aren't attached to friendly cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: First they tire, then they expire.
Program.FullCard.Name: Massacre
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, remove up to five Combo cards in your graveyard from the game.
Destroy X target exhausted allies, where X is the number of cards removed this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Masten Everspirit
Program.FullCard.Notes: UDE Card Preview, Errata: Clarified to state it goes into its owner’s hand from the graveyard.
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Masten Everspirit is destroyed, you may put him from his owner's graveyard into his hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Cannon Master Willey's very own.
Program.FullCard.Name: Master Cannoneer Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Master Cannoneer Boots Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Be flexible and ready to react to a changing battlefield." - Oakenclaw
Program.FullCard.Name: Master Instinct
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero is in bear form.
This turn, your hero loses bear form and is in cat form while you control Master Instinct.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "In all the worlds, lads, there are only ever a few dozen yards that matter."
Program.FullCard.Name: Master Marksman McGee
Program.FullCard.Rules: [Ranged] allies in your party have long-range.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Word of your deeds has spread far and wide, rogue. So far, in fact, that Stormwind Intelligence has asked for you by name."
Program.FullCard.Name: Master Mathias Shaw
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)
When an ally in your party deals combat damage to a defending hero, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The most skilled of rogues can hide even in plain sight.
Program.FullCard.Name: Master of Deception
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Subtlety Hero Required
Ongoing: Your hero has stealth. (Can't protect against it.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A well trained pet is a powerful extension of the hunter's body. Like its master, it's frightening to behold in combat.
Program.FullCard.Name: Master of the Hunt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your Pets have +2 ATK and +2 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A little dab of this, a little pinch of that, and voila! A masterpiece!" - Tysandri Duskstrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Master Poisoner
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assassination Hero Required
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play poisons.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 nature damage to each opposing hero and ally for each Poison attached to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "No treats until you get me out of here!" - Shaii, Strategist Supreme
Program.FullCard.Name: Master's Call
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you control a Pet, destroy any number of abilities attached to your hero.
While you control a Pet this turn, your hero has Untargetable, and Pets you control can protect your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You and I are not that different. It's just a matter of how willing our pets are to serve us." - Felbender Lara
Program.FullCard.Name: Master's Stable
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: You can control an additional Pet.
Pets you control have +1 / +1 for each Hunter and Warlock you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is said the greatest weaponsmiths leave a piece of themselves in every weapon they create.
Program.FullCard.Name: Masterwork Stormhammer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Your hero deals 1 nature damage to each of up to three target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stay hidden. I'll pick up the trail."
Program.FullCard.Name: Matalo Trailfinder
Program.FullCard.Rules: Matalo has +1 ATK while attacking for each quest you have.

Program.FullCard.Name: Matter of Time, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 6 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards. If you control ten or more resources, draw another two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Cats pounce, bears trounce.
Program.FullCard.Name: Maul
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has +1 ATK this turn.
Ongoing: Your hero is in bear form. (Has protector. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Maxum Ironbrew
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Maxum Ironbrew defends, he heals 2 damage from himself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Keep them off me. I bruise easily!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Mayla Finksputter
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Escape Artist (When this ally becomes targeted by an opposing card or effect, you may put it into its owner's hand.)
When Mayla leaves play, you may draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Many authorities on fel magic have thoroughly calculated that it will ultimately consume all who attempt to master it. Until that day arrives, though - woohoo!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Mazar
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Mazar, remove a Pet card in your graveyard from the game Destroy target ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This meaningless exertion bores me. I'll incinerate you all from above."
Program.FullCard.Name: Meaningless Exertion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Destroy target ability; or interrupt target ability card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Engraved on the back is an oath to the Alliance and its noble cause.
Program.FullCard.Name: Medallion of the Alliance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Put Medallion of the Alliance on the bottom of your deck Interrupt target ability card that's targeting your hero if it was played by a [Horde] player.
(This item can prevent damage like an armor.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] These are the first non-armor cards with DEF values. An Alliance player is one who controls an Alliance hero, and a Horde player is one who controls a Horde hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Medallion of the Horde
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Put Medallion of the Horde on the bottom of your deck Interrupt target ability card that's targeting your hero if it was played by an [Alliance] player.
(This item can prevent damage like an armor.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] These are the first non-armor cards with DEF values. An Alliance player is one who controls an Alliance hero, and a Horde player is one who controls a Horde hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest strength of the Aldor is their faith in each other.
Program.FullCard.Name: Medallion of the Lightbearer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
Heroes and allies in your party with inspire are also protectors.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We pray for the strength to fight once more, for our brothers and for our home."
Program.FullCard.Name: Medoc Spiritwarden
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally card from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mama Humzinger always said, 'One power core in a gyrochronatom is better than two electrocogs in a recombobulator.'"
Program.FullCard.Name: Meekway Humzinger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
1, , Put Meekway Humzinger into her owner's hand Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Meeting Stone
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: , Exhaust two allies in your party Search your deck for an ally card and put it into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can only take enjoyment in making fun of the ridiculous clothes you wear or the pathetic look on your face." - Sanath Lim-yo
Program.FullCard.Name: Meeting with the Master
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card for each five resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest indignity isn't the loss of speech or fighting ability, but the possibility of getting sheared.
Program.FullCard.Name: Megamorph
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target any number of allies in one party.
Ongoing: Those allies can't attack or protect, lose all powers, and are Sheep.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Each target has the Sheep tag in its type line in addition to any others. A card’s powers are the text in its text box, as well as any keywords or quoted text added to it by modifiers. If a character loses all powers, it effectively has a blank text box, but it can later gain powers from cards like Face Smash.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is hard to hide from one who is familiar with the shadows.
Program.FullCard.Name: Meganna Callaghan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Meganna can attack elusive heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You call that hiding? I will take a payment of flesh for your foolishness."
Program.FullCard.Name: Meganna the Stalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Meganna This turn, heroes and allies in your party have stealth, and they can attack elusive heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You can easily tell who the smartest gnomes are. They're the ones who still have their eyebrows.
Program.FullCard.Name: Melgwy Pingzot
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Melgwy Pingzot deals 5 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Run! Here comes Melissa!" - Cerripha Sunstreak
Program.FullCard.Name: Melissa Gerrard
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Melissa attacks, target hero or ally has -1 health this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If the target is destroyed by this health loss, that happens before the protect point.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Some priests heal; others enhance. I, however, melt faces!" - Omedus the Punisher
Program.FullCard.Name: Melt Face
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Playing with fire has a price.
Program.FullCard.Name: Melt Weapon
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy all of target opponent's equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Meltdown
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero deals X fire damage to target ally; or destroy target weapon with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Name: Memento of Tyrande
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a non-token ally is destroyed, its controller may put a Spirit ally token into play wit 1 [Holy] ATK / 1 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Memri the Channeler
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Memri Memri deals 1 nature damage to target hero or ally for each Totem you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Some battles can be won on repuation alone.
Program.FullCard.Name: Menace
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally on top of its owner's deck

Program.FullCard.Name: Mend or End
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose one: Your hero heals 5 damage from target ally; or attach to one of your Melee weapons.
Ongoing: Attached weapon has +2 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It may all be in your head, but that doesn't make it hurt any less.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mental Anguish
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target player discards two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Battlegear
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If your hero would deal damage with a weapon, it deals double that much instead.
Exhaust target hero or ally, and your hero deals 1 melee damage to it.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Each armor set is one card with five uniqueness tags: Chest (1), Hands (1), Head (1), Legs (1), and Shoulder (1). Controlling any other armor with one of these tags causes a uniqueness violation as normal.

Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Crossbow of the Phoenix
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Merciless Gladiator's Crossbow of the Phoenix has +X ATK, where X is the combined ATK of your pets.
When you stike with this weapon, your hero has long-range this combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those who wield it will definitely have the last word." - Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Gavel
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero would deal non-combat damage, it deals double that much unstead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The relentless are the ones who get the fame and glory." - "King" Dond
Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Greatsword
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Merciless Gladiator's Greatsword enters play or you strike with it, your hero deals 1 melee damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Pursiut
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, you may put a Bear ally token into play with 4 [Melee] ATK / 4 health, Pet(1), and "This ally can protect your hero."
Your hero deals 2 ranged damage to each of up to three target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The arena seems like no place for a priest, but they still send foes fleeing in terror." - Lady Palanseer
Program.FullCard.Name: Merciless Gladiator's Raiment
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Each hero and ally in your party has +X health, where X is its printed health.
Target opponent puts three allies from his party into their owners' hands.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Freewind Post must know about this renewed harassment immediately!" - Brave Moonhorn
Program.FullCard.Name: Message to Freewind Post
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust your hero and pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Well…you could give them to your mother."
Program.FullCard.Name: Metalmorph
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target equipment.
Ongoing: Attached equipment loses and can't have powers and can't be exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Name: Metamorphosis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Demonology Hero Required
At the start of your turn, put your starting hero back into pay unless you destroy an ally you control. If you destroyed an ally this way, your hero deals shadow damage equal to that ally's cost to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I hate to think of what those cruel thugs might do to him..." - Kaymard Copperpinch
Program.FullCard.Name: Metzen the Reindeer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
When Metzen enters play, target opponent puts three Pirate ally tokens with 1 ATK / 1 health into play.
Ready target hero or ally. Use only if no Pirates are in play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mezzik Darkspark
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Destroy an ally in your party Mezzik Darkspark deals X shadow damage to target hero or ally, where X is the ATK of the destroyed ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the Light embrace you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Miandra
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Miandra enters play with a divine shield counter.
While Miandra has a divine shield counter, prevent all damage that would be dealt to her. When damage is prevented this way, remove her divine shield counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Never has putrescence looked to inviting.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mias the Putrid
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Mias enters play, target player discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you must travel a long distance, then a bat is your best option."
Program.FullCard.Name: Michael Garrett, Bat Handler
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Michael enters play, reveal the top four cards of your deck. Put a revealed location card into hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.
Michael has +1 ATK / +1 health while you have a location.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't drink too much! I don't need you growing horns or hooves on me." - Pagatha Soulbinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Mighty Shadow Protection Potion
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Death Knight, Druid, Hunter, Mage, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy this item Target friendly hero or ally has Shadow Resistance this turn. (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that it would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Mighty U'cha, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn: Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a 1 [Nature] / 1 [Health] Gorilla ally token named U'cha into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You are a terrible opponent."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mikael the Blunt
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing hero or ally readies, Mikael deals 2 ranged damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Millhouse Manastorm
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Millhouse enters play with three monologue counters and can't attack while he has any.
1, Say "Lowly? Nobody refers to the mighty Millhouse Manastorm as lowly!" Remove a monologue counter.
2, Say "Ice, Ice, Baby!" Remove a monologue counter.
3, Say "I'm gonna light you up, sweet cheeks!" Remove a monologue counter.
Use each of these powers onlu once per game.

Program.FullCard.Name: Milo the Unmerciful
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust target armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Shadow priests, mon…dey can melt faces." - Ta'zo
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Blast
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 shadow damage to target hero or ally. Its controller discards a card for each damage dealt.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Control
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally with cost X.
Ongoing: You control attached ally.
When you play a card, destroy Mind Control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Can't…focus…on…the…cube."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Exhaustion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and Magtheridon deals 4 fire damage to it.
Ongoing: Attached character can't exhaust to attach a Cube.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The chilling touch of death can give even the bravest of souls pause for thought." - Wanda Darkfizz
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Freeze
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target ability or ally card. If you do, exhaust all of its controller's resources.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Sear
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 2 shadow damage to each opposing hero and ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 shadow damage to each opposing hero and ally if its controller has no cards in his hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Doctor Herbert Halsey once tested this spell side by side with Rumsey Rum. They both had the same effect." - Deacon Markus Hallow
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Soothe
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't attack your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Victims of a shadow priest seldom remember why they're victims.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Spike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. Its controller discards a card for each damage dealt.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Everything looks so much smaller through a tauren's eyes.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind Vision
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose an opponent.
Ongoing: That opponent plays with his hand revealed.
When you play a card, destroy Mind Vision. If you do, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: At times, the line between friend and foe is hazy.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mindflip
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may choose an ally in your party and have target player gain control of it. If you do, gain control of target ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: What affects the body will surely affect the mind.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mind-numbing Poison
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero that was dealt combat damage by your hero this turn.
Ongoing: At the start of attached hero's controller's turn, that player exhausts one of his ready resources.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This ongoing power triggers after that player readies his or her resources to start the turn. In response to this triggered effect, that player can exhaust any or all of his or her resources to add links to the chain. If that player has any ready resources as this effect resolves, he or she must choose one and exhaust it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Miner Harshdin
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, target player puts the top card of his deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Moggun likes to hunt below ground just as much as he does above it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Miner Moggun
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Put the top two cards of your deck into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let's see what you're up to, eh?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Miner Steelwhiskers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Steelwhiskers protects, put the top two cards of target opponent's deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Miner Stonedeep
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, target player puts the top five cards of his deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Minions of the Shadow Council
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When an opposing ally is destroyed, put a corpse counter on Minions of the Shadow Council.
Remove all corpse counters and pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you removed three or more counters this way, draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Only those who cross her need fear her dark ways.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mioma Shadowflint
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Mend 2 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)
When this ally heals damage, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You make your own luck."
Program.FullCard.Name: Miranda McMiserson
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If it has that name, draw it. Otherwise, put it on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How do you know which one is real?!" - Dizdemona
Program.FullCard.Name: Mirror Image
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put three 0 [Arcane] / 1 [Health] Mirror ally tokens into play with "If damage would be dealt to your hero, it's dealt to a random hero or Mirror you control instead."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The path of least resistance can be the last of your existence.
Program.FullCard.Name: Misdirection
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of each opponent's turn, choose an ally in your party. Opposing allies can attack only that ally this turn if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The slower the death, the more agonizing the pain.
Program.FullCard.Name: Misery
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Hero Required
Ongoing: X, Target player puts the top X cards of his deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bishop DeLavey asked me to approach adventurers who might be able to help him with a delicate matter." - Thomas
Program.FullCard.Name: Missing Diplomat, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Search your deck for an ally card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mission: The Abyssal Shelf
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 6 to complete this quest.
Reward: Roll six dice one at a time from 6 inches above play. For each die that lands on an opposing ally, put damage on it equal to that roll.
Program.FullCard.Rulings:
[MoL Rules FAQ] Before this reward effect resolves, each player is free to move his or her allies around, although they must remain within the boundaries of that player’s “normal play area,” which has the approximate dimensions of a playmat. Allies can’t be positioned so they overlap other characters.
Dice must be six-sided, between one and two centimeters wide, and must be rolled from at least six inches above play. As they drop, players can’t interfere with them or any cards in play. If a die lands on a stack of cards (or any other object), that much damage is put on any underlying allies, including allies underneath other cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When I am through, there will be nothing left but a pile of mush." - Martiana the Mindwrench
Program.FullCard.Name: Mist of Corrosion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose "ability," "ally," or "equipment."
Target opponent destroys a card of that kind he controls unless he discards a card of that kind.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Smooch!
Program.FullCard.Name: Mistletoe
Program.FullCard.Rules: You and another friendly player each exhaust your heroes You and that player each draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The quickest way to find the needle: burn the haystack." - Harrigan Soulsunder
Program.FullCard.Name: Mistress Naila Flameburst
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Naila attacks, she deals 1 fire damage to each other hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've got an itchy trigger finger, so don't tempt me."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mithran the Sniper
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing ability, ally, or equipment enters play, destroy this ally. If you do, destroy that opposing card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Broken have taught me that nothing is beyond saving."
Program.FullCard.Name: Moala Stonebinder
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Moala Stonebinder Your weapons can't be destroyed this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Pride, more than flesh, is easily stung.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mocking Blow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 melee damage to target hero or ally. This turn, that character must attack if able and can attack only your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't worry, lads, I'm watchin' yer backs."
Program.FullCard.Name: Modric Sternbeard
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Find Treasure (When this ally enters play, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.)
When Modric defends, he may heal all damage from target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mogor decim-…Mogor destro-…Mogor KILL!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Mogor
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Mogor is destroyed, you may pay 3. If you do, his owner puts him from his graveyard into his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Never give them the chance to doubt you.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mogor's Anointing Club
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: , Destroy an ally in your party Put an ally card with lower cost than that ally from your graveyard into play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This effect doesn't target. Choose an applicable ally card as it resolves.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Her looks can be disarming.
Program.FullCard.Name: Moira Darkheart
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy Moira Darkheart Destroy target armor or weapon.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Doctor Zin'tar
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Zin'tar attacks, he heals 1 damage from target hero or ally in your party and deals 1 nature damage to target opposing hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't worry - if you die, I still make use of you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Masher Shakko
Program.FullCard.Rules: When another ally in your party is destroyed, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Punishment be comin' to anyone who tries to harm my bruddahs."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Masher Ven'dango
Program.FullCard.Rules: When another ally in your party is destroyed, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If ya need me, dere be no harm in callin' for help, bruddah. We must all work together if we gonna stop da Scourge."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Master Zandum
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Zandum, discard a Priest Zandum heals 4 damage divided as you choose from any number of target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Everyone needs a helpin' hand. Mine's just a bit more powerful than others, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Mender Ja'nah
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Mojo Mender Ja'nah Ja'nah heals all damage from target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Da mojo can manifest itself in many ways, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Mistress Zurania
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mend 2 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Ojo got mojo to sho' joo."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mojo Shaper Ojo'mon
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Mojo Shaper Ojo'mon Put an ally card with cost 2 or less from your graveyard into play. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mok'Nathal Wildercloak
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing ally is destroyed, put a +1 DEF counter on Mok'Nathal Wildercloak.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The early hunter catches the bird catching the worm.
Program.FullCard.Name: Moko Hunts-at-Dawn
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Mollie Brightheart
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Diplomacy: Draenei (You pay 1 less to play Draenei allies, to a minimum of 1.)
Mollie deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "As if bein' encased in ice wasn't bad enough! How's a rogue to make a living?" - Rotun Daggerhand
Program.FullCard.Name: Molten Armor
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, Remove an ability card in your graveyard from the game If your hero is defending, it deals 1 fire damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Molten destroyers are the stronger, tougher brethren of the molten giants. They stand guard deeper in the Molten Core.
Program.FullCard.Name: Molten Destroyer
Program.FullCard.Rules: Molten Destroyer has +1 ATK and +1 health for each rune you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: These massive creatures are the first sight greeting those who find their way from Blackrock Depths into the Molten Core.
Program.FullCard.Name: Molten Giants
Program.FullCard.Rules: Molten Giants has +1 ATK and +1 health for each rune you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I thought I could bear her in close-quarters combat…Boy was I wrong!" - Galway Steamwhistle
Program.FullCard.Name: Mongoose Bite
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target attacker, and that attacker has -2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When the time comes, Elune will belss me with her power. All I must do is call her name."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mooncaller Jynalla Nightpath
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has +3 / +3 and Protector while you control a Shout.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Tailors tell the the first recipe for mooncloth was scribed by Elune herself.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mooncloth Robe
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, , Exhaust your hero Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In all other things, moderation.
Program.FullCard.Name: Moonfire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and your hero deals 1 arcane damage to it.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, if Moonfire is in play, your hero deals 1 arcane damage to attached character.
1 Put Moonfire into its owner's hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Your hero deals 1 damage only if Moonfire is in play continuously from the start of your turn until its triggered effect resolves. If the attached character is fatally damaged this way, there’s no opportunity to return Moonfire to hand before that character is destroyed and Moonfire is put into a graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The enemy never counts on nature being your ally." - Yanna Dal'Shalan
Program.FullCard.Name: Moonflare
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When a resource enters play under your control, your hero may deal 1 arcane damage to target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] A card entering your resource row from play doesn't trigger Moonflare's power.

Program.FullCard.Name: Moonkin Form
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Balance Hero Required
Ongoing: Each of your armor has +1 DEF.
If your hero would deal damage with a Balance ability, it deals that much damage +1 instead.
When you play a non-Balance ability, destroy Moonkin Form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Life, death, rebirth: all of nature is a cycle.
Program.FullCard.Name: Moonshadow
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Moonshadow Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw that many cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Moonstrider Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Your hero has stealth this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When it all goes wrong, it's his name they call.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mordotz
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mordotz has +1 ATK and +1 health for each ability you control attached to opposing heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "One singe, two flash, three cringe, four ash." - Troll nursery rhyme
Program.FullCard.Name: More, the Scarier, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X fire damage to each of X target allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Felhunters feed on magical energies...and those who wield them.
Program.FullCard.Name: Morfiel
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents pay 1 more to play abilities.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't think you've thought things through completely. Allow me to correct that."
Program.FullCard.Name: Morganis Blackvein
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Morganis Blackvein Opponents can't draw cards this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Morik
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When Morik attacks, each player draws a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stand back and watch."
Program.FullCard.Name: Morkad Sharptooth
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, choose a hero or ally in your party. Other characters can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Morlug Soulslaver
Program.FullCard.Rules: When one of your resources is destroyed, Morlug Soulslaver deals 1 shadow damage to target hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You are not deserving of such gifts."
Program.FullCard.Name: Morn Salts-the-Land
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3, Flip Morn You can play target ability card from an opponent's graveyard this turn.
Grimtotem

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I never let anything go to waste."
Program.FullCard.Name: Morn Walks-the-Path
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Morn You can play target ability card from your graveyard this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Cenarion Circle will not be content until balance has been restored to the land.
Program.FullCard.Name: Morova of the Sands
Program.FullCard.Rules: 10, Flip Morova Morova deals 7 nature damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Power does not come without a price.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mortal Delights
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, Put 3 damage on your hero Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Enough tricks. Now you die!" - Emmi Sprinklestrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Mortal Slash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Attached character can't be healed.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 melee damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mortal Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arms Hero Required.
Your hero deals X melee damage to target hero or ally, where X is 1 plus the ATK of one of your Melee weapons. That character can't be healed this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't worry, I'll watch your back for you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mortok
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mortok can attack only exhausted heroes and allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You don’t know the true meaning of sacrifice. I'll teach you. . . For a price."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mor'zul Bloodbringer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Remove a Warlock ally you control from the game Remove target ally from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Legion is aware of you. That is why I am here."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mother Misery
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Sextuple Wield (Can have up to six hands of Melee weapons and strike with any number of them during the same combat.)
BACK: Sextuple Wield (Can have up to six hands of Melee weapons and strike with any number of them during the same combat.)
Deckbuilding: You can include only neutral quests and any Melee weapons. You can’t include cards with reputation or text restrictions (like Fire Hero Required).

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "No need to run. Mothra will protect us from Ghaz'rilla!" - Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Name: Mothra
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When this ally exhausts, ready up to three resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mottled Drake
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you place a resource into your resource row face up, ready target Dragonkin ally you control.
Your hero heals all damage from it.
(Mounts can’t attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They rarely attack alone."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mrglrglmrglmrrrlggg
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Mrglrglmrglmrrrlggg attacks, say "Mrglrglmrglmrrrlggg!" Then, put two Murloc ally tokens with +1 ATK, 1 health, and ferocity into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Muddle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When this ability enters play, you may put target opposing ability into its owner's hand.
Opponents pay 1 more to play abilities.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A flick of the wrist, a twist of the blade, and a problem is solved.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mugger's Belt
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage to a hero, that hero's controller discards a card and you draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Multi-Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 ranged damage to each of up to three target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Greed is good.
Program.FullCard.Name: Munkin Blackfist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Munkin enters play, destroy target equipment if its controller has more equipment than you.

Program.FullCard.Name: Murderous Torment
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: When an opponent draws a card, your hero deals 1 arcane damage to his hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will ignite a fiery inferno and burn everything to ash before I serve the Lich King again!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Murphy Watson
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has Assault 3 while an ally is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There's nothing like the fury of Ursoc to help rally the troops."
Program.FullCard.Name: Muruna the Savage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Allies you control have +2 [Health] while you control a Form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Few healers escape her blades.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mustang Sally
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Destroy an ally in your party other than Mustang Sally Destroy target ally with cost 4 or less.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Leave nothing the family can identify." - The Assassin's Creed, Chapter 4
Program.FullCard.Name: Mutilate
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assassination Hero Required
Your hero deals melee damage to target hero or ally equal to 1 plus the combined ATK of your Daggers.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can play this card even if you don’t have a Dagger in play. If so, your hero deals 1 damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A knack for all things mechanical flows through the blood of every gnome.
Program.FullCard.Name: Mya, Dragonling Wrangler
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Mya enters play, put a Mechanical Dragonling ally token with 1 ATK and 1 health into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The moon is full tonight. This does not bode well for you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Myriam Starcaller
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Untargetable
Myriam deals 5 arcane damage to target hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Highly prized by warriors across Azeroth, the signet's price was well worth the bloodshed it saved.
Program.FullCard.Name: Myrmidon's Signet
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has +5 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Shift your focus to a weaker target and you will surely find your efficiency increase."
Program.FullCard.Name: Myrodan Silversong
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally can't attack heroes.

Program.FullCard.Name: Mystery Goo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top five cards of your deck. Put a revealed ability into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let's see if this works on the third try." - Dizdemona
Program.FullCard.Name: Mystic Denial
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Interrupt target card.
Ongoing: When an opponent plays a card, destroy Mystic Denial. If you do, interrupt that card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Cards that have been placed on the chain can't be targeted for interruption.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The druids of the Cenarion Circle are helpless children. They cower in their precious Emerald Dream."
Program.FullCard.Name: Mythen of the Fang
Program.FullCard.Rules:
2, Flip Mythen Mythen deals 1 nature damage to target hero for each quest its controller has.
Druids of the Fang

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Naralex hoped to revitalize the Barrens. If only he hadn't become trapped in a nightmare!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Mythen of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Mythen Mythen heals 2 damage from target hero or ally for each quest you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You will not fall on my watch!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Naan the Selfless
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Naan defends, he deals 1 nature damage to target hero or ally and heals 1 damage from a second target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The protection of the naaru is not something to be taken for granted.
Program.FullCard.Name: Naaru Belt of Precision
Program.FullCard.Rules: Naaru Belt of Precision has +X DEF, where X is your hero's ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "With the support of the naaru, the Light will triumph." - Adyen the Lightwarden
Program.FullCard.Name: Naaru Lightwarden's Band
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly heroes have +5 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Najan Spiritbinder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When Najan Spiritbinder deals combat damage to a hero, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Armor is a fundamental extension of a warrior's defensive power."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nakistis, Exodar Armorer
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has +1 / +1 while you control an armor.

Program.FullCard.Name: Nala Stalks-the-Night
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Naliss the Silencer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Blood Elf Hero Required
Arcane Torrent
1 Target opposing card in play loses and can't have powers this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "By Elune's grace, the injured shall be made whole."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nalkas
Program.FullCard.Rules: Nalkas heals 2 damage from each hero and ally in target player's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The dark times will pass."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nalonae
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may destroy one of your resources rather than pay Nalonae's cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You return! Astounding. Did you discover the true name?" - Loramus Thalipedes
Program.FullCard.Name: Name of the Beast, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose "ability," "ally," "equipment," or "quest." Reveal the top four cards of your deck. Put a revealed card of that kind into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Nami Dabpox
Program.FullCard.Rules: Elusive (This ally can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Addiction to the arcane is not without its consequences.
Program.FullCard.Name: Naolin Sunsurge
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Blood Elf Hero Required
When you play an ability for the first time on each of your turns, draw a card.
At the end of your turn, if you didn't play an ability this turn, destroy Naolin Sunsurge.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This power triggers the first time you play any ability on your turn. It never triggers twice during the same turn, even if the second ability you play that turn is different than the first.

Program.FullCard.Name: Narmak Doomratchet
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
, Put X damage on your hero Narmak Doomratchet deals X shadow damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Narthadus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
At the end of your turn, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have seen the other side…and I have returned."
Program.FullCard.Name: Natasha Hutchins
Program.FullCard.Rules: Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow [Shadow] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I do not serve the Light. The Light serves me."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nathadan
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Nathadan If target ally in your party is defending, remove it from combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've got the situation under control."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nathaniel Voran
Program.FullCard.Rules: Will of the Forsaken (This ally cant leave play unless it has fatal damage or 0 health.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Amidst our ranks, there are few with more dedication or vigor." - Lady Sylvanas Windrunner
Program.FullCard.Name: Nathanos Blightcaller
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When this ally enters play, put two 2 [Melee] / 2 [Health] Blighthound ally tokens into play with Protector.
This ally can't be destroyed while you control a Blighthound.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't squander my earnings on gowns or jewelry. Take it from me, such things only draw unwanted attention."
Program.FullCard.Name: Nathressa Darkstrider
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Nathressa Darkstrider Nathressa has stealth this turn. (Can't protect against her.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When nature exists in balance, all things are possible.
Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Alignment
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X nature damage to target hero or ally and heals X damage from target hero or ally, where X is the number of friendly players.

Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Conduit
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 nature damage to target ally and heals 3 damage from itself.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] No damage is healed if the target is illegal on resolution.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Thangal weathered blow after blow unscathed, blade and arrow alike glancing harmlessly off his thick hide.
Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Defenses
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Each of your armor has +1 DEF while your hero is in bear form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Anything worth doing is worth overdoing."
Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Disaster
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 6 nature damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Genesis
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Each player may place an additional resource during his turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Multiple copies of Natural Genesis are cumulative. For example, if two Natural Genesis cards are in play, each player may place up to three resources during each of his or her turns. If you’ve placed fewer resources this turn than the number you’re currently allowed, you may place another one. Once a resource has been placed on the chain, it can’t be interrupted by removing a Natural Genesis from play in response.

Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Order, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Reclamation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When you complete a quest, you may put a 1 [Melee] / 1 [Health] Treant ally token into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Beware, I sense an external force at play here…This is not natural!" - Earthbinder Galandna Nightbreeze
Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Remedies
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 0 to complete this quest.
Reward: Look at the top two cards of your deck. Put one on top of your deck and the other on the bottom.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sooner or later, everything returns to the earth.
Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Repossession
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one or both: Destroy target ability; or destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Natural Selection
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero deals 3 nature damage to target hero or ally; or your hero heals 3 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Druids strive to mimic the razor-sharp instincts of the animals they protect.
Program.FullCard.Name: Nature of the Beast
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your hero has +1 ATK while attacking in bear or cat form.

Program.FullCard.Name: Nature Resistance Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When this card enters play, it deals 2 nature damage to target hero or ally.
Other friendly heroes and allies have Nature Resistance. (Prevent all nature ([Nature]) damage that would be dealt to them.)
(Totems can't attack.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The pain you suffer will be unbearable." - Grumpherys
Program.FullCard.Name: Nature Unleashed
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put five bear Ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Elune offers me her blessing, and I offer you her punishment." - Mythen of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Name: Nature's Focus
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero deals 4 nature damage to target ally; or your hero heals 4 damage from target hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your presence here is a problem that demands a swift solution." - Arturius Hathrow

Program.FullCard.Name: Noggenfogger Elixir
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destroy Noggenfogger Elixir Choose an ally in your party and roll a die.
1-2: That ally can't be destroyed this turn.
3-4: Ready that ally.
5-6: That ally can't be attacked this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings:
[Paul Ross 9/7/2006] NOTE: All references to the Elixir assume a roll of 1-2.
* If a character can't be destroyed, then any attempts to destroy it fail.
* An Elixir-affected character can still take damage. All characters, whether or not Elixir-affected, can take more damage than they have health.
* Execute tries to destroy its target as it resolves. If that modifier clashes with an Elixir modifier, then "can't be destroyed" wins and the target lives to fight another day. Execute still goes to the graveyard; costs are never refunded. Elixir doesn't stop opponents from playing Execute.
* Fatal damage destroys characters. The game checks for fatal damage any time a player would get priority (as part of Pre Priority Processing (PPP)). If an Elixir-affected character accumulates fatal damage, then the game tries to destroy it just before the next player gets priority, fails, continues until just before the next player gets priority, tries again, fails again, and so on.
* Relatively technical bit - possibly only interesting to judges-to-be: The Elixir wears off at the end of the wrap-up step. There are no priority windows during the wrap-up step, so the next time a player would get priority is during the next turn's ready step, after readying. Just before that player gets priority is when a fatally-damaged-and-formerly-Elixired character will be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You'll get a kick out of this." - Nyn'jah
Program.FullCard.Name: Nyn'jah's Tabi Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Other players can't use payment () powers during your turn.
You can use the payment powers of any cards in play during your turn (including opposing cards).
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Quest reward powers are not payment powers. Using a power of an opposing card is otherwise identical to using a power of a card you control. Such a power is read from your perspective (the player using the power), so "opposing" means opposed to you, and so on. Any resource costs must be paid with your resources as normal.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My heart will beat forever with my forest's pulse."

Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] If you control another Form while your hero has Form (1), you must immediately destroy that Form (or your hero) to repair the uniqueness violation. Maleo loses both cat form and Form (1) if you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Kel'Thuzad's destruction is the first step towards defeating the Lich King, but we must act quickly, for time is not in our favor."

Program.FullCard.Rules:
When The Oathkeeper enters play, choose an oath: "I won't play cards;" or "I won't draw cards."
You can't break that oath.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] The chosen oath applies only to the oathtaker (the player under whose control The Oathkeeper entered play). While The Oathkeeper remains under that player's control, the second power creates a modifier that says he or she either "can't play cards" or "can't draw cards." If The Oathkeeper leaves that player's control, he or she is free to break that oath.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Target opponent chooses an ally in his party. When that ally is destroyed this turn, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Chaos must be fought, no matter the cost."
Program.FullCard.Name: Orderkeeper Calister
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Opponents pay 2 more to play equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't waste your breath."
Program.FullCard.Name: Orderkeeper Henley
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents pay 2 more to play abilities.

Program.FullCard.Name: Orderkeeper Vesra
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents pay 2 more to play allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Orders From Lady Vashj
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you have no cards in hand, draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Orgrimmar was founded in the valleys and caverns of nothern Durotar as the new home of the orcish race and the capital of the Horde." - Explorers' Guild Guide to Kalimdor
Program.FullCard.Name: Orgrimmar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Orc Hero Required
Target Orc in your party has ferocity this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For the Horde!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Orgrimmar Grunts
Program.FullCard.Rules: Orgrimmar Grunts has +1 ATK for each other ally named Orgrimmar Grunts in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Orgrim's Hammer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When a quest you control turns face down, add a cannonball counter.
On your turn: 1, , Remove two cannoball counters Your hero deals 4 ranged damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Taste blessed steel, cur!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Orion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector

Program.FullCard.Name: Orkahn of Orgrimmar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When this ally enters play, you may put target equipment from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The shadows demand punishment for the wasteful."
Program.FullCard.Name: Orlund
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Find Treasure (When this ally enters play, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.)
When an opponent discards a card, Orlund deals 3 shadow damage to that opponent's hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Its craftsmanship is beyond compare.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ornate Adamantium Breastplate

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The spark of fire and the chill of frost.
Program.FullCard.Name: Orono the Great
Osha Shadowdrinker
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a Shadow ally in your party deals combat damage, ready up to that many of your resources.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The crystalling powder from the mountain is infused within the earthen core of this region.
Program.FullCard.Name: Oshu'gun Crystal Powder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you control a location, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You can't make something un-undead."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ossandran, Crematorium Master
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing ability, ally, equipment, or resource is destroyed, remove it from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If we must go, we will not go quietly!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ossus the Ancient
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Draenei Hero Required
Inspiring Presence
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How am I supposed to make a living here with hellboars and demons and fel orcs attacking all the time?" - Foreman Razelcraz
Program.FullCard.Name: Outland Sucks!
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card, or two cards if an opponent has a Blood Elf, Draenei, or Demon in his party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Outrider Zarg
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
At the end of your turn, if Outrider Zarg dealt no damage this turn, destroy him.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If a packet is completely prevented, it ceases to exist and so deals no damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Overkill
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, remov up to five Finishing Move cards from your graveyard from the game.
Each opponent destroys that many of his equipment and discards that many cards, and your hero deals that much melee damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Behold, mon! We be creatin' da greatest Scourge army ever seen!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Overlord Drakuru
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
This ally has Assault X, where X is the highest cost among Scourge allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Kor'kron guard would be honored to fight by your side anytime."
Program.FullCard.Name: Overlord Or'barokh
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When Or'barokh enters play, you may destroy target damaged ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stop moving so I can crush you!" - Lord Benjamin Tremendouson
Program.FullCard.Name: Overpower
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Opposing cards can't be exhausted on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Thorium Brotherhood are master craftsmen who share their knowledge with those who earn their favor.
Program.FullCard.Name: Overseer Oilfist
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Overseer Oilfist enters play, reveal the top four cards of your deck. Put a revealed equipment card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Cult of the Damned will not rest until the Lich King's plans have been fulfilled.
Program.FullCard.Name: Overseer Savryn
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Flip Savryn, remove a Rogue in your graveyard from the game This turn, Melee weapons you control have Assault 1, and combat damage your hero would deal is unpreventable.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even those dimwitted metal Dwarves will recognize an impostor with a stolen suit." - Scout Vor'takh
Program.FullCard.Name: Overseer's Shadow, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you control an ability, draw a card.
If you control an ally, draw a card.
If you control an equipment, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Sit down!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Owned!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target ally from the game. Search its owner's deck, graveyard, hand, and party for all ally cards with the same name as that ally and remove them from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let their souls be cleansed in the searing light of the naaru."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ozzati
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Ozzati Ozzati deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Oh, great, he brought friends…" - Ryno
Program.FullCard.Name: Pack Tactics
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Allies in your party have +1 ATK / +1 health.
Your hero is in cat form. (+1 ATK while attacking. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is dark business to manipulate another's mind.
Program.FullCard.Name: Pact of Shadow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When an opponent discards a card, your hero deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It brings fear to those who hear its steps.
Program.FullCard.Name: Pads of the Dread Wolf

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do you have the courage to seize what you desire? Are you willing to do whatever you must to achieve your goals?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Pagatha Soulbinder
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Flip Pagatha Soulbinder Interrupt target ally card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's just a flesh wound."
Program.FullCard.Name: Pain Suppression
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Discipline Hero Required
Ongoing: If your hero would be dealt damage, prevent 1 of that damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's the only kind of bomb they let me use." - Pugg
Program.FullCard.Name: Paint Bomb
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally card and name a class.
Ongoing: Allies in attached ally's party have that class and lose all other classes.

Program.FullCard.Name: Paladin Training
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly ally.
Ongoing: When attached ally deals combat damage, it also heals that much from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It would be my honor to guide you in your first steps as a paladin." - Aurelon
Program.FullCard.Name: Paladin Training
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Target hero or ally you control has Protector this turn. Prevent all damage that it would be dealt while protecting this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Panax the Unstable
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Destroy Panax Panax deals X arcane damage to each ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Storm, earth, and fire - heed my call!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Pandamonium!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put three Pandaren ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and "This token has +1 ATK / +1 health for each other Pandaren in your party."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The secret is in the oats.
Program.FullCard.Name: Papa Hummel's Old-Fashioned Pet Biscuit
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target Pet ally in your party and put X growth counters on Papa Hummel's Old-Fashioned Pet Biscuit.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +1 ATK/+1 health for each growth counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Whee!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Paper Airplane
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put Paper Airplane on top of target player's deck. (He owns it for the rest of the game.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings:
[MoL Rules FAQ] If you gain ownership of another player’s Paper Airplane, it will enter your deck, hand, graveyard, or removed from game zone (rather than that other player’s) while you own it.
If it’s sleeved differently from the rest of your deck, that fact is public knowledge at all times, even while it’s in a non-public zone. For example, any player who shuffles or cuts your deck can legally cut to it. However, you have the option of resleeving it if you have a spare sleeve (or you can desleeve a card from your side deck.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've taught me lads everything I know."
Program.FullCard.Name: Pappy Ironbane
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
At the end of your turn, you may destroy target ability or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You won't have to worry that he might do something if you kill him before he does it." - Savitir Skullsmasher
Program.FullCard.Name: Paralyze
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose "ability," "ally," or "equipment." Target player can't play cards of that kind during his next turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Parren Shadowshot
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Target hero or ally has long-range this turn. (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Tauren warriors stand between their allies and death. Gnomes keep death from walking that far.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who follow the path of nature will be rewarded with its bounty.

Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has "1, Ready another target ally."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Indeed, these troublesome whelps are up to something insidious." - Kor'kron Wind Rider

If no opposing allies are in play, pay 2 to complete this quest.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Time to supplement my workforce."

Traitor Hero Required
2, Remove Pathaleon from the game Put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck, then draw that many cards. You can use this power if Pathaleon is in your hand or party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That which has come from the grave must be returned to it."

Long-Range

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I am in no hurry. My prey will soon show itself."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Many a bold hero has fled when faced by a collection of this disconsolate mail.

Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with a weapon, target ally in your party has long-range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Who can deny the majesty of the red dragonflight?" - Belnistrasz
Program.FullCard.Name: Pauldrons of the Crimson Flight
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, ready one of your armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A small price to pay for the glory of battle." - Boarguts the Impaler

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who have wronged will pay dearly.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A rose by this name is twice as sweet.

Pay 3 to complete this quest.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the Light guide me so that I may free Azeroth from the clutch of death."

4, Flip Phosphus Choose one: Phosphus deals 4 fire damage to target ally; or Phosphus deals 2 fire damage to each of two target allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Leeroy?"

Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You name a card as Pick Pocket resolves. Target opponent can respond by playing instants or discarding cards if able before you name a card. Once you name a card, there’s no opportunity for your opponent to do anything before revealing his or her hand and discarding all cards with that name.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Secrets are for sharing."

Attach to target ally, and your hero deals 2 melee damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's not stealing, technically. It's unauthorized trading." - Jonas White

Play only if Magtheridon is Unleashed.
Destroy a Blood This turn, Magtheridon can't be targeted by raiding players, and your cards can't be interrupted.

Play only if Magtheridon is Unleashed.
When Magtheridon deals combat damage to a hero or ally, he also deals that much damage to a second target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Watch me hit the last petal on that peacebloom. No, not that one. Farther away, on top of those hills. You can't make it out? Oh, for - just take my word for it, all right?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Pithran Mithrilshot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Long-Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Pixia Darkmist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)
Your hero has Protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What? You mean you can't kill this one by yourself?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Piztog
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Other allies in your party have +1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You will not harm my master! I Will give my life for the Legion!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Plague Demonsoul
Program.FullCard.Rules:
2, Flip Plague If a Demon in your party would be dealt damage this turn, it's dealt to Plague instead.
Shadowsworn

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Death by smashing or death by explosive poison? A lose-lose situation.
Program.FullCard.Name: Plague Eruptor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
When this ally is dealt non-fatal damage, destroy it. If you do, it deals that much nature damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Legion are mere pawns in the greater game."
Program.FullCard.Name: Plague Fleshbane
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Plague If Plague would be dealt damage this turn, you may choose a Demon in your party. If you do, that damage is dealt to that Demon instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Only fools and gods would think they can control such an unpredictable force." - Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Name: Plague Igniter
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals shadow ([Shadow]) damage to a hero, allies in its party have -1 [Health] this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Plague Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to attached hero.
When damage is dealt this way, target ally in attached hero's party has -1 health this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The meat wagons bring bodies to the slaughterhouse to make unthinkable horrors.
Program.FullCard.Name: Plagueborn Meatwall
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Plagueborn Meatwall defends against an ally, remove all damage from Plagueborn Meatwall, and he deals that much melee damage to each attacking ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Tread lightly, my friend. The Earth Mother is watching."
Program.FullCard.Name: Plainsrunner Marun
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
When Marun attacks, you pay 1 less to complete your next quest this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When you need me, my blade is yours."
Program.FullCard.Name: Plainswatcher Taro
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
While you control four or more cards in play with the same name, you may play Taro without paying his cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Da true mastas of da hunt always have a Plan B." - The Longeye
Program.FullCard.Name: Planned Assault
Program.FullCard.Rules: You can play target ability card from your graveyard this turn if able. If an ability card would enter your graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Snowfall Glade wolvar have as much right to exist as do we." - Trapper Mau'i
Program.FullCard.Name: Planning for the Future
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top two cards of your deck. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The second of Plasma Rat's infamous creations. His first, the Turbogyro Mouse Delouser, is not as widely known.
Program.FullCard.Name: Plasma Rat's Hyper-Scythe
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust one of your armor or weapons Ready one of your resources.
