Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The plague of undeath must be stopped here and now!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Plasu
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that this ally would be dealt.)
This ally has Assault 2 while an opponent controls a [Shadow] card. (+2 ATK on your turn)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Created by the Makers, the technology has yet to be reproduced successfully.
Program.FullCard.Name: Platinium Disks of Swiftness
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to play your nest ally that shares a class with your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Platinum Shield of the Valorous
Program.FullCard.Rules: Platinum Shield of the Valorous has +1 DEF for each face-down resource you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As he nocked another arrow, Elendril could barely believe it. Was the dragon holding back, toying with them? If this was not the full extent of her fury, what hope did they have?
Program.FullCard.Name: Play With Your Food
Program.FullCard.Rules: Roll as many dice as the number of opposing heroes. Then, choose one die for each hero, and Onyxia deals that amount of melee damage to that hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't see your name on it!" - Rordag the Sly
Program.FullCard.Name: Plunder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target location or quest.
Ongoing: You control atatched resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Let me take that off your hands. - Jonas White
Program.FullCard.Name: Poach
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at target player's hand and choose an ability, ally, or equipment with cost 4 or less. He discards that card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I told ya to git out of me face, cow!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Point Blank
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero is defending, it deals 3 ranged damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Goblins and their servants have tainted our sacred water wells!" - Mull Thunderhorn
Program.FullCard.Name: Poison Water
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose one: Shuffle any number of cards from your graveyard into your deck; or draw a card. If your hero is a Tauren, you may do both.

Program.FullCard.Name: Polished Breastplate of Valor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3 Add a +1 [Defense] counter to target armor you control.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Add a +1 ATK counter o target weapon you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Baaaaa."
Program.FullCard.Name: Polymorph
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't attack or protect, loses all powers, and is a sheep.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 11/7/2006] An ally's powers are described in its text box. If an ally "loses all powers," it effectively has a blank text box.; Polymorph doesn't change/remove the card type of the attached ally. That ally can still be exhausted to complete The Love Potion, for example.; Face Smash doesn't attach to an ally. It just gives that ally a payment power until end of turn. If you resolve Face Smash targeting an already-polymorphed ally, that ally is affected by two modifiers until end of turn (or until the Polymorph is removed, whichever happens first). Those two modifiers don't depend on each other, so they apply to that ally in timestamp order. First, it loses all its powers to Polymorph, then gains the payment power from Face Smash. End result: a face-smashing sheep!

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I thought being turned into a sheep was humiliating enough . . . Now this?!" - Gorebelly
Program.FullCard.Name: Polymorph Penguin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't attack or protect, loses and can't have powers, and is also a Penguin.

Program.FullCard.Name: Poof!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally's controller removes it from the game. At the start of the next turn, he puts it into his party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] As that ally leaves play, its attachments are destroyed and its counters and damage are removed. That player puts it into his party even if he doesn’t own it. It enters play ready.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The shortest distance between two points is one incantation." - Blaize Brightspark
Program.FullCard.Name: Portal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Search your deck for an ally card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Portal Stone
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn: 1, Remove target ally you control from the game.
On your turn: 1, Put an ally removed by the card named Portal Stone into play under your control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Porto
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Friendly Totems are untargetable.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We'll have to be careful with it, but I think we can find a way to adapt this to help ward off the mana creatures." - Lieutenant-Sorcerer Morran
Program.FullCard.Name: Potential Energy Source
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: You pay 4 less to complete your next quest this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Power Infusion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Discipline Hero Required
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, add a haste counter.
For each haste counter, you pay 1 less to play your first card each turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My blood will be the end of you!" - Magtheridon
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Returns
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Draw a card for each Blood in play.
Destroy a Blood Put Power Returns into your hand. Use only if Power Returns is in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My power is a gift. I am an instrument of the Light." - Gladiator Katianna
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Courage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Preparation (On your first turn, you may play this card without paying its cost.)
Ongoing: Allies in your party have +1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All you need is a little faith." - Durzion, Champion of A'dal
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Faith
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has Mend 3.
When attached ally heals damage, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Spoken aloud, this word turns flesh to iron, doubt to courage.
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Fortitude
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Attached character has +5 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Preservation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has -3 / +3.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A hurried word of prayer can mean the difference between life and death.
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Restore
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero, and you may turn it face up.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 1 damage from attached hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Ease you mind. The Light has a watchful eye on you." - Kalatine Carmichael
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Sanctuary
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally you control.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attached ally.
Death Rattle (When this ability enters your graveyard from anywhere.): Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target ally you control this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Shelter
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attached ally.
At end of turn, destroy this ability.

Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attached character. When damage is prevented this way, destroy Power Word: Shield.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Maybe this will help keep you from dying so easily." - Xerandaal, Shade Servitor
Program.FullCard.Name: Power Word: Vigor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +5 [Health].

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Just as the Light connects all our hearts and souls, so let it protect us now in these dark and troubled times." - Kintara Wintermoon
Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Fortitude
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Heroes and allies in your party have +5 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Healing
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 3 damage from each hero and ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Mending
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to friendly ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 3 damage from attached ally. When attached ally is destroyed, put Prayer of Mending from its owner's graveyard into play attached to target friendly ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stay close to me, and you got nothin' to fear, bruddah." - Witch Doctor Koo'zar
Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Shadow Protection
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly heroes and allies have Shadow Resistance this turn. (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that they would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You can find inner harmony with a sound body, mind, and soul." - Boris Brightbeard
Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Spirit
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Ready a resource you control for each ally you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I gonna help joo harness da mojo, bruddah." - Mojo Mender Ja'nah
Program.FullCard.Name: Prayer of Vitality
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero heals all damage from allies you control.
Ongoing: Allies you control have +1 [Health].

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They think themselves strong, but they've been playing right into our trap."
Program.FullCard.Name: Precognition
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target opponent reveals his hand and chooses an ally card in it with cost X or less. Put that card into your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In nature there is give and take. Predators take, even when the prey refuses to give.
Program.FullCard.Name: Predatory Gloves
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Predatory Gloves enters play, target opponent discards a card and you draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Once a Druid catches wind of your scent, you may as well start digging your own grave, lad." - Chaigon Steelsight
Program.FullCard.Name: Predatory Sense
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has Assault 2 this turn>
Ongoing: Your hero has Cat Form. (It has +1 ATK while attacking. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Predatory Strikes
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Feral Hero Required.
Ongoing: While your hero is in bear form or cat form, it has +2 ATK while attacking.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Mike Hummel 8/28/2006] Predatory Strikes is neither unique nor does it have a limit number on the right hand side of the referent bar. You can have 1, 2, 3 or 4 of them in play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Leave nothing to chance." - The Assassin's Creed, Chapter 1
Program.FullCard.Name: Premeditation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Subtlety Hero Required
Search your deck for up to two Combo cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We have many among us who are willing to fight but are ill equiped. Bring me the naga's own weapons so that we may reforge them into glaives and arrowheads." - Ysiel Windsinger
Program.FullCard.Name: Preparing for War
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay X to complete this quest.
Reward: Shuffle X target cards from any number of graveyards into their owners' decks.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Impatience is a vitrue.
Program.FullCard.Name: Presence of Mind
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arcane Hero Required
Cards in your hand are instant this turn until you play a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When death and darkness surround you, that is when your faith must remain at its strongest." - Kaerie, Defender of the Sunwell
Program.FullCard.Name: Presence of the Divine
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When an attacking ally deals damage to an ally you control, you may destroy that attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Rogues don't much care about fair fights.
Program.FullCard.Name: Prey on the Weak
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ally wth cost 4 or less.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Fel Horde troops under the command of Kargath Bladefist are a brutal, battle-hardened lot fortified by foul magics." - Field Commander Romus
Program.FullCard.Name: Pride of the Fel Horde
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you have no ready resources, draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] The orientation of your resources is checked on resolution.

Program.FullCard.Name: Priest Training
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has " This ally heals 5 damage from target hero or ally."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Perhaps you should jump at shadows."
Program.FullCard.Name: Priestess Katianna
Program.FullCard.Rules: Elusive (Can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: She spreads the Betrayer's madness to every corner of the Black Temple.
Program.FullCard.Name: Priestess of Dementia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
2, Destroy an ally in your party Each opponent destroys an ability or equipment he controls.

Program.FullCard.Name: Primal Focus
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the end of your turn, ready up to two resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As with the land, the scars of battle take time to heal.
Program.FullCard.Name: Primal Mending
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally, and your hero heals 2 damage from it.
Ongoing: At the end of each turn, your hero heals 1 damage from attached ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are times when weakening an enemy serves more purpose than destroying him." - Morn Walks-the-Path
Program.FullCard.Name: Primal Taming
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally or weapon.
Ongoing: Attached card has -X ATK, where X is the highest cost among Hunter and Shaman allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Primal Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When one of your Totems is destroyed, it deals 1 nature damage to each opposing hero and ally.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] When Primal Totem itself is destroyed, it deals 1 nature damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Primalist Naseth
Program.FullCard.Rules: Primalist Naseth deals 4 nature damage to target hero or ally and heals 4 damage from another target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Welcome…to the future. A pity you are too late to stop it. No one can stop me now! Selama ashal'amore!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Prince Kael'thas Sunstrider
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
At the end of your turn, gain control of all ready opposing resources. (Move them to your resource row.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That's no princess."
Program.FullCard.Name: Princess Trapped, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top two cards of your deck. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the other one on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Prized Beastmaster's Mantle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Neutral allies you control have +3 [Health].
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Your hero heals 3 damage from target neutral ally you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Unauthorized entry detected. Engaging annihilation protocols."
Program.FullCard.Name: Promenade Sentinel
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
When Promenade Sentinel enters play, it deals 2 arcane damage to each of up to three target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've never seen such fervor. Even the Burning Legion would retreat on occasion, but the Scourge are relentless."
Program.FullCard.Name: Prometha
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Shaman: Flip Prometha Ready target Melee Weapon.

Program.FullCard.Name: Promises of Darkness, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. For each damage dealt this way, put 1 damage on your hero and draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Slay a mature black dragon and remove the sinew from its bones. Return that sinew to me, and I shall enchant the material into an almost indestructuble bow string." - Stoma the Ancient
Program.FullCard.Name: Proper String, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn: Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Heroes and allies you control have Long-Range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Prophet Velen
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust a Draenei in your party Prophet Velen deals 1 nature damage to target opposing hero or ally and heals 1 damage from target friendly hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can exhaust Velen to pay the cost of his own power, and because it’s not an activated () power, you can do so as soon as he enters your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A hunter is never caught alone.
Program.FullCard.Name: Protect the Master
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your Pets have protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Many powerful artifacts have found their way to the Kirin Tor, and they are awarded to those who prove themselves worthy." - Magistrix Lambriesse
Program.FullCard.Name: Protective Barricade of the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
[Paladin] Hero: This armor has +2 [Defense].
[Shaman] Hero: You pay 2 less to play this armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All newcomers to the Valley must first complete the rite of battle." - Warmaster Laggrond
Program.FullCard.Name: Proving Grounds
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've seen kobolds that hit harder than you!" - Ivan, Bladewind Brute
Program.FullCard.Name: Provoke
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of attached hero's controller's turn, your hero deals 1 melee damage to it. This turn, a hero dealt damage this way must attack if able and can attack only your hero if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A druid's mimicry of a rogue's stealth is the sincerest form of battery.
Program.FullCard.Name: Prowl
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has stealth while in cat form.
When your hero deals damage, put Prowl into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You say 'scream' … I say 'serenade.'"
Program.FullCard.Name: Psychic Scream
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent puts three allies from his party into their owner's hands.

Program.FullCard.Name: Psychic Shriek
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put each ally into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Psychic Wail
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target player puts an ally he controls into its owner's hand.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Exhaust target resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Oooh, shiny!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Pugg
Program.FullCard.Rules: Other allies in your party have -1 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Pulverize
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Destroy target damaged ally; or destroy target ability or equipment with one or more counters.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The first, best solution to anything.
Program.FullCard.Name: Pummel
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You may exhaust one of your Melee weapons rather than pay Pummel's cost.
Interrupt target ability card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Puncture
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ally or equipement.

Program.FullCard.Name: Pure Evil
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 6 to complete this quest.
Reward: If an ability is in your graveyard, draw a card.
If an ally is in your graveyard, draw a card.
If an equipment is in your graveyard, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is as with Mannoroth's blood curse - a spiritual problem requires a spiritual solution.
Program.FullCard.Name: Purge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability unless it's attached to a friendly hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's not like you really need that gold."
Program.FullCard.Name: Purloin
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at target opponent's hand and choose an ability or equipment card. That opponent discards that card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What's good for the goose. . .well, you know the rest." - Rottun Daggerhand
Program.FullCard.Name: Putrefying Poison
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero that was dealt combat damag by your hero this turn.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 nature damage to attached hero.
When damage is dealt this way, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target ally in attached hero's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You mean there's a setting to this thing other than 'gnome'?"
Program.FullCard.Name: PX-238 Winter Wondervolt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose an ally type.
Ongoing: All allies also have that type. (Examples of types are Chicken, Demon, Druid, Gnome, and Yeti.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] (Arena) isn’t an ally type, so it can’t be chosen by PX-238 Winter Wondervolt.

Program.FullCard.Name: Pyroblast
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Fire Hero Required.
Attach to target hero or ally, and your hero deals 6 fire damage to it. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 fire damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Name: Pyroclastic Consumption
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: When attached hero is dealt fire or [Fire] damage, put an inferno counter on Pyroclastic Consumption.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to attached hero for each inferno counter.

Program.FullCard.Name: Pyromancer Davins
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aberration
1 Target friendly ally has +2 / -2 this turn.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Target friendly ally has +2 / -2 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Hidden within the eye lies the very secret of magic.
Program.FullCard.Name: Quagmirran's Eye
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to play abilities, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's probably just a herd of elekk." - Leeroy Jenkins
Program.FullCard.Name: Quakelord Razek Warhoof
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Tauren Hero Required
War Stomp
When Razek attacks or defends, target opponent exhausts each ability and equipment he controls.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm uncertain of the theoretical consequences of using this sword!" - Bildros Nullvoid
Program.FullCard.Name: Quantum Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove the top ten cards of your deck from the game You pay 5 less the next time you strike with Quantum Blade this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Once Ymiron has been awakened, we will scour this world of its unworthy infestation."
Program.FullCard.Name: Queen Angerboda
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Flip Angerboda, remove a Mage in your graveyard from the game Target ally can't attack this turn.
BACK: Deckbuilding: You can only include either [Alliance] or [Horde] cards, [Mage] cards, [Mage] Frost talents, neutral cards, and Scourge cards. You can't include cards with reputations or other text restrictions.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Banshee Queen only seeks vengeance on behalf of her people, the Forsaken.
Program.FullCard.Name: Queen Sylvanas Windrunner
Program.FullCard.Rules: Other Undead heroes and allies in your party can't be destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If my end will save another who sudders, then I welcome it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Quenlan Lifeboon
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy Quenlan Quenlan heals 3 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We're fitting together the pieces of a giant puzzle together here. A mistake on your part could lead us to the wrong conclusions." - Watcher Leesa'oh
Program.FullCard.Name: Question of Gluttony, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to complete this quest for each card in your hand.
Pay 7 to complete this card.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Quick Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Quickdraw
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 ranged damage to target ally, or 6 if that ally entered play this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: His father had always advised, "Ye will always be short of leg, so never be short of breath." Yet Warrax wasn't sure outracing the elves and humans was his best tactic right now.
Program.FullCard.Name: Quicken the Pace
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put the top card of the event deck into your resource row face down. Each opponent puts the top card of his deck into his resource row face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our troops don't even need a moment's notice." - Nazgrel, Advisor to Thrall
Program.FullCard.Name: Quickstrider Moccasins
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready another target card in play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Quigley Slipshade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1 Quigley is elusive this turn.
1 Quigley is untargetable this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Voodoo be good for you, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ra'chee
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Ra'chee enters play, he heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Azeroth's darkest places offer great rewards to those willing to traverse them.
Program.FullCard.Name: Radak Doombringer
Program.FullCard.Rules: X, Flip Radak Doombringer, destroy one of your Pets with cost X Radak deals X shadow damage to target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do you really want to see me?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Raena the Unpredictable
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, choose whether Raena is elusive or a protector until the end of your next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I would rest much better knowing his death was not in vain." - Raene Wolfrunner
Program.FullCard.Name: Raene's Cleansing
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you've completed a quest this turn, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light sustains us, and it will ease even the heaviest of burdens. To think it has abandoned us is pure folly."
Program.FullCard.Name: Raesa Morningstar
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Raesa Morningstar Put target ability into its owner's hand. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Raging Shout
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Allies you control have Assault 1.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Your hero has Assault 1 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ragnaros
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Untargetable
Ragnaros can't be dealt damage. You can't play or discard cards.
At the start of your turn, flip Ragnaros.
BACK: Ragnaros has +10 ATK while attacking and can attack only heroes.
Ragnaros can't be dealt fire damage. At the end of your turn, if you have exactly three resources, put eight Sons of Flame into play and flip Ragnaros.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rahn Grimstaff
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target hero or ally has -1 health this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rain of Arrows
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals ranged damage to target hero or ally equal to 2 plus the number of other abilities you've played this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: This is the rain that falls in the Twisted Nether.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rain of Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, pay 4 or destroy Rain of Fire.
At the end of your turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You find yourself longing for the rains of the Wetlands." - Urrth
Program.FullCard.Name: Rain of Shadow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 shadow damage to each opposing hero and ally. When a character dealt damage this way is destroyed this turn, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rain or Pain
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose one: At the end of this turn, your hero deals 1 fire damage to each opposing ally; or attach to target ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 3 shadow damage to attached ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do not be mistaken - I will gladly trade your life for a more obedient soldier." - Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Name: Raise Dead
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the end of your turn, if no Ghouls are in your party, you may remove target ally card in a graveyard from the game. If you do, put a Ghoul ally token into play with 3 [Melee] ATK / 3 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Raise from the Ashes
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play, destroy an ally in your party.
Search your deck for a card with the same name as that ally and put it into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rak Skyfury
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Rak Skyfury enters play, ready your hero and one of your weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The fury of the tempest will lay waste to all who stand in my way."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rakasa Mournewind
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Rakasa deals damage, target opposing hero or ally can't attack or protect this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No one wants to become a druid's scratching post.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rake
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and your hero deals 1 melee damage to it.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, if your hero is in cat form, it deals 1 melee damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rally the Troops
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies in your party have +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Defensive positions! Prepare for attack!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Rallying Shout
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Allies in your party have protector.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ramaladni's Blade of Cunning
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes and allies have Protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The wicked do not deserve the power they wield."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rames the Purifier
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, you may destroy an ability attached to a hero or ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rampage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Fury Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, put a slaughter counter on Rampage.
Your hero has +1 ATK while attacking for each slaughter counter on Rampage.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You add one slaughter counter for each packet of combat damage your hero deals with a weapon, regardless of the size of that packet.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rampant Destruction
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destroy an opposing ability or equipment for each Blood in play.
When an opposing card or effect causes you to discard Rampant Destruction, you may put it from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The spark of life that once powered Rivendare's abomination is contained within.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ramstein's Lightning Bolts
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Ramstein's Lightning Bolts Your hero deals 1 nature damage to each hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The fastest way to an orc's heart is between the third and fourth ribs."
Program.FullCard.Name: Randipan
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Randipan deals combat damage to a defending hero, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The icy grasp of death offers no mercy to those who oppose it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Randolphe Each opposing hero and ally has -1 ATK this turn for each damage on it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Lich King underestimates me if he thinks I won't exploit his mindless creatures of undeath with the power that he granted me."
Program.FullCard.Name: Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Randolphe This turn, opposing heroes and allies have "This character has -1 ATK for each damage on it."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A true marksman is not the one who never misses; it's one who always kills." - The Greatest Race of Hunters
Program.FullCard.Name: Ranged Weapon Specialization
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Marksmanship Hero Required
Ongoing: Your Ranged Weapons have +2 ATK and you pay 1 less to strike with them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You won't be needing these."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ransack
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy the card with the lowest cost among abilities, allies, and equipment in play. If two or more are tied, destroy all with that cost.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Look at all abilities, allies, and equipment in play as a single set, determine the lowest cost among them, and then destroy all cards in that set with that cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ranthus Adler
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy Ranthus Adler Put target ally into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your efforts are commendable, but your death is inevitable.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rantuko Grimtouch
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Rantuko readies, he deals 1 shadow damage to each opposing ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rapid Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: Whenever you strike with a Ranged weapon this turn, you may pay 1. If you do, ready that weapon and your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A good hunter isn't afraid to put down her bow.
Program.FullCard.Name: Raptor Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 melee damage to target ally that entered play this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You must search the dung for the digested remnants of the Nagrand caracoli." - Elementalist Lo'ap
Program.FullCard.Name: Rare Bean, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose a rarity, then reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed card with that rarity into hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] The color of a card's collector number represents that card's rarity: white for common, green for uncommon, blue for rare, purple for epic, and orange for legendary.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It hurts me, mon. But it'll hurt choo more."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ras'fari Bloodfrenzy
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
When Ras'fari attacks for the first time each turn, ready him if he has damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Shaking Raul's hand is the same as simply handing him your bracelet.
Program.FullCard.Name: Raul "Fingers" Maldren
Program.FullCard.Rules: Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The flesh of the dead tears just as easily as the flesh of the living. - Maleo the Blur
Program.FullCard.Name: Ravage
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target ally, or 4 if you control a Form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That's the thing about odds - they're always changing."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ravenna
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Ravenna Target ally in your party has stealth this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ravenous Bite
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target ally has +3 ATK this turn.
Target ally has -3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I could do dis all day!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ra'waza Stonetusk
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
At the start of your turn, Ra'waza heals all damage from himself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rayder
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies in your party have +2 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You've picked the wrong night elf to mess with."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rayne Savageboon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Nature Resistance (Prevent all nature or [Nature] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Greetings, mon. It's nice to beat ya."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ra'za Wildstorm

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Come on, you apes. You want to live forever?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Razak Ironsides
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opposing her or ally readies, Razal deals 4 ranged damage to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Safety in numbers is just an illusion." - Daspien Bladedancer
Program.FullCard.Name: Raze
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Finishing Move (To play, remove X Combo cards in your graveyard from the game, where X is 5 or less.)
Destroy each opposing ally and equipment with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Name: Razorsaw
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)
When Razorsaw enters play, he deals 4 ranged damage to target ally in your party. When Razorsaw leaves play, he deals 4 ranged damage to target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] If there are no other targetable allies in your party when Razorsaw enters play, he must target himself. If there are no targetable opposing allies when Razorsaw leaves play, he must target a friendly ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Dat all you got?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Raztu'jor
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally attacks, you may destroy target weapon.

Program.FullCard.Name: Readiness
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Survival Hero Required
You can play ability cards from your graveyard this turn.
If an ability card would enter your graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can play ability cards from your graveyard if otherwise legal. You can still play ability cards from your hand. All ability cards that would enter your graveyard from any other zone are removed from the game, except ability cards that are face-down resources entering the graveyard from play. You can still destroy or discard an ability card to pay a cost. Readiness itself is removed from the game as it resolves.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The jormungar have a spawnmother in the caverns below. We call her Rattlebore." - Ko'char the Unbreakable
Program.FullCard.Name: Really Big Worm
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust ten cards you control to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When you are offered a second chance at life, you will do anything to seize it." - Erondra Frostmoon
Program.FullCard.Name: Reanimator's Hacker
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy this weapon Put target ally from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Scourge know this blade well, and it hungers for the damned." - Auryna the Lightsworn
Program.FullCard.Name: Reaper of Dark Souls
Program.FullCard.Rules: This weapon enters play with X +1 ATK counters.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "As Greatfather Winter walked Azeroth, bringing winter in his wake, it was said he would provide a bounty for those who welcomed his presence." - The Feast of Winter Veil
Program.FullCard.Name: Reason for the Season, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. If it's December, draw another card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Reaver of the Infinites
Program.FullCard.Rules: 15 Reaver of the Infinites has + ∞ ATK this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] As this effect resolves, choose any large positive integer to represent infinity (∞).

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The children of summer are reborn in my wake." - Arturius Hathrow
Program.FullCard.Name: Reawakening
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put any number of [Nature] allies from your graveyard into your resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Birth is less painful the second time." - Eriun Moonglow
Program.FullCard.Name: Rebirth
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Name: Recall from the Brink
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally or weapon card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Pain is only temporary, but your death will be permanent!" - Boarguts the Impaler
Program.FullCard.Name: Reckless Abandon
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If target friendly ally would be dealt damage this turn, it's dealt to your hero instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This is all the defense you could muster?" - Fillet, Kneecapper Extraordinaire
Program.FullCard.Name: Recklessness
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, add an abandon counter.
If your hero would deal or be dealt damage, that much +X is dealt instead, where X is the number of abandon counter.

Program.FullCard.Name: Reckoning
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protection Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero is dealt combat damage on an opponent's turn, you may ready a card you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light's justice is all-reaching and relentless."
Program.FullCard.Name: Reckoning of the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy each ability and equipment with which damage was dealt to your hero this game.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Applicable cards are destroyed only if they have remained in play continuously since that damage was dealt. If your hero is dealt damage with such a card, and then you play a Master hero, a modifier that checks if “damage was dealt to your hero this game” with that card remains true.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "…the fel orcs are on draenei holy ground, and their presence must be dealt with." - Vindicator Aluumen
Program.FullCard.Name: Reclaiming Holy Grounds
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put target quest card from your graveyard into hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Reclusion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that attached ally would deal.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Gimme a minute. I think I can fix this right up." - Chloe Mithrilbolt
Program.FullCard.Name: Reconstruct
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target equipment from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: All who saw his color red would soon find themselves amongst the dead.
Program.FullCard.Name: Red Bearon, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: The Red Bearon has +X ATK / +X health, where X is the combined DEF of your armor.

Program.FullCard.Name: Red Rider Air Rifle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long-Range
This weapon enters play with two eye counters.
This weapon has +2 ATK for each eye counter on it.
When you strike with this weapon, reveal the top card of your deck. If is has an odd cost, remove an eye counter from this weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light conquers even the darkness of death." - Thatia Truthbringer
Program.FullCard.Name: Redemption
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How could anything so big move so fast?" - Mazar
Program.FullCard.Name: Redouble Effort
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Ready Magtheridon. He can't attack the same hero more than once this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Make your way to the Redridge Mountains and speak with an associate of SI:7 named Lucius." - Renzik "The Shiv"
Program.FullCard.Name: Redridge Rendezvous
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card for each different [Alliance] race among heroes and allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: For every action, these blades provide an equal and deadly reaction.
Program.FullCard.Name: Reflex Blades
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an armor or weapon, ready Reflex Blades and your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Life springs most strongly from a field of death." - Brahu Starsear
Program.FullCard.Name: Reforestation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability or equipment. Put three Treant ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If the target is no longer legal as this card tries to resolve, no Treants enter play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm no adventurer - could you find my things and bring them here to me, please?" - Felix Whindlebolt
Program.FullCard.Name: Refugee's Quandary, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose one: Ready one of your equipment; or draw a card. If your hero is a Gnome, you may choose both.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The touch of nature soothes even the most battered of souls.
Program.FullCard.Name: Regrowth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and your hero heals 4 damage from it.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 1 damage from attached character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A man is truly a prisoner only as long as he agrees to remain one."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rehgar Earthfury
Program.FullCard.Rules:
[Alliance] allies in your party have +1 health.
[Horde] allies in your party have +1 ATK.
When Rehgar attacks, gain control of target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Rehgar has both factions, so he has 6 ATK / 6 health in the absence of any other modifiers. You gain control of target ally for the rest of the game, even if Rehgar leaves your party or loses his powers.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Is that all you have, dragon?" Radak bellowed as he brushed ash from his robes. The fires that burst up around him made him question the wisdom of his taunts.
Program.FullCard.Name: Reign of Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: Onyxia deals X fire damage to each opposing ally, where X is the current stage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Death cannot thwart the will of the elements. I still have much work to do." - Urrth
Program.FullCard.Name: Reincarnation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If your hero would be destroyed, remove Reincarnation from the game and remove all but 14 damage from your hero instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rejuvenation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: Attached hero has Mend 2. (At the start of your turn, it may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Rek'gar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When one of your Totems is destroyed, Rek'gar deals 1 frost damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rekwa Proudhorn
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 2 Flip Rekwa. BACK: Damage that Rekwa and allies you control would deal is unpreventable.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For every minute we delay, their fate comes one step closer to eternal doom." - Athridas Bearmantle
Program.FullCard.Name: Relics of Wakening, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Night Elf Hero Required
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Ready all allies in your party that haven't attacked this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The odds were already stacked against you." - Faesha Firestalker
Program.FullCard.Name: Reload
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready your hero and one of your Ranged weapons. If you ready a weapon this way, you pay 10 less the next time you strike with it this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I knew you'd see things my way."
Program.FullCard.Name: Remba, Abbess of Ash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
4, Flip Remba Gain control of target ally with an attachment. Use only on your turn.
Shadowforge

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I gave him a choice: die piece by piece, or all at once." - Gorebelly
Program.FullCard.Name: Rend
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 melee damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The warrior's wounds closed as quickly as they appeared.
Program.FullCard.Name: Renew
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 1 damage from attached character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those that fully embrace the cycle of life know that death is only a temporary state of being.
Program.FullCard.Name: Renewal of Life
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you may destroy this item. If you do, each player puts all allies from his graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This will hurt a bit."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rensarth Shadowsun
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 1, Put 1 damage on another ally in your party Target ally has -1 health this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Repentance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Retribution Hero Required
Destroy target ability, ally, or equipment that damage was dealt with or dealt by this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You are now tasked with the protection of the surrounding Elwynn Forest." - Marshall McBride
Program.FullCard.Name: Report to Goldshire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If you control more allies than an opponent: Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No injustice should go unpunished.
Program.FullCard.Name: Reprisal
Program.FullCard.Rules: If damage was dealt with target ability or equipment this turn, destroy it

Program.FullCard.Name: Repurposed Lava Dredger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3, Reveal the top card of your deck and an additional card for each heirloom counter on this equipent. Place each revealed card into your resource row exhausted as an additional resource.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Add an heirloom counter to target equipment you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can see the pain in your eyes. Let me help you relieve it." - Bulkas Wildhorn
Program.FullCard.Name: Requite
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 4 melee damage to target damaged hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We'll survive this yet with your help." - Zalduun
Program.FullCard.Name: Rescue the Survivors!
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Draenei Hero Required
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put two Draenei Survivor ally tokens into play with 0 ATK, 1 health, and "Exhaust your hero, remove this ally from the game Draw a card."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light blesses us with unflinching resolve." - Justice Blindburn
Program.FullCard.Name: Resolute Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: For each armor you control, your weapons have +1 ATK and you pay 1 less to strike with them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Any problem can be solved with a little ingenuity.
Program.FullCard.Name: Resourcefulness
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Survival Hero Required
Ongoing: Heroes and non-token allies in your party can be exhausted to pay costs as though they were resources.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Affected characters are _not_ resources. Affected allies can be exhausted this way regardless of how long they’ve been in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Well, fancy stunning into you here, of all places."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ressa Shadeshine
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Ressa Ressa deals melee damage to target ally equal to the ATK of one of your weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Thermaplugg and I do not take kindly to uninvited guests!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ressa the Leper Queen
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3, Flip Ressa Target player destroys one of his equipment.
Leper Gnome

Program.FullCard.Name: Rest and Relaxation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, , Exhaust two allies in your party Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Rise quickly, before the Lich King can raise you as one of his own!" - Thatia Truthbringer
Program.FullCard.Name: Restitution
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally with Assault, Mend, or Protector and cost less than or equal to the number of resources you control from your graveyard into play. Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For those damned souls, there is no eternal peace. We must provide their souls rest." - Father Gustav
Program.FullCard.Name: Restless Dead, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn: Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Each player shuffles his graveyard into his deck, and then draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: May your second chance end better than your first.
Program.FullCard.Name: Resurrection
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Alashon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: All keywords
When Alashon sabotages keywords, opposing cards everywhere lose and can't have keyword powers while he remains in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Athan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Scryer ReputationWhen Athan is destroyed, target player discards his hand, then draws that many cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Cara
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Equipment (This ally can attack opposing equipment.)
When Cara sabotages an equipment, gain control of it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Eteron
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Hand
When Eteron sabotages an opponent’s hand, look at it and choose up to two cards. That opponent puts those cards in his resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If we can cut their supply lines, they will choke to death."
Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Faryn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Resource
When Faryn sabotages a resource, gain control of it. (Move it to your resource row.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Jitaen
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Quest (This ally can attack opposing quests.)
When Jitaen sabotages a quest, turn it face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Scryers cannot be stopped."
Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Kai
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor card in your deck.)
When Kai or another Scryer ally enters your party, opposing heroes and allies can't protect this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is not my job to think. There are others for that. My purpose is death.
Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Kedryn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Stealth: (Can't protect against this character.)
When Kedryn deals combat damage to an ally, destroy that ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Khorbus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
When Khorbus deals combat damage, put him from play into his owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'd reconsider my options if I were you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Marcus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
When Marcus enters play, look at target player's hand and name a card in it.
That player can't play cards with that name.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Mythras
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
When Mythras enters play, target opponent gains control of him. Mythras can't attack.
At the end of your turn, destroy an ally in your party other than Mythras. If you can't, destroy Mythras.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Nealos
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Weapon (This ally can attack opposing weapons.)
When Nealos sabotages a weapon, exhaust it. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Ryn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Sabotage: Player
When Ryn sabotages a player, that player chooses an ability, ally, equipment, or resource he controls and puts it on top of its owner's deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Salvan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Armor (This ally can attack opposing armor.)
When Salvan sabotages a player's armor, exhaust all of that player's armor.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Zaelan
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation (Can't put Aldor cards in your deck.)
Sabotage: Equipment (This ally can attack opposing equipment.)
When Zaelan sabotages an equipment, put it into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer Zian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Stealth
Zian has -1 ATK / -1 health for each protector in play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Their weapons are as brutal as their tactics.
Program.FullCard.Name: Retainer's Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
When Retainer's Blade is destroyed, you may destroy target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Retaliation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: You pay 10 less to strike with melee weapons while your hero is defending

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Retribution looms for those beyond redemption.
Program.FullCard.Name: Retribution Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When a hero or ally in your party is dealt combat damage, it deals 1 holy damage to the source of that combat damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Return to Shadow Hold, kill Trey's torturer, and find his remains. There is no reason we can't tie off all these loose ends while Arko'narin mourns in her own private way." - Jessir Moonbow
Program.FullCard.Name: Retribution of the Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: All players shuffle their graveyards into their decks.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The time to end this war is at hand. The Lich King's tyranny ends today!" - Saurfang the Younger
Program.FullCard.Name: Return to Angrathar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to complete this quest for each Scourge ally you control.
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You bring this abomination of a book to this holy site?" - Exarch Onaala
Program.FullCard.Name: Return to the Aldor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation
If you have another Aldor card in play, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Many would pay a great price for the book you carry." - Larissa Sunstrike
Program.FullCard.Name: Return to the Scryers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
If you have another Scryer card in play, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Revenge
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You can't play Revenge during combat.
Destroy target ally that attacked your hero this turn but dealt no comat damage to your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They've requested something special for his get well party, kaliri stew." - The Rokk
Program.FullCard.Name: Revenge is Tasty
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Revenge is Tasty enters play exhausted.
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Reverend Tobias
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Exhaust target ready ally, and Reverand Tobias heals all damage from it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is the healing that allows me to continue fighting the good fight."
Program.FullCard.Name: Revitalize
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero heals 2 damage from attached character.

Program.FullCard.Name: Revival Stone
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally in your party.
Ongoing: When attached ally is destroyed, put it from its owner's graveyard into your party with damage equal to its health minus 1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rewards of Faith, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally. For each damage dealt this way, prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to a second hero or ally this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If your hero deals more than 1 damage this way, choose only one hero or ally for the prevention modifier, not one per damage dealt.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have watched the other races. I have seen their squabbling, their ruthlessness. Their wars do nothing but scar the land and drive the wild things to extinction. No, they cannot be trusted. Only beasts are above deceit."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rexxar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Rexxar enters play, put a unique Bear ally token named Misha with 3 ATK, 3 health, and ferocity into play.
Rexxar has +3 ATK and +3 health while Misha is in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rhok'delar, Longbow of the Ancient Keepers
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with Rhok'delar, your hero has long-range this combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We stand to lose everything if we do not stop fighting and work together!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Rhonin
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Discard a Mage with cost X > Interrupt target card with cost X.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Eat up if you want to be big and strong." - Souldrinker Bogmara
Program.FullCard.Name: Rhuunom
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, you may destroy target attachment. If you do, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: I can surely assist you in one way or another.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rhyllor of the Glade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector, Assault 1, Mend 1

Program.FullCard.Flavor: I have no fear that you'll be able to best Sapph, but do not grow overconfident. - Vereth the Cunning
Program.FullCard.Name: Rider of Frost, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. You pay 1 less to complete quests this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Only a paladin would be foolish enough to run into combat blindly. Then again, only a paladin would be that brave." - Deacon Markus Hallow
Program.FullCard.Name: Righteous Defense
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target friendly defending ally from combat, and your hero becomes a defender. Opposing heroes and allies can't attack that ally this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Your hero enters combat with the attacker and stays in combat until the combat concludes normally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Retribution comes swiftly for the wicked.
Program.FullCard.Name: Righteous Vengeance
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target attacking ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Righteousness Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: If a hero or ally in your party would deal damage, it deals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All of this undeath and ice is making me depressed. Can't we just burn it all down?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Riley Sizzleswitch
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Mage: Flip Riley Riey deals 2 fire damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Earthen Ring is here to assist Highlord Fordring and the Argent Crusade with whatever they may need.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rimblat Earthshatter
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation
Flip Rimblat, remove a Shaman in your graveyard from the game Destroy target ability that's not attached to a friendly card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: I bind you in silence, I bind you in pain, I bind you in darkness, for I am the dragon's bane.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Binding
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents pay 1 more to play abilities that target your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You're definitely strong, but do you have what it takes to become the Warmaul champion?" - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this location face up, reveal an Arena card from your hand.
You pay 2 less to complete your next quest this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If you have no other Arena cards in hand, you can't place this location face up.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "So, are you ready for your first battle?" - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: Brokentoe, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to play this face up, discard a card.
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] To place The Ring of Blood: Brokentoe face up onto the chain, you must discard another card.; If you have no other cards in hand, you can't place this quest face up. You’re the next player to get priority. As you do, that other card is already in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "He's hard as a rock - literally!" - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: Rokdar the Sundered Lord, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this quest face up, remove 2 damage from an opposing hero.
Pay (2) to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If no opposing heroes have 2 or more damage, you can't place this quest face up.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They got a ringer for the next match. They say he's a void lord or something…" - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: Skra'gath, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this quest face up, choose an opponent, and he may draw a card.
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's not too late to chicken out. I'd certainly understand." - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: The Blue Brothers, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this quest face up, choose an opponent, and he may put two Broken Arena ally tokens into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Oh boy. Mogor has invoked his right of battle as hero of the Warmaul. You have to fight him!" - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: The Final Challenge, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this quest face up, put 2 damage on your hero.
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They had to ship the champion in from the Blade's Edge gladiator pits. He was training on mountain giants - three at a time." - Gurgthock
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Blood: The Warmaul Champion, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As a cost to place this quest face up, put the top three cards of your deck into your graveyard.
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Flowing Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Exhaust X of your equipment Your hero heals X damage from itself.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] The activation of Ring of Flowing Light does not count as one of the X equipment you exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This ring will surely be put to the test against the full might of the Scourge and the Lich King." - Auryna the Lightsworn
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Invincibility
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Death Knight, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Target ally has Invincible this turn. (It can't leave play, be targeted, or be dealt damage.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of the Recalcitrant
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly heroes have +1 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Long forgotten on the bottom of Ghaz'an's water tank, the ring waited patiently.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of the Shadow Deeps
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Destory an ally in your party Your hero has +2 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of the Silver Hand
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all combat damage that target attacking ally would deal to your hero this combat.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of the Unliving
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero can't be destroyed.
While your hero has fatal damage on it, when it's dealt damage, destroy that many of your equipment and/or resources.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] When your hero is dealt fatal damage, the Ring’s power doesn’t trigger, and so you don’t destroy any cards. Only when your hero already has fatal damage and is dealt more damage does the Ring’s power trigger. As its triggered effect resolves, if you run out of other equipment and resources to destroy, you must destroy the Ring, causing your hero to be destroyed by fatal damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ring of Trials
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When a hero or ally in your party deals damage, add an arena counter.
, Remove three arena counters Target player chooses an ally in his party, and then you choose an ally in your party. Each deals melee damage equal to its ATK to the other.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Listen to the whispers of your ancestors. They lust for blood!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ringleader Kuma
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Kuma Heroes and allies in your party have +2 ATK while attacking heroes this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "So far, the Scourge have not impressed me much. They are no safer from my demonic powers than a living soul is."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rinni Gloomtrik
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Flip Rinni, discard a Warlock Rinni deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. When that character is destroyed this turn, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Learn from your mistakes, and you will grow to be a great fighter." - Blake Roberts
Program.FullCard.Name: Riot Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero is dealt combat damage, you may add a +1 [Armor] counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I got somethin' special on these blades for ya, mage!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ripley Spellfizzle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Arcane Resistance (Prevent all arcane [Arcane] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will rip apart reality itself to find what I seek!" - Marlowe the Felsworn
Program.FullCard.Name: Ripped through the Portal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Put an ally card that's removed from the game into play under your control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: To the beasts of Outland, Azeroth is a whole new world of prey.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ripper
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3 Double Ripper's ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ripple
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): The next time your hero would deal damage with an ability this turn, it deals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Most do not live long enough to rise above their own mediocrity." - Lieutenant Haggerdin
Program.FullCard.Name: Rise and Be Recognized
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, par 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rise to the Challenge
Program.FullCard.Notes: Errata: The +10 health modifier now applies to the attached hero, not the controller’s hero.
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to your hero and remove all damage from it.
Draw cards until you reach your maximum hand size.
Ongoing: Attached hero has +10 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rite of Vision
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Tauren Hero Required
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a Spirit Guide ally token with 1 ATK and 1 health into play. At the start of your next turn, remove that ally from the game. If you do, choose a card from your collection, reveal it, and put it into your hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] In a tournament, your collection is your side deck. In casual play, your collection includes all cards in your possession but excludes the cards with which you started the current game. Any time you're told to choose a card from your collection and put it into a game zone, you must choose a legal card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ritual of Souls
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if two or more allies are in your party.
Ongoing: Ritual of Souls, enters play with four spirit counters.
, remove a spirit counter Your hero heals 3 damage from target hero or ally. If no counters remain, destroy Ritual of Suols.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ritual of Summoning
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: On your turn: Exhaust your hero and two allies in your party Put an ally card from your collection into play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] In a tournament, your collection is your side deck. In casual play, your collection includes all cards in your possession but excludes the cards with which you started the current game. Any time you're told to choose a card from your collection and put it into a game zone, you must choose a legal card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Warlocks use every tool at their disposal, including friends.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ritual Sacrifice
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Destroy an ally in your party Your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A member of the Scarlet Brotherhood. He must have taken it to their library in the Scarlet Monastery in Tirisfal Glades!" - Magus Tirth
Program.FullCard.Name: Rituals of Power
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Target opposing card loses and can't have powers this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Who cares if they see us coming? They can't possibly stop us all!" - Justice Blindburn
Program.FullCard.Name: Riveted Abomination Leggings
Program.FullCard.Rules: Heroes you allies you control have Assault 2 and Conspicuous.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "From this moment, until the end of days I live and die - For the Horde!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Roanauk Icemist
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the end of your turn, put a 1 [Frost] / 1 [Health] Taunka ally token into play.
Taunka you control have Assault 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You may feel a slight tingle. Then again, it may be not so slight." - Nicholas Merrick
Program.FullCard.Name: Roaring Blaze
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 fire damage to each opposing ally for each card in your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Roasted Flesh
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Destroy Roasted Flesh Onyxia deals 3 fire damage to target opposing hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Robe of the Waking Nightmare
Program.FullCard.Rules: Dragonkin you control have +1 / +1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Decades of gnomish engineering have produced the ultimate design in fowl weaponry.
Program.FullCard.Name: Robotic Homing Chicken
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive.
At the start of your turn, each player rolls a die. If two or more players roll the same number, destroy Robotic Homing Chicken and all allies in those players' parties.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rockbiter Weapon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to one of your Melee weapons.
Ongoing: Attached weapon has +2 ATK.
Your hero has protector.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rocket Barrage
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When target Goblin Ally you control exhausts this turn, you may pay 1. If you do, it deals 1 fire damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A weapon found in Dire Maul, the rod bestows great power upon the wielder.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rod of the Ogre Magi
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, , Exhaust your hero Your hero deals 1 damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When it comes to the world of combat, Rodrigo leads the way.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rodrigo
Roena Trailmaker
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Roena has +1 health for each quest you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I do apologize. Are you feeling a bit lightheaded?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Roger Mortis
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Put 1 damage on another ally in your party Roger deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They will charge, and when they do, we'll be ready for them."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rogg Dreadnock
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero defends, Rogg deals 2 ranged damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Battle has left his heart as cold as his art.
Program.FullCard.Name: Roke the Ice Baron
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Frost allies in your party have " Target ally can't attack this turn."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Vengeance will be mine!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Roktar Blackfist
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Roktar enters play, destroy target resource if its controller has more resources than you.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rolan Phoenix
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aberration
When this ally is destroyed while you control another Worgen, you may pay 1. If you do, his owner puts him from his graveyard into his hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rolling Thunder
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elemental Hero Required
Your hero deals nature damage to target hero or ally equal to 3 plus an additional 3 for each equipment in that character's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "After Ahn'Qiraj, I can't even feel it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Roon Plainswalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Nature Resistance (Prevent all nature [Nature] damage that this ally would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Only the essence of the fallen demon will begin the lengthy healing process of the Winterfall tribe…and the salvation of Timbermaw Hold." - Gorn One Eye
Program.FullCard.Name: Root of All Evil, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Turn target quest face down.

Program.FullCard.Name: Roque Training
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly ally.
Ongoing: When attached ally deals combat damage to a defending hero, that hero's controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't think of yourself as bait for the legions of undead. Think of it as more of a diversionary tactic."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rordag the Sly
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Rogue: Flip Rordag Target hero or ally can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't turn your back on me, fool!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Rorga Trueshot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
Hardiness (If this ally would be dealt damage, prevent 1 of it.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Rosalyne von Erantor
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, she deals 3 fire damage to your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The words of Lady Liadrin act as a guide for each new lesson that the Light teaches me."
Program.FullCard.Name: Roshen the Oathsworn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
You pay 1 less to play Auras, Blessings, and Seals.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You should not always trust the earth you tread upon." - Tahanu Brinkrunner
Program.FullCard.Name: Rotten to the Spore
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust any number of target allies in target opponent's party.
Ongoing: Each of them can't ready during its controller's ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My father always said, 'A blade with blood not yet tasted is a blade that has surely been wasted.' He was a better rogue than a poet."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rotun Daggerhand
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Rotun Daggerhand Rotun deals 1 melee damage to target hero or ally. That damage counts as combat damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Routeen
Program.FullCard.Rules: Routeen deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally that was dealt damage this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Royal Guardian Jameson
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
At the end of your turn, exhaust target ready opposing ally. If you do, you may have it deal melee damage equal to its ATK to a second target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Never been good at fightin', mon. Spottin', that's my trade."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruala the Spotter
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust your hero Target ally has +3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Blazewing
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When this or another ally enters play under your control, it may deal 1 fire damage to target ally.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Your hero deals fire damage to target hero equal to the number of Dragonkin you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Emissary
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 2 less to play Priests and Paladins, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Drakonids are typically used as the primary footsoldiers for their fights.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Enforcer
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Ferocity.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Flameblade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Assault 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: She's a twenty-four karat, multifaceted, magical powerhouse.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Gemsparkle
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Flip Ruby Gemsparkle Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Protector
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Protector.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Skyrazor
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Untargetable.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The origin of dragonspawn is unknown, but they serve their Aspects with absolute loyalty.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruby Stalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Allies you control have Stealth. (They can't be protected against.)
