Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You will leave this world as you entered it. Naked, defenseless - with nothing." - Gorebelly
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruination
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one or both: Destroy target ally; or destroy target weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If anyone dies in the ring, we can bury them right away!" - Vixton Pinchwhistle
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruins of Lordaeron, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When a hero or ally in your party deals damage, add an arena counter.
, Remove three arena counters Put up to three target cards from one player's graveyard on the bottom of his deck.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] That player puts those cards on the bottom of his deck in the order of his choice (without revealing them).

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I sense weakness in your soul, and I mean to exploit it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rukdara Dreadhand
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Discard a card This turn, opposing allies have "This ally has -1 ATK for each damage on it."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is nice of you to pander to my lust for violence."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rula Blackfist
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Rula enters play, remove target ally from the game if its controller has more allies than you.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rulrin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Name: Run to Ground
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, target an opposing hero or ally. Allies in your party have +3 ATK while attacking that character this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Blaz
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, destroy all opposing abilities.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Koro
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing allies have -2 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Kress
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the end of your turn, roll a die.
1: Nothing happens.
2-3: Magmadar deals 1 fire damage to each hero and ally in a party of your choice.
4-5: Magmadar deals 3 fire damage to an opposing hero or ally.
6: Each opponent puts an ally from his party into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Mazj
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opponent plays an ability card, interrupt it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One of the main tools that druids use to shift forms.
Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Metamorphosis
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your Forms aren't destroyed by abilities you play. (You can still have only one card with Form(1) in play.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] For example, this means that Shred isn’t destroyed when you play a non-Feral ability. However, if you play an ability that destroys all cards in play, your Forms will be destroyed as normal.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Mohn
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes and allies can't be healed.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Theri
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your Core Ragers can't be destroyed or otherwise leave your control while your hero is Golemagg.
When Golemagg is destroyed, remove all of your Core Ragers from the game.

Program.FullCard.Name: Rune of Zeth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, if a hero is The Bomb, Baron Geddon deals 5 fire damage to that hero and each ally in its party.
At the end of your turn, choose an opposing hero to be The Bomb until the ned of your next turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When the runes on their blades glow, you had best turn and run. - Kalatine Carmichael
Program.FullCard.Name: Rune Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 melee damage to target ally, or put that ally on the bottom of its owner's deck if you control a Rune.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Forged in the fires of Acherus, these runeblades now serve the Horde and Alliance.
Program.FullCard.Name: Runed Soulblade
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Runed Soulblade enters play, you may destroy an ally in your party. If you do, your hero deals X shadow damage to target ally, where X was the ATK of that ally you destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Its lyrics are a chorus of death.
Program.FullCard.Name: Runesong Dagger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you draw a card, put a verse counter on Runesong Dagger.
1, Remove three verse counters Your hero deals 3 arcane damage to target ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Multiple cards are drawn one at a time, so if you draw two cards, you put two verse counters on Runesong Dagger, and so on. You must remove three counters from a single Runesong Dagger to use its power.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't go too far into da shadow, mon, or joo won't make it out.
Program.FullCard.Name: Runetusk
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Runetusk Target opponent discards a card. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Ruon Wildhoof
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mend 2 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Rupture
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Finishing Move (To play, remove X Combo cards in your graveyard from the game, where X is 5 or less.)
Attach to target hero or ally, and put X bleed counters on Rupture.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 melee damage to attached character for each bleed counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There's more where that came from."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ruthlessness
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assassination Hero Required
Put up to five Combo cards from your removed from game zone into hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Every wood has a path that only the wood dweller knows.
Program.FullCard.Name: Ryn Dreamstrider
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Target hero or ally has +2 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This is a 'small' sample of what's to come."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ryno the Short
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Ryno enters play, put a Felhunter Demon ally token into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.
1, Destroy a Demon in your party Interrupt target ability card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't come back without their bones."
Program.FullCard.Name: Ryno the Wicked
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 2, Flip Ryno Put a Felhunter Demon ally token into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and Pet(1).

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There is much that can be recovered from this shattered land."
Program.FullCard.Name: Rysa the Earthcaller
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
At the start of your turn, put a Totem card from your graveyard into hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "For those who are faithful, death is only temporary." - Emek the Equalizer
Program.FullCard.Name: Sacred Circle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target [Holy] ally from your graveyard into play if it costs less than or equal to the number of resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sacred Duty
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has protector.
When your hero protects, it heals 1 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Enjoy this respite while you still can." - Bronson Greatwhisker
Program.FullCard.Name: Sacred Moment
Program.FullCard.Rules: Cards in play can't ready until after your next turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sacred Purification
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability. If it was attached to a friendly hero or ally, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sacred Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules: Interrupt target ability that is targeting a friendly card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It be a shame to kill Zim'bo, mon, but he swore da blood oath to defend Drak'Tharon and he done failed." - Image of Drakuru
Program.FullCard.Name: Sacrifices Must Be Made
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw three cards, then discard two cards unless you discard an ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The end will at least be a respite from this heat," Warrax thought as he lay charred and broken on the cavern floor. He was a true hero, living his life and dying his death for others.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sacrificial Meal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each opponent destroys one of his abilites, allies, or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sacrificial Poison
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Attach to target hero that your hero dealt combat damage to this turn.
Ongoing: At the start of attached hero's controller's turn, he destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your sacrifice shall not go unrewarded." - Grand Marshall Goldensword
Program.FullCard.Name: Sacrificial Vengeance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally in your party.
Ongoing: When attached ally is destroyed, target opponent destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Never has there been a better definition of trying to choose between the lesser of two evils." - Moala Stonebinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Sadistic Choice
Program.FullCard.Rules: Reveal the top two cards of your deck. Target raiding player chooses whether you put them into your hand or graveyard. If he chooses the graveyard, draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You cannot escape my runeblade. It has already tasted your soul and will not stop until it consumes you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Saeryn Dusksorrow
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Saeryn Put target weapon card from your graveyard into hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Safeguard
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ready your hero.
Ongoing: Your hero has protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The abundant shadows of Ironforge are a blessing to the city's more stealthy denizens.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sal Grimstalker
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)
At the start of your turn, target hero or ally has stealth this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The awful smell is just the beginning.
Program.FullCard.Name: Saliva Corroded Pike
Program.FullCard.Rules: When damage is dealt with this weapon on an opponent's turn, you may ready it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All shall feel my wrath." - Halavar
Program.FullCard.Name: Salt the Wounds
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 1 melee damage to each opposing hero and ally with damage.
Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Your hero deals 1 melee damage to each opposing hero with damage and each opposing ally with damage. You draw a card whether or not any damage is dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Many sought a mount that would bring its own armor to war. Landro delivered.
Program.FullCard.Name: Saltwater Snapjaw
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3 Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Saltwater Snapjaw this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Jeff Donais 8/18/2006] We also made the piece of loot appropriate for the card it appears on. So the loot card version of Saltwater Snapjaw has the turtle mount.

Program.FullCard.Name: Salvation
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 8 damage divided as you choose from any number of target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Samowhat?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Samophlange
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust one of your equipment and pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Mysterious disappearances? I wouldn't know anything about that."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sampron the Banisher
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Remove target opposing ally from the game.
When Sampron leaves play, the owner of each card removed this way puts that card into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In life, he was quick and cruel. In death, why change?
Program.FullCard.Name: Samuel Grey
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Samuel Grey deals combat damage to a defending hero, that hero's controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "An old corpse dies, and a hero lives. Fair trade."
Program.FullCard.Name: Samuel Harrison
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Will of the Forsaken (This ally cant leave play unless it has fatal damage or 0 health.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: From the youngest child to the most veteran soldier, the Light heartens all who are worthy.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sanctity Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Retribution Hero Required
Ongoing: Holy allies in your party have +2 ATK while attacking.
If your hero would deal holy damage, it deals that much +2 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Wheeeee!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sandbox Tiger
Program.FullCard.Rules: Sandbox Tiger has +1 ATK / +1 health for each Loot card in play you control.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] A loot card is a card with the word "loot" in its collector number. Unscratched loot cards aren’t legal in any sanctioned tournament.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A storm's approaching.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sanva
Program.FullCard.Rules: War Stop (When this ally attacks or defends, you may exhaust target opposing hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Sap
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally and exhaust it.
Ongoing: Attached character can't ready during its controller's ready step.
When attached character is dealt damage, destroy Sap.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sapphiron's legacy imbues the cloak with the promise of magic.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sapphiron Drape
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If your hero would deal damage with an ability, it deals that amount of damage plus 1 instead.
If your hero would heal damage with an ability, it heals that amount of damage plus 1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sardok
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Physical Resistance Prevent all melee ([Melee]) and ([Ranged]) damage that would be dealt to this ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The armies of the Lich King destroyed my home and took my family. I have been blessed by the Light, and I will see justice brought to the Scourge, one way or another."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sarina the Immaculate
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: Flip Sarina, discard a Paladin Sarina heals 5 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I love attention, honey - just not that kind."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sarlia
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Untargetable
1 Other allies in your party are elusive this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Voidwalkers do not fear pain, so they are popular with warlocks who do.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sarmoth
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes and allies that can attack Sarmoth can attack only Sarmoth.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sarn Earthtrembler
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
War Stomp (When this ally attacks or defends, you may exhaust target opposing hero or ally.)
You pay 1 less to play Sarn for each exhausted opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Like father, like son.
Program.FullCard.Name: Saurfang the Younger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When Saurfang enters combat with an ally with damage, destroy it and ready Saurfang.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Rise up, sons of the Horde! Blood and glory await us!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Saurfang the Younger, Kor'kron Warlord
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When this ally enters play, you may search your deck for a card named Kor'kron Vanguard, reveal it, and put it into your hand.
Death Rattle: Turn all locations you control face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even the most serene of druids may have a restless beast caged within." - Arturius Hathrow
Program.FullCard.Name: Savage Bear Form
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoign: Your hero has Protector and a +5 [Health]. (It may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Never corner an animal unless you can kill it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Savage Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Feral Hero Required
Ongoing: When you play a Feral ability, if you control a Form, your hero may deal 2 melee damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The sound can make even the bravest warrior cower in fear." - Kauno Stonehoof
Program.FullCard.Name: Savage Roar
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Finishing Move (To play, remove X Combo cards in your graveyard from the game, where X is 5 or less.)
Ongoing: This ability enters play with X roar counters.
While you control a Form, your hero has Assault 1 for each roar counter.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sava'gin the Reckless
Program.FullCard.Rules:
This ally attacks opposing heroes and allies at random.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Your hero deals 2 nature damage to target random opposing hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those who underestimate the power of the Light do so only once.
Program.FullCard.Name: Savin Lightguard
Program.FullCard.Rules: 6, Flip Savin Lightguard Destroy all allies that dealt combat damage to Savin this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "To humbly serve the calling of Cenarius, that is the duty of all children of the forest."
Program.FullCard.Name: Savina Greysky
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Savina Greysky has +2 ATK while you control a Form.

Program.FullCard.Name: Savis Cindur
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aberration (Prevent all non-combat damage that would be dealt to this ally.)
Ferocity (This ally can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They can't hit me until they see me, and they can't see my until it's too late."
Program.FullCard.Name: Savitir Skullsmasher
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Savitir If Savitir has stealth, destroy target exhausted equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bows for foes, guns for fun."
Program.FullCard.Name: Savuka the Acute
Program.FullCard.Rules: While you control a [Hunter] Ranged weapon, this ally has Assault X and Long-Range, where X is the highest ATK among [Hunter] Ranged weapons you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The longer you wait, the less future you have for me to foretell."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sayge
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, remove the top card of target opponent's deck from the game. If it's an ability, ally, or equipment card, you may play it this game. (Pay costs as normal.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Some things are just too hot to handle." - Phosphus the Everburning
Program.FullCard.Name: Scald
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target equipment.
Ongoing: Attached equipment loses and can't have powers.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 fire damage to attached equipment's controller's hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've slain dragons and demons! What are you compared to them?" - Shaii
Program.FullCard.Name: Scaled Breastplate of Carnage
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally deals damage to another ally, destroy both of them.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Ours is the loneliest profession."
Program.FullCard.Name: Scaramanga
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Scaramanga Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Its secret is that the blood of its victims keeps the scarlet color bright.
Program.FullCard.Name: Scarlet Kris
Scatter Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Marksmanship Hero Required
Your hero deals ranged damage to target hero or ally equal to 1 plus the combined ATK of your Ranged weapons. If a hero is dealt damage this way, its controller can't play cards this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Treat the earth with respect, and it will return the favor three times over." - Mythen of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Name: Scent of Nature
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 2 damage from target hero or ally, or 6 if you completed a quest this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Scepter of the Unholy
Program.FullCard.Rules: If a card or effect you control would cause an opponent to discard a card, he discards a random card instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "In death, I have plenty of time to study my ancient tomes."
Program.FullCard.Name: Scholar Krosiss
Program.FullCard.Rules: Krosiss has +2 ATK/ +2 Health while you have seven or more cards in hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is swift and surprising, like the ethereals for which it is named.
Program.FullCard.Name: Scimitar of the Nexus Stalkers

Program.FullCard.Flavor: All magi are pyromaniacs...at least a little bit.
Program.FullCard.Name: Scorch
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How do you expect to fight when you are too weak to pick up your sword?" - Bordrak Barrelblast
Program.FullCard.Name: Scorpid Sting
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of attached hero's controller's turn, he exhausts an equipment he controls. If you control a Ranged weapon, he exhausts a second equipment he controls.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sometimes where there's smoke, you wish there were only fire.
Program.FullCard.Name: Scourge Cauldrons, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top four cards of your deck. Put a revealed quest card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Those monsters began using crusaders as living shields." - Crusade Commander Entari
Program.FullCard.Name: Scourge Tactics
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You pay 1 less to complete this quest for each ally in your graveyard.
Pay 5 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Scourgeborne Battlegear
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the end of your turn, you may remove target ally in a graveyard from the game. If you do, put a 3 [Melee] / 3 [Health] Ghoul ally token into play.
Your hero deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally. Ready a Ghoul you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If I have your assistance, you must go into the desert and recover the silithyst and return it here." - Marshal Bluewall
Program.FullCard.Name: Scouring the Desert
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. You may shuffle your graveyard into your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you see one scout, there are probably three more that you can't see." - Kinivus
Program.FullCard.Name: Scout Kurgo
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play Kurgo, you may search your deck and hand for any number of cards names Scout Kurgo and put them into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stay here while I check out the path ahead."
Program.FullCard.Name: Scout Omerrta
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Why is it looking at me like that?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Scraps
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, destroy Scraps unless you remove an ally card in any graveyard from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can't even hear myself think!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Screeching Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Opposing heroes and allies have -1 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest strength of the Scryers is their collusion with each other.
Program.FullCard.Name: Scryer's Bloodgem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Heroes and allies in your party with sabotage also have stealth

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Arrr! Your booty is as good as mine!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Seadog Nally
Program.FullCard.Rules:
2, Flip Nally, destroy a friendly ally Nally deals ranged damage to target ally equal to that friendly ally's ATK.
Southsea Freebooters

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal Fate
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assassination Hero Required
As an additional cost to play this ability, put the top five cards of your deck into your graveyard.
Your hero deals melee damage to target hero or ally equal to the number of [Rogue] abilities put into your graveyard this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Betrayal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: When an ally is destroyed by combat damage dealt by your hero with a weapon, put that ally from its owner's graveyard into play under your control.
2, Destroy Seal of Betrayal Gain control of target ally that your hero dealt combat damage to this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Blood
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Horde Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon to a hero or ally, your hero also deals 2 holy damage to that character and 1 holy damage to itself.
1, Destroy Seal of Blood Your hero deals 2 holy damage to target hero or ally and 1 holy damage to itself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Command
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Retribution Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon to a hero or ally, your hero then deals 2 holy damage to that character.
1, Destroy Seal of Command Your hero deals 4 holy damage to target exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Danzalar, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, your hero deals shadow damage to target hero equal to the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that hero's controller's hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This effect resolves before your draw step. Count cards as it resolves.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We will not be dissuaded from our goals. Too much is at stake." - Zophos the Vengeful
Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Divinity
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, prevent all damage that would be dealt to target friendly ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Justice
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, exhaust target hero or ally. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.
1, Destroy Seal of Justice Exhaust target hero or ally. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It was said that every enemy Uther felled strengthened his resolve.
Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, it heals 2 damage from itself.
1, Destroy Seal of Light Your hero heals 4 damage from itself.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 11/3/2006] If you strike with a weapon during combat, and then your hero deals a "packet" of 1 or more damage during the conclusion of that combat, that whole packet is said to be "combat damage dealt with that weapon." As long as that packet is not completely prevented, Seal of Light will trigger. This is the case even if: That weapon's ATK was 0 as its strike effect resolved (like an unpumped Longsword); and/or; There are other buffs increasing the size of that packet (like Blessing of Might). To answer later questions: If you prevent some but not all of a packet of combat damage dealt with a weapon, you can't specify that you want to prevent the "part from the weapon" or anything like that, because it's *all* from the weapon.; You must strike with a weapon if you want to deal combat damage with that weapon. It's not enough just to have that weapon in your hero row and deal combat damage via something like Blessing of Might.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Purity
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Weapons you control have Assault 1.
When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, you may destroy target ability that's attached to a friendly card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Redemption
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, put an ally card from your graveyard into hand.
1, Destroy Seal of Redemption Put an ally card from your graveyard into hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Retribution
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, you may destroy target ally that attacked this turn.
1, Destroy Deal of Retribution Destroy target ally that attacked this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are no limits to what you can accomplish when you wield the light." - Grand Marshal Goldensword
Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Righteousness
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your Melee weapons have +1 ATK.
Destroy Seal of Righteousness Your hero deals 2 holy damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Sanctity
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, add a purity counter.
You’re hero has Mend 1 for each purity counter.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of the Crusader
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has -1 ATK.
When your hero deals combat damage for the first time each turn, you may ready it and one of your Melee weapons.
1, Destroy Seal of the Crusader Your hero has +2 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Vengeance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Alliance Hero Required
Ongoing: At the end of each turn, your hero deals 1 holy damage to each hero and ally it dealt combat damage to this turn.
1, Destroy Seal of Vengeance Your hero deals 1 holy damage to each hero and ally it dealt combat damage to this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Such a seal sharpens the mind for the moment of revelation to come."
Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Wisdom
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, draw a card.
1, Destroy Seal of Wisdom Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seal of Wrath
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a weapon, it may also deals 2 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Can it wait? I'm busy here."
Program.FullCard.Name: Seamus Somerset
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When Seamus attacks, you may remove target card in a graveyard from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let this fire consume you!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sear
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 fire damage to target ally, or 6 if that ally was dealt damage this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Dizdemona didn't mind dealing with dangerous power. She was, after all, a warlock. But as the flames grew around her, even she began to doubt the wisdom of assaulting the dragon's lair.
Program.FullCard.Name: Searing Flames
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Name: Searing Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Holy Hero Required
Ongoing: 2, Discard an ability card Your hero deals 3 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally.
Destroy Searing Light Your hero deals 3 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Searing Pain
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 fire damage to target hero or ally, plus an additional 2 for each [Fire] card you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The wood whispered to me as I conjured it. It said it did not fear flame." - Grennan Stormspeaker
Program.FullCard.Name: Searing Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Totem (Can be attacked or targeted like an ally.)
Ongoing: At the start of each turn, Searing Totem deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Ragnrok 11/10/2006] Searing Totem is an ability that is played, it does not attach to anything. It is also an Instant ability which means if your opponent is all tapped out, you can play it at the end of your opponent's turn and ping your choice target at the start of your turn and then ping something else at the start of your opponent's turn with the potential to do more if you have ways to protect it. Yes it is fragile and decks with lots of abilities can deal with it easily, but it is great to get rid of pesky weenie allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Graccus wiped the sweat from his brow and sighed. So far, the dragon just seemed angrier. He hefted his shield, twirled his blade, and sprinted toward her once again.
Program.FullCard.Name: Second Wind
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each player draws cards until he reaches his maximum hand size.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Akama must be warned. Our plans are in jeopardy!" - Seer Olum
Program.FullCard.Name: Secret Compromised, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Look at the top three cards of target opponent's deck. Put one on top of his deck and the rest on the bottom.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We need more weapons in the fight against the Scourge." - Lord Itharius
Program.FullCard.Name: Seeds of the Lashers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Exhaust seven cards you control to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Seeping Shadows
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 shadow damage to attached hero. Its controller puts a card from the top of his deck into his graveyard for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We work in the shadows and lies." - Spymaster Thalodien
Program.FullCard.Name: Seer's Signet
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation
Your hero has "Sabotage: Ability or equipment."
When your hero sabotages a card, destroy it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The air was thick with defeat and death until Gorebelly cried, "For the Horde!" Thrall's champions surged forward.
Program.FullCard.Name: Seize the Moment
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents choose a player. That player readies all of his cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sek Grimlash
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy another ally in your party Put a Demon ally card from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Run as fast or as far from me as you wish; it will matter not."
Program.FullCard.Name: Selin Duskrunner
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an ability, Selin deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Vol'jin relocated his people to this village on the coast of southern Durotar.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sen'jin Village
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Troll Hero Required
At the start of your turn, choose a Troll in your party, and it may heal 1 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I know whom you seek, but you'll have to deal with me first."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sentry Gwynn
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has elusive.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Aided by the Spirit of Air, a shaman may be able to see faraway objects or events, whether the distance be physical or temporal.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sentry Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When an opposing ally enters play, exhaust it.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Vicious and cunning; like hunter, like pet.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sen'zir Beastwalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Sen'zir Beastwalker Put a Pet card from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo are goin' ta have ta do betta dan dat, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sepirion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Berserking (+1 ATK for each damage)
When Sapirion attacks for the first time each turn, you may pay 1. If you do, ready him.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo ready for more?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sepirion the Poised
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Sepirion Ready Sepirion and one of your weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Humans have many allies to draw upon, especially in times of need.
Program.FullCard.Name: Seraph the Exalted
Program.FullCard.Notes: Errata: Putting an ally in to play is now an optional part of using his power.
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Human Hero Required
You may put an ally card from your hand into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I got promoted. Yay!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sergeant Pugg
Program.FullCard.Rules: Other allies have -1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Laced with poisonous toxins, the serpent sting burns the very blood of its target.
Program.FullCard.Name: Serpent Sting
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 nature damage to attached character, or 2 if you have a Ranged weapon.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Deep within the Steam Vault, the Mekgineers construct some of the most powerful weapons in Outland.
Program.FullCard.Name: Serpentcrest Life-Staff
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Discard a card Your hero heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Set Ablaze
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Set Ablaze enters play with X burn counters.
At the start of your turn, destroy each opposing ally and weapon with cost equal to the number of burn counters, then remove a burn counter. If none remain, destroy Set Ablaze.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My son hopes to be the next Nat Pagle." - Zahlia
Program.FullCard.Name: Seth's Graphite Fishing Pole
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put the card tenth from the top of your deck into hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] Don't look at any other cards in your deck. If there are less than ten cards in your deck, nothing happens.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Elune be praised!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Seva Shadowdancer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
X, Seva Shadowdancer heals X damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One good death deserves another.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sever the Cord
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play Sever the Cord, destroy an ally in your party.
Destroy target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadala
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an ability, you may destroy target ability

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You have served your purpose."
Program.FullCard.Name: Shade of Arugal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
Death Rattle: You may destroy an Unlimited Scourge ally you control. If you do, put this ally from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo don't want ta hear de cat's purr, mon. Joo won't never hear nothin' again." - Warmaster Bo'jo
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
(Can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Diversity." - Harnessing Shadows by Lady Sevine
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow and Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destruction Hero Required
Ongoing: 1, Destroy an ability you control Your hero deals 2 shadow or fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May darkness take you, for when I'm done, the Light will not recognize you." - Radak Doombringer
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Bolt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally. When that character is destroyed this turn, its controller discards a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 11/13/2006] Re: Shadow Bolt + Totem - The short answer is: the controller of a totem targeted by Shadow Bolt must discard when that totem is destroyed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "They say it is always darkest before the dawn. I say we never let the dawn come at all." - Randolphe Mortimer
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Burst
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 shadow damage to target hero or ally. When that character is destroyed this turn, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Channeler
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Channeler can attack only heroes and has +X ATK while attacking, where X is 1 plus the number of Warlocks that have left your party.
3, Shadow Channeler deals 1 shadow damage to each hero and ally in target raiding player's party. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Channeler
Program.FullCard.Rules: Shadow Channeler can attack only heroes and has +X ATK while attacking, where X is 1 plus the number of Warlocks that have left your party.3, Shadow Channeler deals 1 shadow damage to each hero and ally in target raiding player's party. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Keep your focus. The shadows will not harm you." - Addisyn the Untouchable
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Resistance Aura
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Friendly allies have Shadow Resistance while ready. (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that they would be dealt.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I don't worry about pain. I have something else for that." - Omedus the Punisher
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Silhouettes
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, remove 6 damage from your hero and put 1 damage on Shadow Silhouettes for each damage removed this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Of course I am more comfortable in darkness than in the light." - Gladiator Meganna
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Tactics
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Preparation (On your first turn, you may play this card without paying its cost.)
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play Combos and finishing moves, to a minimum of 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "How's it taste?" - Marlowe Christophers
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Ward
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has Shadow Resistance this turn. (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that they would be dealt.)
When damage that an opposing hero or ally would deal is prevented this way, your hero may deal that much shadow damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Weaving
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Hero Required
Attach to target opposing hero or ally.
Ongoing: If attached character would be dealt shadow damage, it's dealt that much +2 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I…hate…priests!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Word: Agony
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, attached hero's controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The further you delve into these arts, the greater the risk you place yourself in." - Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Word: Anguish
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 5 shadow damage to target ally and 5 shadow damage to itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The shadows care not who they hurt. Set them loose, and they will do their job." - Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Word: Chaos
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 4 shadow damage to a random opposing hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: As words go, it's frequently the last.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Word: Death
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally. If that character doesn't have fatal damage on it, put 3 damage on your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your pain is my pleasure." - Omedus the Punisher
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadow Word: Pain
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally, and its controller discards a card.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to attached character.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowburn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destruction Hero Required
As an additional cost to play Shadowburn, destroy one of your resources.
Your hero deals 4 shadow damage to target hero or ally. When that character is destroyed this turn, put the top card of your deck into your resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowfiend
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
When Shadowfiend deals combat damage to a hero, ready one of your resources.
At the end of your turn, put Shadowfiend into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I draw deep into the shadows to slake my thirst for power. I'm never thirsty for long."
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowform
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Hero Required
Ongoing: If your hero would deal shadow damage, it deals that amount of damage plus 1 instead. When you play a Holy ability, destroy Shadowform.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowfury
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Destruction Hero Required
Your hero deals 2 shadow damage to each opposing ally. Exhaust each ally dealt damage this way, and it can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The forests of Teldrassil are not so empty as they appear.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowmeld
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Night Elf Hero Required
Ongoing: Your hero is elusive and untargetable.
At the start of your turn, destroy Shadowmeld.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] Players can target your hero in response to you playing Shadowmeld. However, you can’t play Shadowmeld in response to a link targeting your hero, because Shadowmeld is not instant.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowmistress Jezebel Hawke
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly Pets have +2 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The most vicious attackers dwell in the shadows.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowprowler's Chestguard
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Blood of Gladiators) - requires 6 Primal Earth, 6 Primal Shadow, 5 Heavy Knothide Leather, 8 Bolt of Soulcloth, 1 Primal Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has +1 ATK while attacking for each hero and ally in your party with stealth.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Rhuunom will only be gone for a moment. Can you say the same for yourself?" - Felbender Lara
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadows of Death
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1, Destroy a Demon or Ghoul you control Your hero deals 3 shadow damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowstalker's Sash
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly Druids and Rogues have stealth. (Can't protect against them.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Death is only a step away.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowstep
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Subtlety Hero Required
Ongoing: Ready opposing heroes and allies also count as being exhausted. (They are still ready.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The mystical polearm can transform into Thunderstrike. It can also be disenchanted into a nexus crystal, which some argue may be of more use.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shadowstrike
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Destroy Shadowstrike If your hero has Enchanting, draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Of course I saw you coming. How else could you have gotten so dangerously close?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Shaii, Strategist Supreme
Program.FullCard.Rules: If Shaii is defending: , Flip Shaii Shaii deals 1 melee damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sha'kar
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero has dealt fire, frost, or nature damage this turn, Sha'kar has ferocity. (He can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Sha'lin Nightwind
Program.FullCard.Notes: Errata: Art credit should be Ralph Horsley, not Alex Garner
Program.FullCard.Rules: Elusive (Can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Step through the storm and discover your true worth."
Program.FullCard.Name: Shalu Stormshatter
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Shalu Destroy target ability that's not attached to a friendly hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shaman Training
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target friendly ally.
Ongoing: When attached ally attacks for the first time each turn, you may pay 1. If you do, ready it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shamanistic Dual Wield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Enhancement Hero Required
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to strike with weapons.
Your hero has dual wield.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shamanistic Rage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Enhancement Hero Required
Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with one or more Melee weapons for the first time each turn, ready up to X of your resources, where X is the combined strike cost of those weapons.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shanis Bladefall
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Shard of the Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a resource enters play under your control, your hero heals 2 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shard of the Scale
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Shard of the Scale Put the top card of your deck into your resource row face down and exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sharial
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
Exhaust target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Take a deep breath … hold steady … and trust your eyes. - Ona Skyshot
Program.FullCard.Name: Sharp Eye
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target hero or ally you control has Assault 2 and Long-Range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's simple, mon. I just take aim and fire!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sharpeye Yan'ja
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 2, Flip Yan'ja Yan'ja deals ranged damage to target ally equal to 1 plus the combined ATK of your Ranged weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Aye, soon your shots will be as good as mine."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sharpshooter Nally
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Nally Target hero or ally has long-range this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shatterer, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with The Shatterer to a hero, destroy one of that hero's controller's weapons unless he pays 2.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The three most important aspects of weaponry are repair, repair and repair.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shattering Blow
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shattering Scales
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy all opposing abilites and equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shattrath City Peacekeeper
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Allies not named Shattrath City Peacekeeper have -1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Only those of sound mind will be able to keep their thoughts free from the Old God of Death." - Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Name: Shawl of Haunted Memories
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, , Destroy this armor Destroy target ability, ally, or equipment that shares a name with a card in its controller's graveyard.
Death Rattle: Target opponent puts the top three cards of his deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Who died and made him king of the zombies?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Shawn of the Dead
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Shawn of the Dead attacks, you may put an ally card from target opponent's graveyard into play under your control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shazzrah
Program.FullCard.Rules:
FRONT: Shazzrah has +2 ATK while attacking and can attack only heroes.
1 Flip Shazzrah. Use only once per turn.
BACK: When Shazzrah flips to this side, drop him from at least three feet above play. He deals 5 arcane damage to each opposing hero and ally he lands on.
At the start of your turn, flip Shazzrah.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shazzrah's Arcane Explosion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to each hero and ally in target opponent's party. If your hero is Shazzrah, draw three cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sheath of Light
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: There's a good reason a defensive strategy is called "turtling."
Program.FullCard.Name: Shelly
Program.FullCard.Rules: If Shelly would be dealt combat damage, prevent 1 of that damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will ensure your safety." - Keegana Silvershield
Program.FullCard.Name: Shelter
Program.FullCard.Rules: This turn, target non-hero card can't be destroyed, and if it's an ally, prevent all damage that would be dealt to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the Light keep and protect you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Shelter the Flock
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 11 damage from each friendly hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shem Reznict
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target up to three heroes and/or allies. Shem deals 3, 2, and 1 nature damage to them, respectively.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shield Bash
Program.FullCard.Notes: Errata: Talent should be Protection, not Fury; damage is Melee
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You may exhaust one of your Shields rather than pay Shield Bash's cost.
Your hero deals 1 melee damage to target hero or ally. If you targeted a hero, you may interrupt an ability card played by its controller.

Program.FullCard.Flavor:
"My faith be my shield." - Mojo Mender Ja'nah
"Mine be dis huge metal thing, mon" - Indalamar
Program.FullCard.Name: Shield Block
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You may exhaust a Shield you control rather than pay this card's cost.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You must come to grips with the cold, hard fact that you cannot arm me." Erondra Frostmoon
Program.FullCard.Name: Shield of Distortion
Program.FullCard.Rules: Prevent all non-melee (non-[Melee]) damage that would be dealt to target hero or ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shield or Wield
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose one: Prevent the next 3 damage that target ally would be dealt this turn; or attach to target hero.
Ongoing: Attached hero has +1 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Name: Shield Slam
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protection Hero Required
You may exhaust one of your Shields rather than pay Shield Slam's cost.
Your hero deals 3 melee damage to target hero or ally. If you targeted a hero, you may destroy an ability controlled by its controller.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The strength in a warrior's shield comes from within." - "Bonewall" Simms
Program.FullCard.Name: Shield Wall
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put three Wall armor tokens into play with 1 DEF.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The pain from the blade is the least of your worries.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shiv
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 melee damage to target hero or ally. That damage counts as combat damage.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This is the first card that lets you deal combat damage with an ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The elements can bring succor or wreak destruction.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shock and Soothe
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 nature damage to target hero or ally and heals 3 damage from another target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Arrr, me hearties! I be havin' some extra treasure that I be givin' away at the Gurubashi Arena!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Short John Mithril
Program.FullCard.Rules: When John enters play, search your deck for an equipment card and reveal it. If it's an Arena card, put it into hand. Otherwise, put it on top of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When function is more important than fashion.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shoulderpads of Fleshwerks
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this armor enters play, you may destroy target ally with Mend or Protector.

Program.FullCard.Name: Showdown
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a unique Mok'Nathal Beastmaster ally token named Rexxar into play with 3 [Ranged] ATK / 4 health and "At the start of your turn, destroy target Gronn." Each opponent may put a Gronn ally token into play with 5 [Melee] ATK / 5 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Of course claws are better than a weapon: they have three times the blades!" - Arktos
Program.FullCard.Name: Shred
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When Shred enters play, your hero may deal 2 melee damage to target exhausted hero or ally.
Your hero is in cat form. (+1 ATK while attacking. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The truest agony goes deeper than mere flesh and bone.
Program.FullCard.Name: Shred Soul
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove target ally from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Shelly and Shredder just never seem to get along." - Gladiator Magnus
Program.FullCard.Name: Shredder
Program.FullCard.Rules: Preparation (On your first turn, you may play this card without paying its cost.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Shuriken of Negation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Shuriken of Negation enters play, you may interrupt target ability card.
Thrown (When you stike with this weapon, your hero has long-range this combat. At the end of this turn, put this weapon into its owner's hand.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Shutting Down Manaforge Ara
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an equipment was destroy this turn, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will serve whoever can satiate my thirst."
Program.FullCard.Name: Siaranna the Fickle
Program.FullCard.Rules: When a player plays an ability, he gains control of Siaranna.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sigil of Krasus, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an opponent played an ally this turn, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You thought you could rest because you were dead? I think not." - Triton the Sacrilegious
Program.FullCard.Name: Sigil of the Vengeful Heart
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Ready target Ghoul.
When you play a weapon, ready this item.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I shall reward your courage with an eternity of pain and suffering." - Kel'Thuzad
Program.FullCard.Name: Signet of Manifested Pain
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you may put 2 damage on your hero. If you do, put a 2 [Melee] / 2 [Health] ally token into play with the same class and race as your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Wave after wave of Scourge attacked me, and wave after wave broke on my defenses." - Blaine Roberts
Program.FullCard.Name: Signet of the Impregnable Fortress
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Heroes and allies you control have Protector.
Each opposing hero and ally has -2 ATK on its controller's turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Greetings, my friend…I want to welcome you to the greatest show on Azeroth!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Silas Darkmoon
Program.FullCard.Rules: Silas has ATK equal to the combined ATK of all other allies in your party, and health equal to the combined health of all other allies in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: All blood elves are tied to the arcane, even those who don't practice the arts themselves.
Program.FullCard.Name: Silea Dawnwalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an ability, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Silencing Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Marksmanship Hero Required
You may exhaust one of your Ranged weapons rather than pay Silencing Shot's cost.
Your hero deals 2 ranged damage to target hero or ally.
If you targeted a hero, its controller can't play abilities this turn, and you may interrupt an ability card he played.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You may interrupt an ability card that player played only if it's on the chain as Silencing Shot resolves. The “can’t play abilities” restriction applies whether or not you interrupted an ability card. The controller of a targeted hero can play any number of instant abilities in response to Silencing Shot, and those abilities can’t be interrupted by it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Shhh…" - Rordag the Sly
Program.FullCard.Name: Silent Crusader
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an opponent's hero is dealt combat damage with this weapon, exhaust all cards he controls.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Speaking never seemed like a luxury before…
Program.FullCard.Name: Silent Fang
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Silent Fang Interrupt target ability card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: He who controls the silithyst controls Silithus.
Program.FullCard.Name: Silithus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
At the start of your turn, add capture counters equal to the combined cost of allies in your party.
, Remove 200 capture counters Gain control of all cards in play except heroes.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The glorious Silvermoon City has been home to the elven population of the Eastern Kingdoms for milennia." - Explorers' Guild Guide to the Eastern Kingdoms
Program.FullCard.Name: Silvermoon City
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Blood Elf Hero Required
As Silvermoon City enters play, choose arcane, fire, frost, nature, or shadow.
Target Blood Elf in your party has the chosen resistance this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Bal'a dash, malanore."
Program.FullCard.Name: Silvermoon Sentinels
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Silvermoon Sentinels enters play, it deals 1 holy damage to each hero for each ally named Silvermoon Sentinels in your party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You count Silvermoon Sentinels in your party as this effect resolves. Each one that enters play will usually deal at least 1 holy damage to each hero, because it counts itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What's wrong, bruddah? Joo not feelin' good?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sindo'zur the Toxifier
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally deals combat damage to a hero, you may put a Poison from your hand into play attached to that hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sindragosa, the Frost Queen
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
At the start of each turn, you may remove five cards in one graveyard from the game. If you do, this ally deals 5 frost damage to target hero or ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack or protect this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sindragossa, the Frost Queen
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scourge Hero Required
At the start of each turn, you may remove five cards in one graveyard from the game. If you do, this ally deals 5 frost damage to target hero or ally. A character dealt damage this way can't attack or protect this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Singing Crystal Axe
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Singing Crystal Axe enters play with four slow counters.
You pay 1 more to strike with Singing Crystal Axe for each slow counter.
When you strike with Singing Crystal Axe, remove a slow counter.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Pray for mercy!" - Kel'Thuzad
Program.FullCard.Name: Sinister Revenge
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero has Dual Wield.
When this weapon enters play, put X +1 ATK counters on it, where X is the ATK of another Melee weapon you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's all part of the plan." - Jonas White
Program.FullCard.Name: Sinister Set-up
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust up to two target heroes and/or allies. Each of them can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Is adds injury to insult.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sinister Strike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X melee damage to target hero or ally, where X is 1 plus the ATK of one of your Melee weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I hope you brought more friends."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sinthya Flabberghast
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Sinthya When Sinthya next deals combat damage to a hero or ally this turn, she also deals that much melee damage to a second target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Siphon Life
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Affliction Hero Required
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 2 shadow damage to attached character and heals 1 damage from itself for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The draenei's fatal flaw is their trusting nature."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sironas
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, the player with the most resources destroys one of them. If two or more players are tied, you choose which one destroys a resource.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The strength of the Argent Crusade lies in our unwavering faith in the Light and in each other."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sister Colleen Tulley
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation
This ally has Mend 1 for each Unique ally you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Pain is inevitable, but the suffering is optional."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sister of Pain
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
When Sister of Pain attacks, she deals 1 shadow damage to target opposing hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When it comes to the needs of Illidan's troops, Mother Shahraz knows best.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sister of Pleasure
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Protector
When Sister of Pleasure defends, she heals 1 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We must remember the debts we owe to those who came before us, and spread their knowledge to all who will listen."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sister Remba
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Flip Remba Target ally in your party with an attachment is elusive and untargetable this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sister Rot
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Sister Rot enters play, you may destroy target ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Give me your life. You weren't using it anyway."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sivandra Darklust
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Will of the Forsaken (This ally cant leave play unless it has fatal damage or 0 health.)
When Sivandra enters play, draw a card, then destroy an ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The grip of death starts from even the smallest injury."
Program.FullCard.Name: Skaala of the Somber Watch
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing heroes have "This hero has -1 ATK for each damage on it."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "He who fights and runs away lives to fight another day!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Skaduzzle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Escape Artist (When this ally becomes targeted by an opposing card or effect, you may put it into its owner's hand.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "RWARGH! Me smush you!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Skarr the Unbreakable
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Prevent all damage that Arena allies would deal to Skarr.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No living creature was spared from the horrors of the Plague.
Program.FullCard.Name: Skeletal Warhorse
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Undead Hero Required
You pay 1 less to complete quests.
When you place a resource face up, you may remove target card in a graveyard from the game. (Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Despite the years they spent in the internment camps of Lordaeron, the Horde never truly lost their will to fight.
Program.FullCard.Name: Skewer
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose an ally in your party. It deals melee damage equal to its ATK to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Skibi's Pendant
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Paladin, Rogue, Shaman, Warrior
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to strike with weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even the Scourge know the strength that lies within even the smallest scale of a dragonkin." - Arturius Hathrow
Program.FullCard.Name: Skinned Whelp Shoulders
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has Assault 2 for each Dragonkin you control

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The greatest warlocks of Azeroth have one thing in common: a lust for strength not their own.
Program.FullCard.Name: Skorn, Mistress of Shadow
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ally is dealt damage, Skorn deals that amount of shadow damage to target hero in that ally's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One man's skull is this orc's trophy.
Program.FullCard.Name: Skronk Skullseeker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Skronk has +3 ATK while attacking an exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Skull of Gul'dan, The
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 2 less the next time you pay a cost with X in it this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Skullflame Shield
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero defends, it deals 1 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I've sent in someone special to handle de peasants. She's de best dere is - supposedly." - Kuray'bin
Program.FullCard.Name: Skumm Bag'go
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Skumm enters play, you may turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Dis be too easy, bruddah."
Program.FullCard.Name: Skumm the Pillager
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 3, Flip Skumm Turn target resource face down.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our base, the Skybreaker, flies high above Icecrown." - Marshall Ivalius
Program.FullCard.Name: Skybreaker, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When a quest you control turns face down, add a cannonball counter.
On your turn: 1, , Remove two cannonball counters Your hero deals 4 ranged damage to target hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Skyfire Hawk-Bow
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with Skyfire Hawk-Bow, your hero has long-range this combat. (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Sky-Hunter Swift Boots
Program.FullCard.Rules: Untargetable

Program.FullCard.Name: Skymistress Taranna
Program.FullCard.Rules: When another Arcane ally enters your party, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Skywing
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a Bird ally token named Skywing with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health into play. At the start of your next turn, it has +3 ATK / +3 health and is an Arakkoa.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Warriors aren't really big on subtlety.
Program.FullCard.Name: Slam
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals X melee damage to target hero or ally, where X is 1 plus the ATK of one of your Melee weapons.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You can play Slam whether or not you have a Melee weapon. If you don’t have one, X is 1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Slash and Dash
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When Slash and Dash enters play, you may destroy target exhauste ally.
Your hero has stealth. (Can't protect against it.)
When your hero deals damage, destroy Slash and Dash.

Program.FullCard.Name: Slashdance
Program.FullCard.Rules: Each player may dance the way he imagines his hero would dance. If he does, he may turn his hero face up.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One by one the weary adventurers fell, their cries stifled by a gloved hand.
Program.FullCard.Name: Slaughter from the Shadows
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if your hero has stealth.
Destroy all exhausted allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Slay or Stay
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose one: Destroy target damaged ally; or attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally is a protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: If a rogue is present, it's never a fair fight.
Program.FullCard.Name: Slay the Feeble
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 3 melee damage to target exhausted hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: To the victor of Halaa go its spoils.
Program.FullCard.Name: Slayer's Waistguard
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 3 less to strike with weapons while your hero is defending.

Program.FullCard.Name: Slice and Dice
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play Slice and Dice, remove up to five Combo cards in your graveyard from the game.
Your hero deals X melee damage divided as you choose to any number of target heroes and/or allies, where X is the number of Combo cards you removed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A . . . little . . . help . . . here?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Slow
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Arcane Hero Required
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: Attached hero's controller can't play more than one card per turn. (This doesn't include placing resources.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] If a player has already played one or more cards this turn as this card attaches to his or her hero, that player can’t play any more cards this turn. Placing a resource is different from playing a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Smash
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target equipment. If you do, your hero deals melee damage to its controller's hero equal to its cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Smite
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 4 holy damage to target hero or ally. That damage can't be prevented.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Flame and cinders surrounded them, making it impossible to see. All Gorebelly could do was move toward the heat.
Program.FullCard.Name: Smoke and Ash
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may destroy target ability, ally, or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Smoke or Croak
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose one: Your hero deals 3 fire damage to target hero; or attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't attack or protect, loses and can't have powers, and is a Frog.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The flames were so hot that flesh and steel melted like they were butter. . ." - Tome of Fiery Arcana
Program.FullCard.Name: Smoldering Blast
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Destroy this ability Your hero deals 3 fire damage to target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Snake Trap
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Trap (You may exhaust your defending hero rather than pay this card's cost.)
Put X Snake ally tokens with 1 Nature ATK / 1 health into play, where X is target opposing attacker's cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "All must be sacrificed for the glory of the Horde!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Snarl Hellwind
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy an ally in your party other than Snarl Hellwind Snarl has +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You can't kill what you can't find.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sneak
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally has elusive this turn. (It can't be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Snig Feralsnout
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stealth (Can't protect against this character.)
Snig Feralsnout has ferocity while you control a Form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The first shot is always the most important." - Shaii
Program.FullCard.Name: Snipe
Program.FullCard.Rules: When the next ability, ally, or equipment enters play this turn, destroy it.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Any powers or modifiers that trigger off that card entering play will still trigger. That card can be exhausted or destroyed to pay a cost before it's destroyed. If Snipe is played in response to card A, but an applicable card B enters play after Snipe resolves but before card A does, Snipe will destroy card B.

Program.FullCard.Name: Solanian's Belongings
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose one: Put an ability card from your graveyard on top of your deck; or draw a card. If your hero is a Blood Elf, you may choose both.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Nothing's alive back behind us, right?" - Cryo-Engineer Sha'heen
Program.FullCard.Name: Someone Else's Hard Work Pays Off
Program.FullCard.Rules:
On your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a unique Ethereal ally token named Cryo-Engineer Sha'heen into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health and "At the start of your turn, remove this token from the game. If you do, gain control of target ability or equipment."

Program.FullCard.Name: Son of Flame
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
Son of Flame can't be dealt fire damage. When the last Son of Flame leaves play, if Ragnaros is Submerged, flip Ragnaros.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Few have heard the rumblings of Murmur and lived.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sonic Spear
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Sonic Spear to a hero, that hero's controller destroys one of his equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't be afraid to push yourself to your limits. I will take care of the rest." - Zaritha
Program.FullCard.Name: Soothing Wave
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 4 damage from each of up to two target heroes and/or allies.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Refresh this moment, for the Earthmother has given you her blessing."
Program.FullCard.Name: Soram Wildbark
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Mend 1
When this ally heals damage from a hero or ally, that character has Assault 1 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Ready or not.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sorga the Swift
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity (Can attack immediately.)
War Stomp (When this ally attack or defends, you may exhaust opposing hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are always lost souls who need direction."
Program.FullCard.Name: Soul Conductor, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: The Soul Conductor had +1 ATK / +1 health for each ally card in opposing removed from game zones.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There's always a cost for power - you just have to decide whether or not you can afford it." - Forang Deathrattle
Program.FullCard.Name: Soul Inversion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally has +2 ATK / -2 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Soul Link
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Demonology Hero Required
Ongoing: Put 1 damage on an ally in your party Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to your hero this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Soul of the Dead
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Youre hero has +1 [Health] for each soul counter.
[Death Knight] Hero: Opposing allies everywhere have "Death Rattle: Add a soul counter to this item."
[Priest] Hero: Opposing abilities everywhere have "Death Rattle: Add a soul counter to this item."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are things worse than death. Let me show you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Soul Rend
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target opponent puts an ally from his party into its owner's hand. If he does, that opponent discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Our assault on Northrend is quite pleasing. I yean to taste of the untold powers that await."
Program.FullCard.Name: Souldrinker Bogmara
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Warlock: Flip Bogmara Bogmara deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally and heals 1 damage from herself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You too will be consumed." - Harrigan Soulsunder
Program.FullCard.Name: Soul-Eater's Handwraps
Program.FullCard.Rules: When an ability, ally, equipment, or hero readies, its controller puts the top card of his deck into his graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Although I prefer the shadows, I have not turned my back on the Light."
Program.FullCard.Name: Soulseeker Huulo
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has Assault 1 while you control another hero or ally with Assault, and Mend 1 while you control another hero or ally with Mend.

Program.FullCard.Name: Soulshatter
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When your hero defends against an ally, that ally's controller exhausts all allies in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The shadows will grant you another life; try not to waste it this time." - Pidge Filthfinder
Program.FullCard.Name: Soulstone
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: When attached ally is destroyed, its owner may put it from his graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Soup for the Soul
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Soup for the Soul enters play exhausted.
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The main supply center to the Battle of Alterac, Southshore is often under siege by the Horde.
Program.FullCard.Name: Southshore
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 1, When target [Alliance] ally in your party next deals damage to an ally with lower cost this turn, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sow Destruction
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Sow Destruction enters play with a curse counter for each Blood in play.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, put a curse counter on Sow Destruction, and then Magtheridon deals fire damage equal to the number of curse counters to the opposing hero with the least damage. You settle ties.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sowing of Seeds, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 nature damage to target hero or ally. For each damage dealt this way, put a Treant ally token into play with 1 [Melee] ATK / 1 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Feel da power of da elements deep inside joo, bruddah, and give da world a taste." - Sepirion
Program.FullCard.Name: Spark
Program.FullCard.Rules: This turn, your hero has "Exhaust a card in play you control This hero deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have little patience, especially for the likes of you!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Sparkington the Abrupt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Mages and [Mage] cards in your hand are instant.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "May the spirits guide us to the unseen wisdom that was lost an eternity ago." - Grennan Stormspeaker
Program.FullCard.Name: Spaulders of Lost Secrets
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this armor enters play, you may put the bottom card of your deck into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "To see it with my own eyes . . . Marvelous!" - Ruby Gemsparkle
Program.FullCard.Name: Spectral Kitten
Program.FullCard.Rules: [Horde] allies you control have +1 ATK. [Alliance] allies you control have +1 [Health]. Non-[Horde], non-[Alliance] allies you control have +1 / +1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spectral Tiger
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Alliance: Elusive allies in your party have +1 health.
Horde: Allies with ferocity in your party have +1 ATK.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The spell was marked, "Return to sender."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spell Reflection
Program.FullCard.Rules:
You may exhaust one of your Shields rather than pay Spell Reflection's cost.
If an ability card is targeting only your hero, change its target to its controller's hero.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spell Ricochet
Program.FullCard.Rules: You may change the target of an ability card with a single target.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] An "ability card with a single target" is one that had a single target as it was added to the chain.
