As Spell Ricochet resolves, choose such a card on the chain, and you may change its target to any other legal target (reading that card's target description from its controller's perspective, so "opposing" continues to mean opposed to that player, and

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I hope you weren't relying on that to defeat me." - Spellweaver Jihan
Program.FullCard.Name: Spell Suppression
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ability, ally, equipment, or resource.
Ongoing: Attached card loses and can't have powers.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Only powers are lost. An attached ally can still attack, an attached weapon can still strike, an attached resource can still exhaust to pay resource costs, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spellbreaker's Buckler
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, , Discard an equipment card Interrupt target ability card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Rogues aren't the only thieves in Azeroth.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spellsteal
Program.FullCard.Rules: Gain control of target ability. If it's attached to a hero or ally, you may attach it to another hero or ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You can only target an ability in play. You gain control of it until it leaves play. If it’s not attached to a character, simply move it to your hero row. To attach an ability to another character, first detach it and then attach it to another character with one of the card types specified in that ability’s attach description. The rest of that ability’s attach description is ignored. Reattaching an ability in this way doesn’t add it to the chain, so its non-ongoing text is not reprocessed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Twice the power for half the price." - Varanis Bitterstar
Program.FullCard.Name: Spellstrike Hood
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program - requires 4 Primal Water, 4 Primal Fire, 4 Primal Earth, 4 Primal Mana, 4 Primal Air, 5 Spellcloth, 1 Primal Nether
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, When you next play a non-ongoing ability this turn, copy it. (You may choose new targets for the copy.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The tapestries of magic are at my fingertips."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spellweaver Jihan
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Jihan The next time Jihan would deal damage with an ability this turn, she deals that much +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Pry the treasure from their cold, lifeless fingers, lads!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Spelunker Maddocks
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Dwarf Hero Required
Find Treasure
Maddocks has +1 ATK / +1 health for each card in your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sphere of Divinity
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that attached ally would be dealt.
At the start of the turn, destroy Sphere of Divinity.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The blood of the fallen feeds the wielder of this great axe.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spinal Reaper
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals fatal combat damage with Spinal Reaper, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spinning Fate
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Thrown (When you strike with this weapon, your hero has long-range this combat. At the end of this turn, put this weapon into its owner's hand.)
When you strike with this weapon, put the top card of target opponent's deck into the graveyard. This weapon has Assault X this combat, where X is the cost of that card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Da light of day will always shine as long as we be faithful, bruddah." - Mojo Master Zandum
Program.FullCard.Name: Spire of Sunset
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 2, Exhaust your hero Your hero deals fire damage to target hero or ally equal to the number of different classes among heroes and allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "After the hunt, we rest here as one entity and together feel our strength return."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Bond
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Beast Mastery Hero Required
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, if you have a Pet, your hero heals 2 damage from itself and each of your Pets.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is not yet your time. I shall aid your journey back to the realm of the living."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Healer
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the end of each player's turn, that player may put an ally card from his graveyard into play with damage on it equal to its health minus 1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: How you die can say a lot about how you lived.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit of Redemption
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Holy Hero Required
You pay 1 less to play Spirit of Redemption for each damage on your hero.
Spirit of Redemption can't be destroyed while you control an ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Even deep within the Emerald Dream, Malfurion's spirit sensed Illidan's fall…and grieved.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit of Stormrage
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Untargetable
Search your deck for a card and put it into hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Watoosun was able to shed the stink of corruption, but in doing so, created a twisted spirit essence." - Elementalist Lo'ap
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Polluted, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Put 3 damage on your hero and pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You know about the totems more than any, and I be needin' a spirit totem to protect me." - Bath'rah the Windwatcher
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Ready target ally or weapon you control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Weapons
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Enhancement Hero Required
Ongoing: Target hero or ally has -X ATK this turn, where X is the combined ATK of your Melee weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "That's not the kind of healing I was hoping for." - Fillet
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirit Wrench
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if seven or more Bloods are in play.
Remove all damage from target opposing hero and put it on a second target hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Should we succeed in gaining the spirits' favor, they will grant us a boon that will aid in our endeavors." - Exorcist Sullivan
Program.FullCard.Name: Spirits of Auchindoun
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Turn one of your other face-up resources face down to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] You must also turn this quest face down to complete it as normal. If you turn another quest face down to complete this one, there's no way to simultaneously complete that other quest.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Strength comes from those for whom a paladin fights.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Attunement
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When another hero or ally heals damage from your hero, you may pay 1. If you do, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The elements are not yet ready to receive me. How unfortunate for you." - Earthmender Vaaki
Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Awakening
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, remove all but 14 damage from your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Treachery is a virus infecting even the dead.
Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Domination
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Put target ally card from an opponent's graveyard into play under your control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Harmony
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target ally from your graveyard into your hand. If you do, your hero heals damage from itself equal to that ally's cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Healing
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Holy Hero Required
Ongoing: When you play a Holy ability, your hero heals 2 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritual Return
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put target [Fire], [Frost], or [Nature] ally from your graveyard into play if its cost is less than or equal to the number of resources you control. That ally enters play with damage equal to its [Health] -1.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We all begin in darkness - some of us just never leave it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritualist Sunshroud
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 3, Flip Sunshroud Target player destroys an ally in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Da elements whisper in my ears, and dey remind me dat dere is more than one way to destroy da Scourge."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spiritwalker Kavi'je
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Kavi'je, discard a Shaman You pay 2 less to play your next Totem this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Splinter Mind
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: You control attached ally.
At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to attached ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have just the right antidote for the Scourge masses." - Tribemother Torra
Program.FullCard.Name: Split Greathammer
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero would deal combat damage to a hero with this weapon, it may deal that much divided as you choose among any number of opposing heroes and/or allies instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It's hard to fight when you are trying to keep your insides inside!" - Bulkas Wildhorn
Program.FullCard.Name: Split Open
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Attached character has -2 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The bigger they are, the harder they fall." - Magnus the Depriver
Program.FullCard.Name: Spoils of the Hunt
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy all opposing allies that have or share the highest cost among opposing allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Spread the Word
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Damage dealt by friendly heroes can't be prevented.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Sometimes you just have to get away from it all.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sprint
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Choose one: Ready your hero; or if your hero is defending, remove all attacking allies from combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "My tactics are not subtle, but they work."
Program.FullCard.Name: Spymaster Thalodien
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Scryer Reputation, Sabotage: Deck
When Thalodien sabotages a deck, reveal cards from the top until you reveal a non-quest card. Remove that card from the game and put the rest on the bottom. You may play that card without paying its play cost this turn. If it has X in its play cost, X is 0.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If they manage to make it through the storm, there are far worse things to come." - Shalu Stormshatter
Program.FullCard.Name: Squall Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When this ability enters play, exhaust all opposing heroes and allies.
When an opposing hero or ally attacks or protects, you may exhaust a second target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Watch out for falling allies!" - Ozzati
Program.FullCard.Name: Squish Together
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust twp target opposing allies. Each deals melee damage equal to its ATK to the other ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I would prefer a rogue's guess to a mage's certainty." - Master Mathias Shaw
Program.FullCard.Name: Stab in the Dark
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at target opponent's hand and choose an ally card. He discards that card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What?! She has two?!?!" - Crazy Igvand
Program.FullCard.Name: Stable Master
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: You can have an additional Pet.

Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of Dominance
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Staff of Dominance enters play exhausted.
X, , Destroy Staff of Dominance Gain control of target ally with cost X. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: An ancient weapon bestowed with the powers of an ancient evil.
Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of Sinister Claws
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, target random ally you control has Assault 2 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The weapon houses the strange magic of Akama himself.
Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of the Ashtongue Deathsworn
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Loyal Hero Required
Text that refers to the start of a turn refers to the end of that turn instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A great part of wisdom is learning from the mistakes of the past.
Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of the Ruins
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 1 less to play your next ability this turn for each card in your graveyard with the same name as that ability.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Some would say that my style is erratic, but they fail to see the truth behind it all." - Arktos
Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of Trickery
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust your hero, discard a card Ready or exhaust target card if it shares a type with the card you discarded.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Double, double, toil and trouble.
Program.FullCard.Name: Staff of Twin Worlds, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Other cards in play have their printed text a second time. (For example, if a card has the text, "Allies have +1 ATK," treat it as though it says that twice.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] “Text” refers only to text in a card’s text box. Most keywords don’t do anything extra while doubled, but berserking, cat form, diplomacy, inspire, and war stomp do. In general, doubling a payment power does nothing extra unless it can be used only once per [period], in which case the doubled power can also be used once per [period]. If two Staffs are in play, the second one does nothing (except double the printed text of the first), because all other cards in play already have their printed text a second time.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stained Shadowcraft Tunic
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Target hero or ally has Stealth this turn.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): Target hero or ally has Stealth this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stakethrower
Program.FullCard.Rules:
This equipment enters play with a stake counter.
Long-Range (When you strike with this weapon on your turn, defenders deal no combat damage to the attacker.)
Remove a stake counter This weapon has +3 ATK this combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Nothing inspires greatness more than standing alone between victory and defeat.
Program.FullCard.Name: Stalwart Protector
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your hero has protector.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stance Mastery
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Your hero has +1 ATK this combat.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you're venturing into the Burning Blade Ruins, I have a task for you. Take these Mag'har battle standards and place them at three distinct locations in the ogre compound." - Elkay'gan
Program.FullCard.Name: Standards and Practices
Program.FullCard.Rules:
While more allies are in an opponent's party than in your, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The very heavens echoed the druid's rage and opened up at his command.
Program.FullCard.Name: Starfire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 5 arcane damage to target hero or ally.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I said go that way, you big dummy."
Program.FullCard.Name: Starli
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally deals damage to an ally, you may remove target weapon from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: None can stand against the ancient power of the night sky.
Program.FullCard.Name: Starshot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 3 arcane damage to target ally.
Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] If the target is no longer legal as this card tries to resolve, you don’t draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stasis
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target equipment and exhaust it.
Ongoing: Attached equipment can't ready during its controller's ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I keep them well, and they in turn keep me well."
Program.FullCard.Name: Statia the Preserver
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Flip Statia Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target Totem this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Come worship Pugg!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Statue Generator
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When this item enters play, remove target ally from the game. If you do, add three marble counters, and that ally's owner puts it into play under his control when this item leaves play.
At the start of your turn, remove a marble counter. If none remain, destroy this item.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Let them come a bit closer. I've got quite the surprise waiting." - Triton the Sacrilegious
Program.FullCard.Name: Staunch Reprisal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has Protector.
When your hero protects, it may deal 2 melee damage to target attacker.

Program.FullCard.Name: Steady Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero may deal 1 ranged damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Tonight, I'll drink to your health - may it long be mine."
Program.FullCard.Name: Steal Essence
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 shadow damage to target hero or ally and heals 1 damage from itself for each damage dealt.

Program.FullCard.Name: Steal Steel
Program.FullCard.Rules:
As an additional cost to play this ability, remove up to five [Rogue] abilities in your graveyard from the game.
Search target opponent's deck for an equipment with cost less than or equal to the number of cards removed this way and put it into play under your control.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stealth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has stealth.
When your hero deals damage, destroy Stealth.
When Stealth is destroyed, you may pay (2). If you do, its owner puts it from his graveyard into his hand at end of turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Its combination of speed and power is nearly unmatched in ranged combat." - Feera Quickshot
Program.FullCard.Name: Steelhawk Crossbow
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with Steelhawk Crossbow, your hero has long-range this combat.
At the start of your turn, exhaust Steelhawk Crossbow unless you pay 1.

Program.FullCard.Name: Steelsmith Joseph Carroll
Program.FullCard.Rules: Steelsmith Joseph Carroll has +1 ATK and +1 health for each equipment you have.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stella Forgebane
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, you may destroy target exhausted equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stellaris

Program.FullCard.Flavor: All things end the same way, be it in rot or rust.

Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 3, Destroy another ally you control Destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Light does far more than just heal. . ." - Aleyah Dawnborn
Program.FullCard.Name: Stifling Decree
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ability or weapon.
Ongoing: Prevent all damage that would be dealt with attached card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "DARKSHIRE...I HUNGER!!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Stitches
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Stitches has +1 ATK and +1 health for each ally card in your graveyard.
When Stitches is dealt damage, remove that many ally cards in your graveyard from the game. Then, remove 1 damage from Stitches for each ally card you removed.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You have taken the elements for granted. Now, beg for their forgiveness."
Program.FullCard.Name: Stone Guard Rashun
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Tauren Hero Required
When an opposing ally enters play, exhaust it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stoneclaw Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:

When a hero or ally deals combat damage to Stoneclaw Totem, that character can't ready during its controller's next ready step.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stone does not bleed, tremble, sicken, or quaver."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Ever try to stab a rock?" - Ixamos the Redeemed
Program.FullCard.Name: Stoneskin Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Opposing allies have -1 ATK.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Out of nowhere, he was grabbed by stony talons and whisked away into the night sky … - Commander Falstaav

Scourge Hero Required
While this ally is ready, prevent all damage that would be dealt to it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: My people have been decimated by the Lich King. - Gymer

Pay 3 to complete this quest.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A single spark can give rise to a raging inferno.
Program.FullCard.Name: Stormfire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero deals 3 arcane damage to target hero or ally.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Eye of Command

When you play a card, add an honor counter. If there are six or more on Stormpike Insignia, destroy it.
When Stormpike Insignia is destroyed this way, your hero deals 5 frost damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Stormrage Cover
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, Draw a card, then discard a card.
When you play a Druid ability, ready Stormrage Cover.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you play a Druid ability, you may pay 1.
If you do, target ally has +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When you strike with it, you will feel as fast as lightning." - Ringleader Kuma

Death Rattle:
[Rogue] Hero: Exhaust target hero or ally.

When you play a card, you may pay 1. If you do, add a surge counter.
2, Exhaust your hero, remove all surge counters Your hero deals 1 frost damage to target hero or ally for each counter removed this way.

Attach to target opposing ability, ally, or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "With each death, we are forced to push ourselves harder."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sullivan Holmes

Summoner Channeler can attack only heroes and has +X ATK while attacking, where X is 1 plus the number of Warlocks that have left your party.
3, Put an Abyssal ally token with 6 ATK / 6 health into play. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Fury shatters what forges build.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Imbued with the power of the Light, its protection is something no foe will be able to withstand." - Sarina the Immaculate
Program.FullCard.Name: Sun-Emblazoned Chestplate

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Those unworthy of the Earth Mother's grace are burned by her touch.
Program.FullCard.Name: Sunfire

Your hero deals X arcane damage to target hero or ally, where X is the number of friendly heroes and allies.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The power of the Sunwell in the palm of your hand.

Sunfire Handwraps enters play with a +1 DEF counter for each friendly hero and ally.
, Remove a +1 DEF counter Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with Sunfury Bow of the Phoenix, your hero has long-range this combat. (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)
Your hero deals 1 ranged damage to target hero.

Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer cards in your deck.)

Program.FullCard.Rules: When Sun-Gilded Shouldercaps enters play, you may exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I have faith that you will return the favor another day."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sunguard Cersie

Protector
Once per turn: 1 Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target hero or ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Can I trust you to deliver this message safely and in confidence?" - Fleet Master Seahorn

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your death will come quickly, for all I need is a small opening in your defenses."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sunstalker Andora

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "But you…remind me of my younger days; ready to take on the world with a sword in one hand and a skillet in the other." - The Rokk

Super Hot Stew enters play exhausted.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: One part felweed, two parts dreaming glory - all part useful.

Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Destroy Super Mana Potion Draw four cards.

At the start of your turn, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If it's an ability card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You'll feel it before you see it.

As an additional cost to play, destroy all of your resources.
Your hero deals fire damage to target hero equal to the number of resources destroyed this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sura Lightningheart

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The essence of your soul is quite empowering." - Krog Deathfist
Program.FullCard.Name: Surge of Blood
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally. Weapons you control have Assault 2 this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Power over the elements is power over creation itself.
Program.FullCard.Name: Surge of Life
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 5 damage from target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There's no time to rest. It's going to take all we have to stop the Lich King." - Zaritha
Program.FullCard.Name: Surge of Life
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals 3 damage from target ally. You may ready that ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The elements always follow the path of least resistance.
Program.FullCard.Name: Surge of Lightning
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero deals 6 nature damage to target ally; or your hero deals 3, 2, and 1 nature damage to up to three target allies, respectively.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "First we crack the shell, then we crack the nuts inside!" - Timmo Shadestep
Program.FullCard.Name: Surgical Strikes
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: When a hero or ally in your party deals combat damage to a defending hero, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You need not always be hidden to get the upper hand in a fight." - The Assassin's Creed, Chapter 8

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Combat Hero Required

Combat damage dealt by your hero can't be prevented.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Even the smallest detail that you may think inconsequential could be useful for our purposes." - Altruis the Sufferer

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you control an ability, ally, or equipment, draw a card, or two cards if you control all three.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "A hunter worth his weight in arrows knows to be prepared when the hunt turns on him." - Morn Walks-the-Path
Program.FullCard.Name: Survival Instincts
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Survival Hero Required

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Go ahead…I'll wait."

Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ability, ally, or equipment.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, remove attached card from the game.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Druids understand the interdependence of all living things. When this delicate equilibrium is disrupted, the druid works to restore the balance.

Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one: Your hero heals all damage from target ally; or put target ally card from your graveyard into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sus'vayin
Program.FullCard.Rules: Sus'vayin has ferocity and long-range while more allies are in an opponent's party than in yours.

Program.FullCard.Name: Suvok Frozeneye

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Shaza-kie!!"

Program.FullCard.Rules: Play only if one or more Bloods are in play. Destroy target opposing ally, and its controller chooses a second raiding player. That player destroys one of his resources and chooses a third raiding player. That player discards a card.

Ongoing: When your hero deals combat damage with a Melee weapon to an ally, it also deals that much melee damage to each other hero and ally in that ally's party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: In war, second place is last place.
Program.FullCard.Name: Swift Assault
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally has +2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Now I want you to go back to my two dimwitted students and discipline them using this wand." - Instructor Antheol
Program.FullCard.Name: Swift Discipline

During your turn, pay 1 to complete this quest.

Dwarf Hero Required

When you place a resource face up, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.
Mounts can’t attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A vicious raptor for a vicious Troll - a match made in heaven.
Program.FullCard.Name: Swift Raptor
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Troll Hero Required
You pay 1 less to complete quests.
When you place a resource face up, your hero heals 2 damage from itself.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "If you thought that orcs were vicious, then you haven't seen anything yet." - Dralor
Program.FullCard.Name: Swift Timber Wolf
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Orc Hero Required
You pay 1 less to complete quests.
When you place a resource face up, your hero has Assault 2 this turn.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: That which darts gracefully through the glade may emerge bristling with tooth and claw.
Program.FullCard.Name: Swiftshift
Program.FullCard.Rules: Search you deck and/or graveyard for a Form card, reveal it, and put it into you hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The armor is flawless. Perhaps your weapon is not." - Graccus
Program.FullCard.Name: Swiftsteel Bracers
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (The Hunt for Ilidan) - requires 6 Primal Air, 14 Felsteel Bar, 2 Hardened Adamantite Bar, 4 Heart of Darkness
Program.FullCard.Rules: You pay 5 less to strike with weapons.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Maybe forming into a line wasn't such a good idea."
Program.FullCard.Name: Swipe
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: When Swipe enters play, your hero deals 1 melee damage to each of up to three target heroes and/or allies.
Your hero is in bear form. (Has protector. Destroy this card when you strike with a weapon or play a non-Feral ability.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It was foretold that, one day, heroes who could wield the sword might reveal themselves."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sword of a Thousand Truths
Program.FullCard.Notes: This card was included in a 2007 Apirl Fools Day article. The card is a reference to an episode of South Park called "Make Love Not Warcraft."
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Sword of a Thousand Truths to a hero, that hero's controller discards his hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Justice is served." - Aleyah Dawnborn
Program.FullCard.Name: Sword of Justice
Program.FullCard.Rules:
This weapon enters play with a +1 ATK counter for each card in your hand.
Remove a +1 ATK counter Exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Sword of Zeal
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Sword of Zeal, target player may ready that many of his resources.

Program.FullCard.Name: Swordsmith Hanso
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Your weapons have +3 ATK.
Opposing weapons have -3 ATK

Program.FullCard.Name: Syluri
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
, Destroy Syluri Destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We are the Forsaken. We will slaughter anyone who stands in our way."
Program.FullCard.Name: Sylvanas, Lady of Undercity
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this ally.)
When this ally deals fatal damage to a defending ally, you may put target [Horde] ally with cost less than or equal to that defending ally's cost from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I feel your pain." - Katianna the Shrouded
Program.FullCard.Name: Sympathy
Program.FullCard.Rules: If an ally you control would be dealt damage, 1 of it is dealt to your hero instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Lich King promised that more prey would eventually make their way to Northrend. How lucky for me."
Program.FullCard.Name: Syreian the Bonecarver
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Syreian, remove a Hunter in your graveyard from the game Ready target Pet.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "These will do quite nicely." - Kor'kron Wind Rider
Program.FullCard.Name: Tabards of the Illidari
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an ally is in your party, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Not yet…not yet…"
Program.FullCard.Name: Tahanu Brinkrunner
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Tahanu Put target ally card from your graveyard into hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Taheo Skyspeaker
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Taheo Choose one: Taheo deals 3 nature damage to target hero or ally; or Taheo heals 6 damage from target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Would-be dragonslayers quickly learn to avoid the tail.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tail Swipe
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ability, ally, or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Druids of the Fang are an aberration. They seek to remake the land to mirror their own twisted dreams." - Warden Stormclaw
Program.FullCard.Name: Tainted Earth
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: When an opponent completes a quest, your hero deals 3 nature damage to target hero in his party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Few corners of the lair are safe from Onyxia's fiery breath. Only the truly swift or truly lucky survive.
Program.FullCard.Name: Take Cover
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponents choose a player. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to heroes and allies in that player's party this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The end justifies the means of getting it there.
Program.FullCard.Name: Take the Shot
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals ranged damage to target hero or ally equal to 1 plus the ATK of one of your Ranged weapons.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] You can play this card even if you don’t have a Ranged weapon in play. If so, your hero deals 1 damage.

Program.FullCard.Name: Talasite Owl
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (The Hunt for Ilidan) - requires 12 Primal Mana, 6 Eternium Bar, 6 Talasite
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Hunter, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Jewelcrafting Hero Required
Put a hoot counter on Talasite Owl.
, Remove X hoot counters, destroy Talasite Owl Ready X of your resources.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Perhaps you've heard the praises of our missing hero?" - Highlord Tirion Fordring
Program.FullCard.Name: Tale of Valor, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top card of your deck and put it into your hand. Your hero heals damage from itself equal to that card's cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "He's missing out on a gloriously messy battle!" - Nalice
Program.FullCard.Name: Tales of Destruction
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Choose "ability," "ally," or "equipment," remove a card of that kind in your graveyard from the game, and pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed card of that kind into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Scabbard a little rusty?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Talian Bladebender
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opponent's can't strike with weapons.

Program.FullCard.Name: Talisman of Ephemeral Power
Program.FullCard.RequireClass: Druid, Mage, Paladin, Priest, Shaman, Warlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an ability, you may pay 1 and put Talisman of Ephemeral Power into its owner's hand. If you do and your hero would deal damage with that ability this turn, it deals that much damage +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Alliance's talent for tenacity resides within this charm.
Program.FullCard.Name: Talisman of the Alliance
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Destroy Talisman of the Alliance Destroy all abilities and equipment that have or share the lowest cost among abilities and equipment in play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] As either of these effects resolves, look at the pool of all abilities and equipment in play, find the lowest/highest cost in that pool, then destroy all cards in that pool with that cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Horde's aptitude for aggression seethes within this trinket.
Program.FullCard.Name: Talisman of the Horde
Program.FullCard.Rules: , Destroy Talisman of the Horde Destroy all abilities and equipment that have or share the highest cost among abilities and equipment in play.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] As either of these effects resolves, look at the pool of all abilities and equipment in play, find the lowest/highest cost in that pool, then destroy all cards in that pool with that cost.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Charles Worth, Proprietor
Program.FullCard.Name: Talismanic Textiles, Dalaran
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put X + 1 [Armor] counters on target Cloth armor you control, where X is the number of Tailoring heroes and allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There be no rest for da weary…even in da undeath."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tal'zin
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
When you strike with a weapon, you may ready Tal'zin.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "At least it's not Stranglevine!" - Gyro of the Ring
Program.FullCard.Name: Tanglevine
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally.
Ongoing: Attached ally can't ready during its controller's ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Little by little, we chip away at the Scourge ranks."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tani Bixtix
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, this ally may deal 1 nature damage to target Scourge hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tankatronic Goggles
Program.FullCard.Notes: Available as part of Crafting Redemption Program (Drums of War) - 6 Heavy Knothide Leather, 1 Primal Nether, 2 Khorium Power Core, 2 Hardened Adamantite Tube, 8 Felsteel Bar, 2 Talasite
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Engineering Hero Required
When Tankatronic Goggles enters play, look at target player's hand.
Your hero is a protector. Opposing allies lose and can't have elusive, stealth, and untargetable.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Alard Schmeid, Proprietor
Program.FullCard.Name: Tanks for Everything, Dalaran
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready up to X target Plate armor you control, where X is the number of Blacksmithing heroes and allies you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is said that Tanwa can hit a plainstrider without leaving Hunter Rise.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tanwa the Marksman
Program.FullCard.Rules: Long-Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Finally! I been waitin' for a challenge all day, mon."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tanzuri
Program.FullCard.Rules: This ally has Assault 2 while an opposing ally with cost 4 or more is in play. (+2 ATK on your turn.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Tarn Darkwalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Demons have ferocity. (They can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Located between a river and the main road to the Alterac Mountains, Tarren Mill is often under fire from the Alliance passersby.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tarren Mill
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 1, When target [Horde] ally in your party next deals damage to an ally with higher cost this turn, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tarwila Gladespring
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive (Can't be attacked.)
You pay 1 less to play your next card this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Lick your wounds, curs. I have you now!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Taste for Blood
Program.FullCard.Rules: Draw a card for each damaged opposing hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Name: Taste of Arcana, The
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally. If you targeted a hero, you may interrupt a card played by its controller unless he pays 1 for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Tell me if you want another dose, mon!" - Witch Doctor Koo'zar
Program.FullCard.Name: Taste of Divinity, A
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 unpreventable holy damage to target ally. If that ally doesn't have fatal damage, put A Taste of Divinity into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tattered Dreadmist Mantle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If this equipment would prevent magical damage, it prevents that much +3 instead.
Stash (As this enters your resource row, you may have it enter face up. Immediately turn it face down.): The next time target hero or ally would be dealt magical damage this turn, prevent it.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tatulla the Reclaimer
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Tatulla enters play, target player destroys an ability or equipment he controls.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Your mother was a furbolg and your father smells of elekk turd!" - Blaine Roberts
Program.FullCard.Name: Taunt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: Attached character must attack if able and can attack only your hero if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Leaving so soon?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Taunting Blows
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 melee damage to each opposing hero and ally. This turn, characters dealt damage this way must attack if able and can attack only your hero if able.

Program.FullCard.Name: Taz'dingo
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Taz'Dingo enters play, he deals 1 ranged damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You play wit da fire, mon, you gonna get da burn!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Ta'zo
Program.FullCard.Notes: UDE Card Preview, Gen Con 2006 Promo Card
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Ta'zo Ta'zo deals 3 fire damage to target hero or ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Teebu's Blazing Longsword
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2 Teebu's Blazing Longsword has +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The Earth Mother weeps at the devastation caused by the Sourge. I have no choice but to punish your transgressions."
Program.FullCard.Name: Teina Cloudstalker
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Druid: Flip Teina Teina has +1 ATK while attacking this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Telescopic Sharprifle
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1 When you strike with Telescopic Sharprifle this turn, your hero has long-range this turn. (Defenders deal no combat damage to it.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Telor Sunsurge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector (This ally may exhaust to become the defender when an opposing hero or ally attacks.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Prowling about the shadows isn't the exclusive territory of rogues. I make sure of that."
Program.FullCard.Name: Telrander
Program.FullCard.Rules:
3, Flip Telrander Ready Telrander.
Use only while he's in cat form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Though mechanical In design, its essence is pure magic.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tempest of Chaos
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, target a random opposing hero or ally. Put a chaos counter on Tempest of Chaos, and then your hero deals 1 fire damage to that character for each chaos counter.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] First identify the set of possible targets (for example, by excluding untargetable cards) and then randomly choose from that set. If the target is no longer legal as this effect tries to resolve, don't add a chaos counter.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tempest, Son-of-Storms
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Tempest enters play, ready a hero or ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Business…or pleasure?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Temple Concubine
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
If Temple Concubine would be dealt 3 or more damage, prevent it.

Program.FullCard.Artist: E. M. Gist E. M. Gist
Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Now you see them…now you don't" - Maginor Dumas
Program.FullCard.Name: Temporary Dissipation
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Remove all allies in your party from the game.
At the end of the next turn, put all cards removed this way into your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Heed the words of the Nether, its knowledge far surpasses any mortal understanding or reality."
Program.FullCard.Name: Teresa Voidheart
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that this ally would be dealt.)
2, Remove this ally from the game Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Terina Calin
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, if you control an equipment, you may destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Terokk's Quill
Program.FullCard.Rules: Terokk's Quill has +4 ATK while your hero is defending.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Clutching this staff and gripped by madness, Talon King Ikiss proclaimed himself Terokk reborn.
Program.FullCard.Name: Terokk's Shadowstaff
Program.FullCard.Rules: 2, Destroy Terokk's Shadowstaff Target opponent chooses an ally in his party, and you gain control of it. and you take control of that ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Without your help, I would have been stuck in here for all eternity." - Teron Gorefiend
Program.FullCard.Name: Teron Gorefiend, I Am…
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Untargetable
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The roar frightens away many before they even see what they're up against.
Program.FullCard.Name: Terrifying Presence
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Opposing allies enter play exhausted.
Exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Why waste enery on causing death when terror is just as effective?" - Andarius the Damned
Program.FullCard.Name: Terrifying Visage
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put each of up to two target opposing allies into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Terror Pit Girdle
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero is untargetable while an ally is in your party.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tesla
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Assault 2 (This ally has +2 ATK on your turn.)
Ferocity (This ally can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It does not matter what you believe sometimes. It is just important that you believe in something." - Dorn Plainstalker
Program.FullCard.Name: Test of Faith
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Discard your hand, then draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If you have no cards in hand as this completion effect resolves, you simply draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tewa Wildmane
Program.FullCard.Rules: Tewa Wildmane has +1 ATK and +1 health for each face-down resource you have.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I share da voodoo wit choo, mon, no charge."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tez Tez the Patchmonger
Program.FullCard.Rules: When Tez Tez enters play, target opposing ally has -3 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This will make a nice trophy to add to my collection."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thag "Big Bounty" Cragshot
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally enters play, he may deal 4 ranged damage to target ally with cost 4 or more.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Patience is key for a successful shot, but you must be quick to take it when the chance presents itself."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thaka Deadeye
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Thaka, discard a Hunter Ready up to two resources you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: You dare challenge the might of the vrykul in our homelands? By Valhalas, you will soon be nothing more than a mindless servant of undeath.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thane Ufrang the Mighty
Program.FullCard.Rules: Flip Ufrang, remove a Warrior in your graveyard from the game Target hero or ally has Protector this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The most powerful druids know their greatest strength lies in versatility.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thangal
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Thangal Ready Thangal. Use only while he's in bear form.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We will have our revenge!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Thassarian
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Once per turn: Turn a resource you control face down Target ally has -5 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take heart, for the Light does not heal the unworthy. Now, had you listened to me to begin with, friend…"
Program.FullCard.Name: Thatia Truthbringer
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Thatia Truthbringer Choose one: Thatia heals 4 damage from target hero or ally; or prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target hero or ally this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Take this kit and use the guts from their abominations to create one of your own, then command it to attack the enemy forces at the gate. - Thassarian
Program.FullCard.Name: That's Abominable!
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw two cards. Then, if you have three or more cards in your hand, discard two cards.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thick as Thieves
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Allies with Stealth in your party are elusive and untargetable

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I'm not like most guards."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thief Catcher Norun
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Aldor Reputation (Can't put Scryer card in your deck.)
Protector
Norun can also protect against attackers with stealth.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Yes. Let's end this."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thomas "Slash" Robinson
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove an ally card in your graveyard from the game Thomas has ferocity this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thorn in the Side
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero.
Ongoing: While attached hero can attack your hero, it can attack only your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We can learn much from the elder vine, which threatens with barbs the hand that would trim it back."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thorns
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: When attached character is dealt combat damage, it deals 1 nature damage to the source of that combat damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "None shall harm those beneath my shield!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Thoros the Savior
Program.FullCard.Rules: 4, Flip Thoros Thoros heals 2 damage from target hero or ally. Draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] You can target an undamaged character. You draw a card even if no damage is healed. However, if the target is no longer legal as this card tries to resolve, you don’t draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Be bathed in my power! Drink in my might! Battle for the glory of the Horde!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Thrall, Warchief of the Horde
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector, Frost Resistance
When this ally enters play, you may put target [Horde] card from your graveyard into your hand.
Other [Horde] allies you control have +2/+2.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thrandis the Venomous
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero defends, you may put two 1 [Nature] / 1 [Health] Snake ally tokens into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thrash
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Destroy Thrash Ready Onyxia.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thrash Blade
Program.FullCard.Rules: When your hero deals combat damage with Thrash Blade for the first time on each of your turns, ready Thrash Blade and your hero.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 9/6/2006] If your hero strikes with Thrash Blade, but all combat damage is prevented as that combat concludes, then yes, Thrash Blade's power doesn't trigger.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thrill of the Hunt
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Survival Hero Required
Destroy target ally. If you do, ready up to X of your resources, where X is that ally's cost.

Program.FullCard.Name: Through the Dark Portal
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 13 to complete this quest.
Reward: Remove your deck and graveyard from the game. Build a new ten-card deck using cards from your entire collection.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thud!
Program.FullCard.Rules: Exhaust target card in play. It can't ready during its controller's next ready step.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No one can hide from the hounds of Hakkar.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thulthun
Program.FullCard.Rules: Opposing allies lose and can't have elusive or stealth.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thunder Bluff
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Tauren Hero Required
Tauren in your party have +1 health.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thunder Clap
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 melee damage to each opposing hero and ally. A character dealt damage this way has -1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The fury of Thunderaan rages between the folded metal.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thunderfury, Blessed Blade of the Windseeker
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you strike with Thunderfury, choose up to five heroes and/or allies. Your hero deals 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1 nature damage to them, respectively.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] You can’t choose the same character twice. You can choose fewer than five characters. If you choose three, for example, your hero deals 5, 4, and 3 nature damage to them, respectively.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The Black Flame were among the first to gain the aid of the mighty hippogryphs in battle.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thunderhead Hippogryph
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Alliance: Thunderhead Hippogryph had elusive.
Horde: Thunderhead Hippogryph had ferocity

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Do you hear something?"
Program.FullCard.Name: Thundering Footsteps
Program.FullCard.Notes: March of the Legion Sneak Preview Promo
Program.FullCard.Rules: As an additional cost to play Thundering Footsteps, stomp your feet. Put a Mechanical ally token named Fel Reaver with 10 ATK / 10 health into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The helm will inspire even the greatest of cowards.
Program.FullCard.Name: Thundering Greathelm
Program.FullCard.Rules: When you play an ally, your weapons have +1 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thunderous Challenge
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 2 melee damage to each opposing hero and ally. A character dealt damage this way has -2 ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thunderstorm
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elemental Hero Required
Exhaust all opposing heroes and allies. Your hero deals 1 nature damage to each of them. Ready a resource for each character dealt damage this way.

Program.FullCard.Name: Thunderstrike Weapon
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target equipment you control.
Ongoing: When attached equipment exhausts, you may pay 1. If you do, your hero deals 1 nature damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We lost his life once in battle, but do not underestimate his ability to inspire others." - Bloody Mary
Program.FullCard.Name: Thurgood Steelwall
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Shadow Resistance (Prevent all shadow ([Shadow]) damage that this ally would be dealt.)
2, Discard a card Target hero or ally has Protector this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The dirty beasts have a three-tiered attack planned on the trolls and orcs of Durotar." - Lar Prowltusk
Program.FullCard.Name: Thwarting Kolkar Aggression
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose one: Target player turns one of his quests face down; or draw a card. If your hero is a Troll, you may choose both.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There will be no peace until all are embraced by the Twisting Nether."
Program.FullCard.Name: Thysta Spiritlasher
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of each player's turn, if no damage was dealt this turn, Thysta Spiritlasher deals 3 fire damage to that player's hero.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If a packet is completely prevented, it ceases to exist and so deals no damage.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Feel the wrath of the deep!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Tidal Burst
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Your hero deals 3 frost damage to target opposing ally and each other opposing ally with the same cost as that ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't think. Feel. There is more to battle than weapons clashing." - Prometha
Program.FullCard.Name: Tidal Infusion
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target ally or weapon you control.
Ongoing: When attached card exhausts, you may draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When the elements align, the result is overwhelming.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tidal Mastery
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: Exhaust four of your Totems Your hero deals 10 nature damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Joo can't reason with de beast, mon. Joo just got to put it down." - Sharpeye Yan'ja
Program.FullCard.Name: Tiger's Fury
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: 1 Your hero has an additional +1 ATK while attacking in cat form this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Hold on to your weapons tightly! If you drop something, we're not going looking for it."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tight Quarters
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tilly Fiddlelight
Program.FullCard.Rules: FRONT: 3 Flip Tilly. BACK: Each ally you control has Mend 1. (At the start of your turn, it may heal 1 damage from target hero or ally.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There are some who call me...Tim."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tim
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elusive
Tim deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Drive back the corrupted Deadwood tribe of Felwood and we may one day consider you an ally." - Grazle
Program.FullCard.Name: Timbermaw Ally
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Remove three ability cards in your graveyard from the game and pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Timeslicer
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has dual wield. (Can have a second one-handed Melee weapon instead of an Off-Hand equipment. Can strike with a second Melee weapon during the same combat.)
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Some Melee weapons have the power “Your hero has dual wield.” If you already have a Melee weapon, and your hero doesn’t have dual wield, you can play one of these weapons without causing a uniqueness violation.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: The ability to hide in half a shadow makes gnomes among Azeroth's deadliest assassins.
Program.FullCard.Name: Timmo Shadestep
Program.FullCard.Rules: 5, Flip Timmo Shadestep Destroy target exhausted ally. Use only on your turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tinker Art Seaclock
Program.FullCard.Rules: Art has long-range while he's undamaged. Defenders deal no combat damage to him.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This prototype will be worth a fortune! Assuming it passes the field test…"
Program.FullCard.Name: Tinker Bixy Blue
Program.FullCard.Rules: If Bixy is undamaged: Target player discards a card and you draw a card.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Damaging either Tinker in response to its activated effect doesn't interrupt or otherwise impact that effect. Damage is checked only as the power is used.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Take that! Err…shizbot! Hang on, I have to recalibrate the fire capacitor!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Tinker Burnfizzle
Program.FullCard.Rules: If Burnfizzle is undamaged: Burnfizzle deals 3 fire damage to each opposing hero and ally.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] Damaging either Tinker in response to its activated effect doesn't interrupt or otherwise impact that effect. Damage is checked only as the power is used.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This shield will stop anything…once."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tinker Casey Springlock
Program.FullCard.Rules: Case is a protector while she's undamaged.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you may put an equipment card from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tiny
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you place a resource face up, you pay 2 less to complete your next quest this turn.
(Mounts can't attack or be attacked.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Tiril Dawnrider
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ferocity
At the end of your turn, put Tiril Dawnrider into his owner's hand.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] This power triggers only if Tiril is in play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "And now I learn that it might be Arthas's own heart a thing containing the last bit of his remaining humanity." - Highlord Tirion Fording
Program.FullCard.Name: Tirion's Gambit
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Argent Crusade Reputation (You can't put cards with other reputations in your deck.)
Pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed Unique card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: If you can leave Karazhan, you will leave laden with power.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tirisfal Wand of Ascendancy
Program.FullCard.Rules: Remove an ability card in your graveyard from the game You pay 1 less the next time you strike with Tirisfal Wand of Ascendancy this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Titan-forged Rune of Cruelty
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, each hero deals melee damage to itself equal to the number of cards in its controller's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When the titans get a grip, they mean it.
Program.FullCard.Name: Titan's Grip
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: Your hero has Two-Handed dual weild.
Your hero had dual wield. One or both of your weapons can be Two-Handed. You can have a Two-Handed weapon and an Off-Hand equipment.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A good priest can make use of even the most unwilling subjects.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tithe
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ready target opposing ally. This turn, it's a protector and you control it.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Draenei have spent lifetimes in search of just one of these crystals, only to meet horrible fates, their purpose unfulfilled." - Kum'isha
Program.FullCard.Name: To Serve Kum'isha
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Put a revealed card with cost of 3 or more into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: By their very being, the draenei lend their inner strength to their allies.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tomadae the Magnificent
Program.FullCard.Rules: If your hero would deal damage with an ability, it deals that much damage +1 instead.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Keep moving or we'll freeze!" - Morn Walks-the-Path
Program.FullCard.Name: Tomb of Ice
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: At the end of each opponent's turn, destroy each ally in his party that neither attacked nor entered play this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tonks the Tenacious
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy Tonks Target hero or ally can't attack this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "So he couldn't find his way back on his own? Figures." -Torta
Program.FullCard.Name: Tooga's Quest
Program.FullCard.Rules:
During your turn, pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Put a unique Turtle ally token named Tooga with 1 ATK and 1 health into play. At the start of your next turn, remove Tooga from the game. If you do, draw two cards.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Jeff Donais 8/9/2006] When you complete a quest you turn it face down, whether it was successful or not. So you have only one shot to save Tooga, unless you have another copy of that Quest and play it later.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Uh-oh," Ta'zo said, "I tink we made her mad."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tooth and Claw
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Onyxia has +5 ATK while attacking.

Program.FullCard.Name: Topple
Program.FullCard.Rules: Destroy target ally attacking your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: I will do all that I can to remain a boon, not a burden.
Program.FullCard.Name: Torashu Stronghoof
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Mend 2 (At the start of your turn, this ally may heal 2 damage from target hero or ally.)
This ally has -1 ATK for each damage on him.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The perfect weapon against the Scourge; may it ignite a holy inferno that purges the land!" - Boris Brightbeard
Program.FullCard.Name: Torch of Holy Fire
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Exhaust your hero Reveal a random card from your hand. If it's a [Holy] card, your hero deals 2 unpreventable holy damage to target hero or ally and heals 2 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Name: Torch of Retribution, The
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 4 to complete this quest.
Reward: Target player shuffles his graveyard into his deck. Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "What do you say? Are you with us?" - Torek
Program.FullCard.Name: Torek's Assault
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an opposing hero was dealt damage this turn by an ally in your party, pay 1 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Sacrifice if necessary in battle."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tor'gor Darkfire
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Hardiness (If this ally would be dealt damage, prevent 1 of it.)
Destroy another ally in your party Tor'gor heals all damage from himself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "You dare approach me? The shadows will tear your flesh from your bones!" - Kaal Soulreaper
Program.FullCard.Name: Torment of Shadows
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Attach to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, your hero deals X shadow damage to attached character, where X is the cost of a non-hero Priest or Warlock you control.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "It is your suffering that I enjoy the most."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tormentor Emek
Program.FullCard.Rules: On your turn: 3, Discard a card Target player discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: By look it is as soft as silk, but by touch it is as hard as metal.
Program.FullCard.Name: Torn Web Wrapping
Program.FullCard.Rules: 1, Reveal a random face-down resource you control. If it's a location or quest, turn it face up. Otherwise, put it into its owner's hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When the walls begin to shake, so will your confidence.
Program.FullCard.Name: Toss About
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Play only if one or more Bloods are in play.
Each raiding player rolls a die. If one or more players roll odd, Magtheridon deals 1 melee damage to each of those players' heroes, and then all raiding players roll again.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tossed into the Hatchery
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put a whelp into play for each opposing ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Slowly, words start to form in your head. You think that the totem is telling you to go up the nearby hill, to the northeast."
Program.FullCard.Name: Totem of Coo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card, then draw another card for each other quest named Totem of Coo you have.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [FoO Rules FAQ] Totem of Coo is not a Totem. It counts only face-up quests in your resource row.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Life is attrition." - Ixamos the Corrupted
Program.FullCard.Name: Totem of Decay
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Traitor Hero Required
Ongoing: At the start of your turn, each opponent destroys an ability, ally, or equipment he controls.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Totem of Splintering
Program.FullCard.Rules:
1, , Destroy a Totem you control Your hero deals nature damage equal to that Totem's cost to target hero or ally.
When you play a Totem, ready this item.

Program.FullCard.Name: Totem of Wrath
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Elemental Hero Required
Ongoing: If an ally in your party would deal non-combat damage, it deals that much +2 instead.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: “Storm, earth, and fire, heed my call!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Totemic Call
Program.FullCard.Rules: Choose one or more: If you have an Air Totem, ready your hero and one of your Melee weapons; or if you have an Earth Totem, allies in your party have +1 ATK this turn; or if you have a Fire Totem, your hero deals 2 fire damage to target hero or ally; or if you have a Water Totem, draw two cards.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 4/16/2007] Totemic Call has been made modal to address some peculiarities caused by its single target. You now choose which mode(s) you're interested in as you play it, and must target a character only if you choose the fire mode.

Program.FullCard.Name: Totemic Focus
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play totems.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Strong tools make great craftsmen." - Ringleader Kuma
Program.FullCard.Name: Totemic Mastery
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: Your Totems have +3 health.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The elements will never abandon us." - Ixamos the Redeemed
Program.FullCard.Name: Totemic Recovery
Program.FullCard.Rules: Put an Air, Earth, Fire, and Water Totem from your graveyard into play.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It is only certain to bring destruction.
Program.FullCard.Name: Touch of Chaos
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When Touch of Chaos enters play, remove all ability cards in your graveyard from the game.
At the start of your turn, choose at random one of the ability cards you removed this way and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Even a brush with the shadow can teat a mind apart.
Program.FullCard.Name: Touch of Darkness
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. If a hero is dealt damage this way, its controller discards a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Touch of Ice
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 frost damage to target hero or ally. If a hero is dealt damage this way, the next time its controller would draw a card this turn, he skips drawing that card instead.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [MoL Rules FAQ] Multiple cards are drawn one at a time, so if a target hero’s controller would next draw three cards this turn, he or she draws two instead. If you target the same hero with two Touches of Ice on the same turn, and its controller would next draw three cards that turn, he or she draws one instead, and so on.

Program.FullCard.Name: Touch of the Arcane
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 arcane damage to target hero or ally. Draw a card for each damage dealt this way.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: There is no rest for the wicked until all are disposed of.
Program.FullCard.Name: Touch of Unlife
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, your hero deals 1 shadow damage to target hero or ally. If damage is dealt this way, your hero heals 1 damage from itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: A simple touch of holy Light to mend the wounds of a battered knight.
Program.FullCard.Name: Touched by Light
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Your hero heals 1 damage from target hero or ally.
Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Towers and bunkers are key defensive positions, and so we must hold as many as possible!" - Sergeant Durgen Stormpike
Program.FullCard.Name: Towers and Bunkers
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: If you control a location, draw a card. If you control a quest, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Towers of Eastern Plaguelands
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When an opposing ally is destroyed, add a capture counter.
, Remove four capture counters Each opposing hero deals 4 nature damage to itself.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I believe that the Deadwood furbolg may be gathering these elements from the elementals living in the Irontree Woods…" - Donova Snowden
Program.FullCard.Name: Toxic Horrors
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Choose up to two players. Each of them draws a card.

Program.FullCard.Name: Toz'jun
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ferocity (This ally can attack immediately.)

Program.FullCard.Name: Track Demons
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, look at the top card of your deck. Either put it in your hand and put 3 damage on your hero, or put it on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Name: Track Dragonkin
Program.FullCard.Rules: Target ally has -2 ATK this turn, or -4 ATK if it's a Dragonkin.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "There is nowhere to run and nowhere to hide." - Shaii, Strategist Supreme
Program.FullCard.Name: Track Hidden
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, you may have target opponent reveal the top card of his deck. If you do, you may have him put that card on the bottom of his deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Don't hunt what you can't kill."
Program.FullCard.Name: Track Humanoids
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: At the start of your turn, look at the top card of your deck. You may put it on the bottom of your deck.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: Tauren are none too fond of the cry "Bull's-eye!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Tracker Gallen
Program.FullCard.Rules: Tracker Gallen has +1 ATK for each ally in your party.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [Paul Ross 9/3/2006] Tracker Gallen does not gain +1 ATK from a totem.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tracker Pardo
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Long Range (Defenders deal no combat damage to this character.)
Pardo has +1 ATK for each other ally in your party.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Long live the Bilgewater Cartel!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Trade Prince Gallywix
Program.FullCard.Rules: Goblin allies you control have Time is Money and " Ready a resource you control."

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Anywhere you see a tribe of enslaved Broken, you will also find a traitor. A despicable being who sold his brothers for promises of power." - Naladu
Program.FullCard.Name: Traitor Among Us, A
Program.FullCard.Rules:
If an ally in your party was destroyed this turn, pay 2 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I will sacrifice whatever it takes."
Program.FullCard.Name: Trakas
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Destroy Trakas Destroy target ally or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Trample
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Onyxia has +2 ATK while attacking. When Onyxia attacks, you may exhaust target ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Wretched, meddling insects!" - Magtheridon
Program.FullCard.Name: Trample Underfoot
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Magtheridon deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally.
Ongoing: When Magtheridon becomes exhausted, he deals 2 melee damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "He seemed to look right through me. Yet I believe he was seeing more than I could fathom."
Program.FullCard.Name: Trance Stone
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the end of your turn, if you didn't place a resource this turn, draw a card.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Stay close, my friends, and I will heal your wounds." - Mythen of the Wild
Program.FullCard.Name: Tranquility
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero heals double X damage from each friendly hero and ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Because I know something you don't know…I am not left-handed."
Program.FullCard.Name: Transfigure
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Target weapon's ATK becomes equal to its strike cost this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [DoW Rules FAQ] This will overwrite any earlier-timestamped modifiers to that weapon’s ATK. Later modifiers can still change its ATK as normal.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Have a trap ready at all times, lad. Never let them get the jump on you." - Hemet Nessingwary
Program.FullCard.Name: Trapper's Rifle
Program.FullCard.Rules:
When you strike with this weapon, your hero has Long-Range this combat.
At the end of your turn, you may ready your hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: When it's time to run, four feet are better than two.
Program.FullCard.Name: Travel Form
Program.FullCard.Notes: From the Through the Dark Portal FAQ
Program.FullCard.Rules: Ongoing: Exhaust your hero You pay 1 less to complete your next quest this turn.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [TDP Rules FAQ] If you have some way to ready your hero, you can use this power, ready your hero, then use it again to pay 2 less to complete your next quest this turn, and so on. Costs can’t be reduced below 0.

Program.FullCard.Name: Traxel Emberklik
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Time is Money (This ally can use powers immediately.)
This ally deals 1 fire damage to target hero or ally.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "OK, everyone. Let's roll on this."
Program.FullCard.Name: Treasure Chest
Program.FullCard.Rules: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Put one into your hand and the rest on top of your deck in any order.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Here's a little something…you know, for the effort." - Great-father Winter
Program.FullCard.Name: Treats for Great-father Winter
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Pay 3 to complete this quest.
Reward: Draw a card. Then, you may discard a Gingerbread Cookie card. If you do, search your deck for a Feast of Winter Veil card, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tree of Life
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Restoration Hero Required
Ongoing: You pay 1 less to play Restoration abilities, to a minimum of 1.
If damage would be healed from a friendly hero or ally, that much damage +1 is healed instead.
When you play a non-Restoration ability, destroy Tree of Life.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We must save the trees, or soon all of Raven's Wood will be lost forever!"
Program.FullCard.Name: Treebole
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, each player chooses an ally in his party. Destroy all other allies.

Program.FullCard.Name: Treesong
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero has protector.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "The fury of the bear and the will of this druid will be the death of you."
Program.FullCard.Name: Treewarden Tolven
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Protector
Shadowmeld (Elusive and untargetable while ready.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "This land is not beyond cleansing."
Program.FullCard.Name: Treewatcher Kursha
Program.FullCard.Rules: When this ally readies, you may destroy target ability and/or equipment.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tremor Shock
Program.FullCard.Rules: Your hero deals 1 frost damage and 1 nature damage to target hero or ally. An ally dealt damage this way can't attack this turn. If a hero was dealt damage this way, you may interrupt an ability card played by its controller.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] This card deals 2 damage in two separate packets to one target. The modifiers that follow apply if either packet deals damage to an applicable target. You may interrupt an applicable card only if it's on the chain as this card resolves. You may interrupt only one such card, even if both packets deal damage to a hero.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: It shakes the ground with such force that all manner of spells lose their cohesion.
Program.FullCard.Name: Tremor Totem
Program.FullCard.Rules:
Ongoing: At the start of each turn, destroy any number of abilities attached to heroes and allies in your party.
(Totems can be attacked or targeted like allies.)

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "We are on a journey together with the spirits. We cannot stray from their path."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tribemother Torra
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Torra Target up to three heroes and/or allies. Torra heals 3, 2, and 1 damage from them, respectively.
Program.FullCard.Rulings: [BoG Rules FAQ] You can’t target the same character twice. Amounts are locked in as you target. For example, if you target two characters, your hero will heal 5 and 4 damage from them, respectively. If the character you targeted for 5 becomes illegal in response, your hero heals 4 damage from the remaining legal character.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "I can hear the agonizing screams of the spirits that are trapped within the walls of Naxxramas. We must ease their suffering and let them rest."
Program.FullCard.Name: Tribemother Torra
Program.FullCard.Rules: 3, Flip Torra Target up to three heroes and/or allies. Torra heals 3, 2, and 1 damage from them, respectively.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tricks of the Trade
Program.FullCard.Rules: Friendly heroes can't be targeted by opponents this turn.

Program.FullCard.Name: Tristan Rapidstrike
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Death is inevitable. I am simply speeding up the process."
Program.FullCard.Name: Triton the Sacrilegious
Program.FullCard.Rules: If you control another Death Knight: Flip Triton This turn, opposing heroes and allies must attach if able and can attack only Triton if able.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "Just remember to thank the little people once I've saved your life."
Program.FullCard.Name: Trixie Boltclunker
Program.FullCard.Rules: Protector

Program.FullCard.Name: Troggbane, Axe of the Frostborne King
Program.FullCard.Rules: X This equipment has +X ATK this turn.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: "When you find a flaw in your enemy's defenses, waste no time in exploiting the weakness."
Program.FullCard.Name: Trogun Smith
Program.FullCard.Rules: At the start of your turn, you may exhaust target armor.

Program.FullCard.Flavor: No prey is safe.
Program.FullCard.Name: Trophy Gatherer
Program.FullCard.Rules:
